title: Engineer
description:
Job Introduction

An exciting opportunity is available for a Connections Strategy Engineer, the location of the role can be flexible and will be agreed with the successful candidate although regular attendance at our offices in Bristol, Tipton and/or Castle Donington will be required. Reporting to the Head of Connections, you will be responsible for:

  • The formulation, development, maintenance, administration and review of Company Connection strategy and policy to meet Company objectives and satisfy Licence and regulatory requirements.
  • The development, review and improvement of Connections strategy, processes and tools to facilitate and enable a quicker and improved customer journey.
  • Manage, supervise and assist Connections Strategy Team Members
  • Contribution to the development, maintenance and review of other Company policy.
  • The development, maintenance and review of a suite of materials that can be used to disseminate policy changes and updates.
  • Provision of technical consultancy within the Company and to external stakeholders on Connections Strategy and specialism.
  • Maintaining up to date knowledge on NGED policy and specialism.

As part of our hybrid working approach this role offers a mix of office and home working. Hybrid working can only be considered once your initial training is complete and subject to business need.

The successful candidate may initially be appointed on a lower salary until all training/courses have been completed.

If you are offered a position, you will be required to successfully complete a basic DBS check that shows any unspent convictions or conditional cautions.

Main Responsibilities

In addition you may also be responsible for:

  • Management and supervision of Connections Strategy Team Members
  • Maintain and develop Connection Policy documents and packages, to include but not limited to: - Statements of Methodology and Charges, offer letters and guidance documents, CROWN terms and estimating/charging packages and Connection agreements.
  • Present/brief Connections strategy and policy matters to NGED teams and external stakeholders.
  • Support to Primary Network Design and Network Services in a technical consultancy role on specialism.
  • Provision of a support service to provide guidance and advice on policy applications and interpretations
  • Be aware of the work of colleagues in Connections Strategy Team to provide cover for their activities and specialisms.
  • Provide support to the Training Centre
  • Respond to external consultations related to specialism
  • Deliver results on time, to required quality standards and to budget, to fulfil the business plan and achieve/support company goals.
  • Participation in related Connections Strategy national groups/working groups/forums.
  • Maintain contact through activities of professional bodies/national and international committees and other professionals involved in similar work in other utilities
  • Organisation and membership of specialist panels.
  • Engage and support the business and external stakeholders in Connections Strategy and Policy
  • Coordinate and prepare responses to Ofgem Significant Code Reviews & other change proposals
  • Regulatory reporting/Annual reports.

Specialism: Connections Strategy & Policy

Responsible for: -

  • New Connections strategy and policy and associated Policy/ST documents
  • NC customers engagement and workshops
  • Internal training and support for PND and NWS Planners including support for centralised teams delivering connections activities.
  • Connection agreements and commercial agreements
  • Generation and energy storage application processes
  • Assessment & Design fees
  • Apportionment rules for reinforcement
  • Quotation Accuracy Scheme

Specialism: Connections Performance & Commercial/ Operational Strategy

Responsible for: -

  • Development and use of performance measures, systems and solutions to drive improved performance in connections activities.
  • Current and future CiCs/ICPs/IDNO strategy
  • CiCs/ICPs/IDNOs engagement and workshops
  • Current and future CiCs/ICPs/IDNO and associated Policy documents
  • Internal training and support for PND and NWS Planners including support for centralised teams delivering connections activities.
The Ideal Candidate

The successful candidate will be educated to at least HNC level with good engineering knowledge. Be able to demonstrate excellent communication skills along with the ability to provide training and advice in formal and informal groups in a range of different settings. Knowledge of connections strategy and policies within a regulated utility industry would be beneficial.

You will need to be able to travel as this role requires regular visits to other sites therefore holding a full and valid driving licence will also be beneficial.

About The Company

Joining the UK’s leading electricity distribution business means plenty of career opportunities and well-deserved recognition. We reward hard work and encourage ambition. So, as well as a competitive salary, you will also benefit from:

  • 26 days paid leave plus 8 bank holidays, up to 28 days with continuous service
  • Competitive contributory pension scheme (we double match your contributions up to a maximum of 12%)
  • Annual Share Save plan
  • Contributory private healthcare scheme for you and your family
  • Support via our Employee Assistance Programme, including musculoskeletal and physiotherapy services
  • Free on-site parking at all our main sites

Things you need to know

As an equal opportunities employer who is committed to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, we celebrate individual difference and are actively bringing in more employees from diverse backgrounds to build on our inclusive culture. We anonymise all applications in our recruitment system so we can eliminate unconscious bias and be a workplace that reflects the community we serve. Hiring managers only have access to necessary information at interview stage. If you require additional support to complete your online application, please email nged.recruitment@nationalgrid.co.uk

Recruitment correspondence is usually sent by email, please check your email account including spam/junk folders regularly after the closing date.

We reserve the right to close the vacancy early should sufficient numbers of suitable applications be received, so it would be best to apply as soon as you can.

About Us

We’re National Grid Electricity Distribution (NGED), the owner and operator behind the electricity distribution systems for the Midlands, the Southwest of England and South Wales. Serving communities of more than 8 million people, our expert teams deliver heat, light and power for homes and businesses.

National Grid employs over 29,000 people worldwide. We are building an inclusive workplace, a place to actively celebrate the cultures, personalities and preferences of our colleagues – who in turn help to build the success of our business and reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. Our vision is to be at the heart of a clean, fair and affordable energy future and we are doing this in a fast-moving industry with an increasing focus on tackling climate change, exploring new energy sources that are renewable, low carbon, and improve efficiency to meet demand.

NGED’s principle objective is to offer an excellent service to our customers and stakeholders. The Customer Excellence team plays a pivotal role in supporting the business to achieve this and is responsible for the Contact Centre, Connections and Connections Reform teams and the Customer Performance team.

All roles and objectives within the Customer Excellence directorate are aligned in that you’ll be actively involved in engaging with customers and stakeholders and across the NGED business with the key objective of improving and enhancing the service that we provide for customers; whether that be in operational support roles in the Contact Centre through to business support and analytical roles in our Connections, Connections Reform & Customer Performance teams.

In ED2, our success will be judged by our connections service from enabling LCT connections at domestic properties through to connecting new houses and EV charge points through to connecting large demand and generation projects to our EHV and 132kV networks. The Connections teams plays a pivotal role in supporting the business to achieve this. The Connections team is responsible for ensuring that we have the correct connection policies and strategies to enable connections now and in the future, that we’re achieving our connections commercial objectives, that we’re strategically engaging with, and improving our service for, customers and stakeholders throughout the connections journey life cycle and that we are digitalising our connections processes to enhance our service to customers whilst improving our business efficiency.

title: Commissioning Engineer
description:
Req ID:446045


Site: Derby / UK Flexible


Appointment Basis: Permanent


Excellent Salary + Benefits- Pension, Life Assurance, Contributed Healthcare plus may more


At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, more than 80000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.


Could you be the full-time Test and Commissioning Engineer in we’re looking for?


Your future role
Take on a new challenge and apply your systematic analytical expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You’ll report to a Test & Commissioning Leader and work alongside energetic and dynamic teammates.
You'll be involved in preparing and executing test and commissioning activities for signalling systems in the field, in support of one or several projects. Testing will be performed on trackside & onboard systems. Including Smartlock, Atlas & ETCS technology in the UK and overseas.
Day-to-day, you’ll work closely with teams across the business including working with Verification and Validation teams.



You’ll specifically responsible for preparing to deliver test & commissioning activities and executing test activities in the field.



We’ll look to you for:
  • Providing resilience, with and analytical way of thinking
  • Ensuring customer satisfaction
  • Delivering communications in an open and clear manner
  • To adhere to Alstom’s EHS and AZDP rules

All about you
We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:
  • Experience or understanding of railway signalling systems
  • IRSE licensed tester or engineering manager
  • Valid PTS
  • IOSH - desirable
  • Knowledge of onboard systems
  • Familiarity with non-Network Rail organisations
  • Knowledge of contract conditions
  • Commercial awareness

On a more personal level, you will also need to be:
  • Self-motivated with a desire to learn
  • Able to work independently
  • A strong team player, with effective interpersonal skills
  • Mobile and willing to work away from home

Things you’ll enjoy
Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:
  • Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
  • Work with new security standards for rail signalling
  • Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
  • Contribute to innovative projects
  • Utilise our style of working environment
  • Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
  • Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
  • Progress towards Test & Commission Leader
  • Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive benefits (pension, life ins., medical, + anything specific to the site e.g. free on-site parking, canteen etc).

You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!


Important to note
As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 70+ countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.
At Alstom we will consider requests for flexible working on hiring. Many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, flexible start and finish times, job sharing, or compressed hours. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you need.
Alstom U.K. is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. We aim to have a welcoming and inclusive environment for individuals, of different ages, genders, ethnicities, disability, LGBT, religion and/or belief.
As a 'Disability Confident' employer, we will interview all disabled job applicants who match the essential criteria of the job description or specification: if you require any reasonable adjustments, please let us know.



Job Segment: Testing, Technology

title: Highway Engineer
description:
Highways Project Engineer

Working Pattern: 37 hrs per week - Monday to Friday

Location: West Bridgford, Nottingham (Hybrid working)

Via is currently looking for two Project Engineer to join our Major Projects & Improvements Team based 3 days a week at our Trent Bridge House Office in West Bridgford (Hybrid working).

You will help to deliver civil engineering projects and provide specialist engineering services which enhance and maintain the road network and meet company business plan objectives.

The Job

Key areas of responsibility will include: -

  • Design and manage the delivery of highway and civil engineering projects to achieve quality, programme and financial targets
  • Provide specialist design, technical and cost advice to colleagues, clients or external bodies to support delivery of complex and large-scale projects
  • Manage the evaluation and authorisation of externally designed engineering schemes on behalf of internal and external clients
  • Collaborate with Via’s Construction and Commercial Division to manage workflow
  • Ensure adherence to Health and Safety management systems, processes and requirements ensuring full compliance to health, safety and environmental legislation, policy
  • Manage consultation, communication and liaison with clients and a wide range of internal and external stakeholders
  • Act as an ambassador for individual schemes and the Company

The Person

Mainly you will be excited to be a vital part of our Major Projects & Improvements Team, but there are just a few other things we’d like from you: -

  • Degree in Civil Engineering or a related subject and relevant experience or knowledge gained through practical experience
  • Strong ICT skills including competence in specialist computer applications used to support highway design and civil engineering activities
  • Working knowledge of current highway design and civil engineering standards, contracts, and procedures.
  • Working knowledge of health and safety, technical, traffic management and other legislation and good practice
  • Experience of providing information, communicating and working collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders
  • Experience of managing project budgets and financial reporting of project programme.
  • Experience of all stages of project implementation from feasibility to construction on site
  • A high level of personal drive and commitment to excellent customer care and the ability to set an example to other staff.

About Via

Based in Nottinghamshire, with a multi-skilled local workforce and a range of highly trained staff at a few different locations throughout the county. Via East Midlands provides sustainable highways services for Nottinghamshire and across the wider East Midlands region.

Our roles include highway maintenance, electrical works, mechanics, construction, forestry, road safety, civil engineering and much more. We combine a public-sector service ethos with a strong commercial focus, and we are passionate about innovation and creating and delivering sustainable solutions safely across Nottinghamshire and the wider East Midlands.

Via is a great place to work if you value work-life balance and we are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer a range of family friendly and inclusive employment policies, including generous annual leave allowances, with flexible working available to our office-based staff. With most of our work being based in the East Midlands, our front-line staff also enjoy short journeys to site each working day.

By joining us you will be part of a growing organisation that positively embraces customer and community aspirations.

If this sounds like you, it would be great to hear from you.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £33,000.00-£38,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Additional leave
  • Casual dress
  • Company pension
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Employee discount
  • Enhanced maternity leave
  • Enhanced paternity leave
  • Free flu jabs
  • Free parking
  • Health & wellbeing programme
  • On-site parking
  • Sick pay

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Flexitime
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

Application question(s):

  • Please indicate your salary expectations

Licence/Certification:

  • Full UK Drivers Licence (preferred)

Work authorisation:

  • United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Project Engineer
description:
Senior Project Engineer

Working Pattern: 37 hrs per week - Monday to Friday

Location: West Bridgford, Nottingham (Hybrid working)

Via is currently looking for a Senior Project Engineer to join our Major Projects & improvements Team based 3 days a week at our Trent Bridge House Office in West Bridgford. (Hybrid working)

You will design and deliver highway and civil engineering schemes, providing specialist technical knowledge support on and input into all schemes in Via’s Design Consultancy portfolio of work to meet company business plan objectives.

The Job

Key areas of responsibility will include: -

  • Lead design and deliver highway and civil engineering projects ranging in value and complexity including highway geometric alignment, pavement, and drainage design, specification and contract documentation
  • Provide specialist design, technical and cost advice to colleagues, clients or external bodies to include checking and approval to relevant standards to support delivery of complex and large-scale projects
  • Manage the evaluation and authorisation of externally designed engineering schemes on behalf of internal and external clients to ensure highway network asset meets regional and national design specification and safety standards.
  • Collaborate with Via’s Construction and Commercial Division to manage workflow there by achieving company business plan objectives
  • Ensure adherence to Health and Safety management systems, processes and requirements ensuring full compliance to health, safety and environmental legislation and policy; to act as Principal Designer on low complexity highway and civil engineering projects, to comply with the Construction Design and Management (CDM) Regulations.
  • Coach and mentor developing technical expertise of team members to assist with achieving individual performance targets and future potential.
  • Manage consultation, communication and liaison with clients and a wide range of internal and external stakeholders
  • Act as an ambassador for individual schemes and the Company across professional, business and community events and networks

The Person

Mainly you will be excited to be a vital part of our Major Projects & Improvements Team, but there are just a few other things we’d like from you: -

  • Degree in Civil Engineering or a related subject and post qualification relevant experience or equivalent knowledge gained through practical experience in a highway and/or civil engineering design environment.
  • Chartered or Incorporated Engineer or Engineering Technician and Member of a Professional Institution (relevant discipline) or working towards with a development plan to gain chartership or equivalent skills, knowledge and experience demonstrated by CDP record
  • Strong ICT skills including competence in specialist computer applications used to support highway design and civil engineering activities
  • Extensive working knowledge of current highway design and civil engineering standards, contracts, and current Construction Design Management (CDM) Regulations.
  • Extensive working knowledge of health and safety, technical, traffic management and other legislation and good practice appropriate to highway and civil engineering construction and maintenance activities.
  • Experience of providing information, communicating and working collaboratively with internal and external customers, stakeholders and colleagues to achieve delivery objectives.
  • Experience of managing project budgets and financial reporting of project programme.
  • Experience of all stages of project implementation from feasibility to construction on site.
  • A high level of personal drive and commitment to excellent customer care and the ability to set an example to other staff.

About Via

Based in Nottinghamshire, with a multi-skilled local workforce and a range of highly trained staff at a few different locations throughout the county. Via East Midlands provides sustainable highways services for Nottinghamshire and across the wider East Midlands region.

Our roles include highway maintenance, electrical works, mechanics, construction, forestry, road safety, civil engineering and much more. We combine a public-sector service ethos with a strong commercial focus, and we are passionate about innovation and creating and delivering sustainable solutions safely across Nottinghamshire and the wider East Midlands.

Via is a great place to work if you value work-life balance and we are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer a range of family friendly and inclusive employment policies, including generous annual leave allowances, with flexible working available to our office-based staff. With most of our work being based in the East Midlands, our front-line staff also enjoy short journeys to site each working day.

By joining us you will be part of a growing organisation that positively embraces customer and community aspirations.

If this sounds like you, it would be great to hear from you.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £38,000.00-£45,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • On-site parking
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Flexitime
  • Monday to Friday

title: Senior System Engineer
description:
Senior Systems Engineer (VMware, SQL, Microsoft Server Family, IIS, WAN Technologies)

£45,000 - £55,000 + car allowance + shift allowance + benefits

This is a hybrid role which will require office visits to Rugby 1-2 times a week

On Call (once a month / shift allowance payable)

Occasional travel to client sites

You will need to be eligible for SC clearance (NPPV3) and resided in the UK for a minimum of 3 years

Who are the Company

Our client are a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, they create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Produce outline system designs and specifications, and overall architectures, typologies, configuration data-bases and design documentation of networks and networking technology within the clients’ hosted services. Specify user/system interfaces, including validation and error correction procedure, processing rules, access, security and audit controls. Assess associated risks, and specify recovery routines and contingency procedures. Translate logical designs into physical designs
  • Undertake routine installations and de-installations of items of hardware and/or software. Take action to ensure targets are met within established safety and quality procedures, including, where appropriate, handover to the client. Conduct tests of hardware and/or software using supplied test procedures and diagnostic tools. Correct malfunctions, calling on other experienced colleagues and external resources if required. Document details of all hardware/software items that have been installed and removed
  • Initiate and monitor actions to investigate and resolve problems in systems and services. Assist with the implementation of agreed remedies and preventative measures.
  • Specify user/system interfaces, and translate logical designs into physical designs taking account of target environment, performance requirements and existing systems. Produce detailed designs and documents all work using required standards, methods and tools, including prototyping tools where appropriate.

You will need to have:

  • Fundamental Knowledge of System Level Design
  • Fundamental Knowledge of Microsoft Server Family including core servers, High availability always on clustering, IIS (web hosting), Application Request Routing, files shares.
  • Fundamental Knowledge of network principles, WAN technologies, routing and Global Load balancing.
  • Fundamental Knowledge of Microsoft SQL
  • Experience with SIP technologies including WebRTC.
  • Experience with/architecting or supporting Azure
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong business/customer facing experience ​
  • Experience/ Desirable with REST API interfaces
  • Experience/ Desirable with Checkpoint Firewall Technologies
  • Must be able to attain SC clearance

What you will get:

In return for your hard work you will be rewarded with:

  • Competitive salary and bonus schemes.
  • Two weeks additional pay per year (holiday bonus).
  • 25 days holiday entitlement + bank holidays.
  • Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
  • Employee stock purchase plan.
  • Flexible working options.
  • Private medical care.
  • Life assurance.
  • Enhanced maternity and paternity pay.
  • Career development support and wide ranging learning opportunities.
  • Employee health and wellbeing support EAP, wellbeing guidance etc.
  • Carbon neutral initiatives/goals.
  • Corporate social responsibility initiatives including support for volunteering days.
  • Well known companies discount scheme.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £45,000.00-£55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Employee discount
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Enhanced maternity leave
  • Enhanced paternity leave
  • On-site parking
  • Sick pay
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme

Application question(s):

  • Have you resided in the UK for a minimum of 3 years?

Experience:

  • System Level Design: 4 years (required)

Work authorisation:

  • United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Rugby

Reference ID: SD/SSE

title: Test Manager
description:
Pontoon is an employment consultancy. We put expertise, energy, and enthusiasm into improving everyone's chance of being part of the workplace. We respect and appreciate people of all ethnicities, generations, religious beliefs, sexual orientations, gender identities, and more. We do this by showcasing their talents, skills, and unique experience in an inclusive environment that helps them thrive.
A fantastic new opportunity has become available for Test Manager - Network Separation & Infrastructure Modernization with one of our Utility Services clients.
Role: Test Manager - Network Separation & Infrastructure Modernization
Location: Warwick (once a week onsite)
Duration: 6 Months
Status: Inside IR35
Networks Test Manager passionate about overseeing network separation, driving infrastructure modernization.

Experience and Skills required:
  • Proven experience in test management of network separation and infrastructure modernization projects.
  • Demonstrated ability in multi-vendor management, ensuring compliance with contractual obligations.
  • Strong understanding of network infrastructure
  • Ability to lead a team, prioritize tasks, and drive results effectively.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Experience within gas industry or utility services in essential
Responsibilities:
  • Manage and oversee the network separation process as part of a significant divestment.
  • Lead the multi-year project to modernize and refresh critical infrastructure.
  • Coordinate and ensure adherence to contractual obligations across multiple significant delivery vendors.
  • Develop and implement effective test strategies to ensure the highest quality standards are met.
  • Identify and mitigate risks related to network separation and infrastructure modernization.
Candidates will ideally show evidence of the above in their CV to be considered.

Please be advised if you haven't heard from us within 48 hours then unfortunately your application has not been successful on this occasion, we may however keep your details on file for any suitable future vacancies and contact you accordingly.

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
Marble Talent Group is currently recruiting for an Electrical Engineer/Electrician for our client in the Melbourne area!

For this role, we are seeking an electrically minded professional to help maintain and service fixed and mobile plant on a fixed site in the area. We are looking for engineers with a strong electrical background, experienced in diagnosing, repairing, and completing PPM work on various plant machinery.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with the maintenance team to conduct planned and preventative maintenance on plant machinery.
  • Diagnose faults with machinery and carry out repairs to maintain site functionality.
  • Continuously support and improve the electrical maintenance regime.
  • Ensure systems stay compliant with electrical requirements.
  • Assist with the replacement and installation of new plant machinery on-site.

Candidate Requirements:

  • 18th Edition Wiring Regulation.
  • Knowledge of working on a range of plant/manufacturing machinery.
  • Good understanding of electrical maintenance methods & techniques.
  • Knowledge & experience of medium/high voltage networks.
  • Good health & safety knowledge of regulations.
  • Computer literate.
  • Full UK driving license.

Benefits:

  • Life assurance.
  • High street discounts.
  • 25 days holiday + 8 bank holidays.
  • 1 fully paid volunteering day.
  • Company pension.
  • Medical cashback plans.

Contract:

  • 48 hours, Monday to Friday.
  • OTE immediately available.

For more information, please apply today, and we will be in touch!

title: Mechanical Designer
description:
Job number: SP05447
Profession: Engineering Design
Location: Sellafield or Risley
Contract type: Permanent contract
Salary: £53,346 – £66,034
Posting date: 22/01/2024
Closing date: 18/02/2024
Join Our Mission
Starting salary: £53,346 – £66,034, with the opportunity to develop and earn more within the role
Working Pattern: Days (37.5 hours per week)
Location: Risley or West Cumbria (hybrid working)
Sellafield Ltd is a global centre for nuclear engineering management, and the Sellafield site is one of the most iconic nuclear sites in the world. We pioneered the harnessing of nuclear power to generate electricity for the country for nearly half a century, and the environment now sits at the heart of our purpose. With 100 years of work ahead of us, we are yet again at the forefront of developing innovative solutions, through setting international standards in high hazard nuclear waste management.
Our work is complex, and we will be facing as-yet-unanswered questions and finding definitive and sector-defining answers to complex technical problems. Transforming the Sellafield site, and leaving a safe, secure, environmentally sound space for future generations will be a triumph of ingenuity and engineering.

What will the Successful Candidate be Doing:
We have multiple opportunities for Mechanical Design Engineers to join us, delivering packages of work as part of a specialist Engineering Design team. These roles offer Engineers the opportunity to lead and coordinate the definition, implementation, and delivery of (or direct delivery of) safe, legally compliant, pragmatic, fit for purpose Mechanical Engineering design solutions that meet functional, safety and business requirements.
The work is diverse, no problem is ever the same, and every project offers a wide variety of technical challenges. This Design Engineering team work across full project lifecycles on a variety of different projects, covering anything from operational plant, to decommissioning of existing plant, through to new build project work. At Sellafield, we are dealing with uncertainties, challenging technical problems, whilst operating within a complex and highly regulated environment. If you have a love for engineering, innovation and design, then this is the role for you!

What’s in it for you?
At Sellafield Ltd, we are committed to supporting our employees in fulfilling their potential. With having 100 years of work in front of us, we offer comprehensive training and development opportunities, enabling you to feel inspired in your role. Whatever area you join us in, you’ll find a genuinely exciting and rewarding career.
Making sure our employees feel supported is important to us. Therefore, to help you get the most out of life in and outside of work, we also offer a range of employee benefits:
  • An attractive defined contribution pension scheme – the company will match up to 13.5% for a 7% employee contribution!
  • You will benefit from an annual bonus of up to £4k made up of company and personal performance.
  • 25.5 days annual leave, plus 8 bank holidays. Rising to 30 days annual leave from 1st April 2024. There is also the ability to purchase 3 additional days.
  • The ability to carry over 5 days (rising to 10 from 1st April 2024) annual leave each financial year.

The Ideal Candidate:
  • Professional Registration (minimum IEng level) with a relevant institute (i.e. IMechE, IET).
  • Previous experience taking technical responsibility for the design of complex, fit-for-purpose engineering solutions.
  • Knowledge of engineering standards and experience of applying these appropriately on projects/tasks within any of the following disciplines: Mechanical Handling; Cranes; Pressure Vessels; Nuclear Ventilation; Building Service; Alpha Design; Nuclear Packages; Structural Integrity and Manufacturing methods.

Skills considered to be highly desirable:

  • Experience of leading change and / or improvement programmes amongst engineering teams with demonstrable results.
  • Experience of the Autodesk Software Suite (Inventor, CAD, Plant 3d etc).

Responsibilities
  • Delivering innovative products and services in a highly regulated environment.
  • Taking technical responsibility for the design of complex, fit-for-purpose engineering systems and ultimate ownership of the solution.
  • Producing deliverables to time, cost and quality requirements.
  • Working collaboratively with the supply chain to deliver successful projects and/or work packages.
  • Coaching and developing others to ensure the achieving challenging goals.
  • Using theoretical knowledge to solve problems in new technologies.
  • Applying an understanding of other engineering disciplines within the delivery of the project.
  • Applying governing laws, key regulations and standards for the nuclear industry appropriately on projects.

title: Senior Design Engineer
description:
Job number: SP04852
Profession: Engineering Design
Location: Sellafield or Risley
Contract type: Permanent contract
Salary: £53,346 – £66,034
Posting date: 07/02/2024
Closing date: 03/03/2024
Join our Team
Salary: £53,346 – £66,034
Location: Warrington or West Cumbria, Hybrid

Join Our Mission
The Sellafield site is one of the most iconic nuclear sites in the world and the birthplace of the UK’s nuclear industry. We have supported national defence, generated electricity for nearly half a century, and the environment now sits at the heart of our purpose. With 100 years of work ahead of us, we are yet again at the forefront of developing innovative solutions, through setting international standards in high hazard nuclear waste management.
Come join and contribute to Sellafield’s exciting new era in leading the way in creating a clean and safe environment for future generations.

What will the successful candidate be doing?
The successful candidate will be joining an experienced team in supporting the full portfolio of work on the SL estate, leading and coordinating the definition, implementation and delivery EC&I engineering design solutions that meet functional and business requirements.
Sellafield can provide Engineers with opportunities to work in roles across the entire design scope – from studies work to define future projects, conceptual design, detailed design and supporting projects and facilities in construction, commissioning and operation. Specialist design roles to more general design management roles leading and managing design teams, or acting as client/customer – all within a unique and challenging environment that can support your ambitions for career development with training and flexibility in deployment.
The work is diverse, no problem is every the same, and there are opportunities in abundance to learn across the whole of electrical, controls and instrumentation. The successful candidate be exposed to anything from heavy power substation work, through to fire & evacuation systems, and also supporting robotics, AI and cyber projects.
If you have a love for engineering, innovation and design, then this is the role for you!

Key Responsibilities:
  • Deliver innovative products and services and / or take technical responsibility for complex engineering systems.
  • Hold technical responsibility for the design of complex, fit-for-purpose engineering systems and ultimate ownership of the solution.
  • Produce deliverables to time, cost and quality requirements.
  • Support less experienced engineers and provide team leadership
  • Work collaboratively with the supply chain to deliver successful projects and work packages
  • Hold a broad understanding of other engineering disciplines and their role within engineering delivery.
  • Understand the importance of nuclear safety and security, to identify key nuclear hazards and articulate methods of managing these.
  • Have an awareness of governing laws, key regulations and standards for the nuclear industry and apply them appropriately on projects
  • Network and connect with other professions in order to deliver successful outcomes.

The Ideal Candidate:
  • Professional Registration (minimum IEng level) with a relevant institute (i.e. IET, IoP, IMC, Nuclear) or Professional Development to a stage that a PRA could endorse a IEng/CEng application.
  • Significant experience working within a highly regulated and quality assured system in roles where professional engineering judgement is the key attribute.
  • Experience of leading change and / or improvement programmes amongst engineering teams with demonstrable results.
  • Good commercial awareness and ability to work with multi discipline teams to deliver solutions

What’s in it for you?
At Sellafield Ltd, we are committed to supporting our employees in fulfilling their potential. With having 100 years of work in front of us, we offer comprehensive training and development opportunities, enabling you to feel inspired in your role.
Whatever area you join us in, you’ll find a genuinely exciting and rewarding career.
Making sure our employees feel supported is important to us. Therefore to help you get the most out of life in and outside of work, we also offer a range of employee benefits:
  • You will benefit from an annual bonus of up to 15%, made up of company and personal performance
  • An attractive defined contribution pension scheme – the company will match up to 13.5% for a 7% employee contribution!
  • 25.5 days annual leave, plus 8 bank holidays. Rising to 30 days annual leave from 1st April 2024. There is also the ability to purchase 3 additional days
  • The ability to carry over 5 days (rising to 10 from 1st April 2024) annual leave each financial year
  • Paid Sick Leave
  • Family Friendly Policies – Visit our Rewards & Benefits page to read more

title: Instrumentation Engineer
description:
Location: Rugby, GB, CV23 0HH
Job Type: Full Time
Department: Gas Transmission
Job Function: Gas Maintenance and Construction
Job posting date: 10 Feb 2024

Electrical and Instrumentation Operations Engineer - Rugby - £49,310 to £62,399 + Company Car
National Gas fuels innovation, growth and your ambition. Sound like the workplace for you? Read on.

As the E&I Operations Engineer for an area of the West Midlands in Gas Transmission, you'll lead the plan to execute maintenance activities, support large capital projects and deliver smaller projects to resolve defects and operational risks within your engineering discipline, working 'hands-on' alongside the Area Manager, Mechanical Operations Engineer and Technicians in the area.

You’ll be surrounded by talented people with all sorts of skill sets and specialities. They’ll still turn to you for technical expertise, because when it comes to knowledge of Electrical, Controls and Instrumentation, there’s nobody better. Together you will maintain safe and reliable assets including gas turbine and electric driven compressors, telemetry, valves and industrial control systems.

You will be the technical lead for a specific engineering discipline within an operational area and to undertake the role of authorising engineer for all disciplines within the permit to work system. The operations engineer is a point of technical escalation accountable for the performance of assets and the safe control of operations on site.

You will complete competency assessments of technicians to support the authorisation process and undertake workplace assessments of operational staff to ensure the ongoing competency of the team. Using key asset performance information you will prioritise maintenance interventions within an engineering discipline whilst leading the works to resolve defects within your area prioritising defects with the highest operational risk.

You will provide technical input into design studies within an engineering discipline including safe working design, maintainability and whole life cost. You will also undertake the role of incident controller during planned and emergency situations and participate in a 24/7 standby rota and emergency response as a duty engineer.

The successful candidate will have a strong engineering knowledge in the Electrical, Control and Instrumentation discipline with a sound understanding of engineering policy, procedures and statutory regulations associated with transmission assets.

You will be a passionate believer in personal and process safety and have an awareness of project and financial management. You will have experience of faulty finding on industrial processes and be able to establish sustainable relationships with key internal and external personnel.

While you will predominantly be based at single site, regular travel around the area will be required so you will need to hold a UK full valid car driving licence.

At National Gas we really take the time to understand what you want to achieve out of your role and career, that’s why we encourage people to speak about their personalised development plan early on. This might be developing in your existing role, you might even have your sights set on a higher level position, whatever it is we will give you the support and tools needed to succeed.
If this feels like you, take a peek at the perks below
  • A basic salary of up to £62,399, dependent on experience and capability
  • A bonus of up to 6% based on personal and company performance
  • Company Car
  • 26 days’ holiday plus statutory holidays – option available to buy extra holiday days
  • A pension scheme where we double match your contribution (maximum Company contribution of 12%)
  • Paid expenses for any business travel and accommodation
  • A flexible benefit scheme where you can opt into a whole host of lifestyle options
  • Access to employee support, care, and assistance helplines
About us
National Gas is one organisation, formed of three businesses – National Gas Transmission, National Gas Services and National Gas Metering.

We are proud of our role at the heart of Britain's energy system. Our skilled colleagues bring gas to around 23m homes and over 200,000 businesses, including heavy industries and power stations that keep the lights on, all whilst enabling the transition of our network to hydrogen.

All with the values of Simplicity, Ownership and Progress, and a shared mission to lead a clean energy future for everyone.

We are a flexible working organisation. At National Gas, we are committed to building a workforce that represents the communities we serve. We celebrate the different experiences our colleagues bring to our organisation, and strongly encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply.
Recognised as one of the UK’s Best Workplaces™ (2023) today by Great Place to Work® UK! National Gas Metering has officially ranked 53rd among Medium sized organisations on the list, this is in addition to being ranked 33rd UK’s Best Places to Work for Well Being. We have also won gold in recent industry awards.

The closing date is 18th February, although in some cases I’ll close the ad early.

I’ll respond to every single application.

title: Controls Engineer
description:
Job Description


The company is a leading global systems integrator for intralogistics solutions, a foundation-based company, that focuses on growing together. They have a great opportunity for a Customer Support Controls Engineer. The primary purpose of the role is to supply our Northern Europe customers with a quality technical hotline service. Ensure all requests are logged within the ticket system, ownership is taken until closure and a professional service is provided at all times.

Responsibilities:

  • To provide 24hr - 7 day cover on a rotated shift pattern
  • To provide professional telephone support to customers both internal and external
  • To provide professional on line software support for PLC
  • To manage the hotline ticket system for IT, Facilities and Controls
  • To manage the support process on an integrated basis.
  • To work on ongoing issues to reduce the volume of calls.
  • To provide effective communication to senior management and support colleagues.
  • To maintain support desk documentation.
  • To monitor trends and action plans to prevent issue escalation.
  • To follow through and own issues raised by yourself, if not resolved.
  • To escalate problems to the next support level where required and continue to manage the problem until resolved.
  • To review and identify common issues raised from reports that need remedial action, either through PLC / WCS teams or additional site training
  • To undertake testing of WCS modules in support of the WCS team when required

Requirements:

  • Extensive Control system experience / knowledge (PLC, IT, Drives, Networks) E
  • Materials handling / Automation D
  • Experience of IT systems support D
  • Experience dealing directly with customers / end users D
  • Excellent communications skills E
  • Ability to work as part of a team E
  • Flexible to travel throughout TGW NE as required E
  • Electrical Qualification to HNC Level D

Reasons why you should apply:

  • Competitive salary
  • Career development
  • Comprehensive benefits
  • Pension contribution
  • Life Assurance

How to Apply:

For more information on the role, or an informal discussion regarding opportunities we have available, please contact Zuzanna Szelest at zuzanna.szelest@proactiveglobal.com

Why work with Proactive?

Proactive Technical Recruitment is an industry leading, specialist engineering recruitment agency focused on the automation, manufacturing and robotics sectors. We offer specialist recruitment services to a niche customer base, vetting that our clients offer the best opportunities for your career. Proactive encourages and promotes equality and diversity within the workforce. We act with honesty, integrity and impartiality, ensuring your application is considered on its own merits and without bias.

When registering with Proactive you will have the opportunity to apply for some of the most interesting, specialist, opportunities in the marketplace, with the biggest companies in the sector. Follow us on Linkedin and Facebook for industry news and download our app for live notifications about newly listed vacancies. We look forward to helping you find your next role!



Proactive Global is committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer.
Proactive Global is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

title: Insider
description:
One of Adecco Public Sector's key clients is looking for a number of Rollout/Deployment Support engineers to join their team for an initial 3 month contract with likely extensions.
This role is to provide high quality desktop support and maintenance services that meets or exceeds standards outlined in Service Level Agreements and provide IT support and advice to all users of PCs, laptops, tablets and peripherals for all customers.

Responsibilities of the role:
  • 2nd line support of desktop/client applications
  • Support and maintain all PCs, Laptop, MCAs and peripherals.
  • In the field or remotely, provide basic triage of application issues, effecting or suggesting alternate routes to resolution for both technical and known application issues.
  • Configuration and deployment of computer and peripheral devices.
  • Application of standard images as part of the deployment or support of computer equipment.
  • Patching of end user networked devices back to edge switches (port level).
  • Accurately diagnose and, where possible, rectify application faults with National applications.
The successful applicant will need to have experience in the following:
  • Service Desk Tools and Technologies
  • Desktop operating systems and applications
  • Desktop/office applications
  • Data backup and recovery technologies
  • Computer and peripheral devices
  • Network protocols and technologies
  • Server operating systems including Microsoft Server and/or Linux
These roles will fall in scope for IR35 so will require candidates to work via an Umbrella Company or PAYE.
These opportunities are to start as soon as possible so are ideally suited to candidates who are immediately available or available at short notice.

title: IT Security Specialist
description:
Utilities
Remote working in a global team - the odd workshop in Warwick
6 months+
£750 per day
In short: Lead Cyber Engineer with strong endpoint experience required to join a global Utilities company.

In full:
Our client is a global leader in the Energy Services industry and is looking to add additional Lead Cyber Security Engineers in their Endpoint Security team. In the Endpoint Security team, you will be using an Agile approach focused on Endpoint Security technologies and processes. The purpose will be to bring the best security solutions to posture their endpoints (workstations, servers, etc.) to be protected and reduce risk, wherever possible.
We are looking for lead cyber security engineers who have strong attention to detail, as well as the proven ability to collaborate and share technical knowledge around automation and security best practices. This role will contribute to the development and execution of the overall strategy and roadmap for endpoint security at the company. This position will be responsible for deploying new solutions (i.e. endpoint detection and response capabilities) as well improve upon existing solutions to provide the best level of protection.

The primary focus areas for the Endpoint Security Team:
  • Review and analyse all security solutions currently deployed on endpoint assets (workstations and servers)
  • Implement security solutions allowing for reduction of agents where possible
  • Identify & implement automation capabilities to reduce the human touchpoint when operational issues occur
  • Build documentation and playbooks for strong processes to support the security posture on systems
  • Partner with other stakeholders to ensure that solutions are improved upon post implementation
  • Identify out of the box solutions for managing security on endpoints
Daily responsibilities as a member of the team:
  • Identify process improvements for automation of security hardening checks on workstations, servers, and databases.
  • Proactively work closely with Security Architecture team to identify new features, functionalities, improvements for existing solutions & designs on new security solutions to improve the posture on endpoints.
  • Identify security control gaps in production and propose solutions for implementation.
  • Train Security Operations team members on playbooks for production implementation & maintenance.
  • Determines automation opportunities and acts as the subject matter expert to help guide and shape how automation is enabled
  • Create and maintain useful, well-structured and error free documentation
  • Communicate complicated issues clearly and succinctly to various levels of the business & senior management
  • Mitigate risk by following established procedures and monitoring controls, spotting key errors, and demonstrating strong ethical behaviour.
Required Technical Skills:
  • Strong Information Security experience in Network and Endpoint Security (i.e. DLP, Endpoint Detection and Response, File Integrity, and SIEM).
  • In depth knowledge of Operating Systems (Linux/Windows), technology/web platforms (Server, Network, Application, Databases, Cloud)
  • Strong scripting and programming knowledge with good understanding of language fundamentals (Python, PowerShell, Chef, Perl, Ruby etc.)
  • Strong, demonstrable experience in Cybersecurity engineering, design, implementation and documentation
  • Knowledge of industry-standard Information Security frameworks, policies and procedures
  • Solid understanding of network and infrastructure (Networking protocol knowledge is an advantage- TCP/IP, HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, firewalls, proxies, IDS, IPS etc.)
  • Experience working in Agile squads
  • Security certifications (CEH, CCSP, CISSP, OSCP) and ITIL V3 certification
  • Subject Matter expert skilled in the installation and configuration of endpoint security tools such as antivirus, configuration management, and asset recognition.
  • Experience with Endpoint detection and protection tools
  • Experience with Security Hardening workstation to reduce attack surfaces.
  • Knowledge of Deployment tooling such as GPO, SCCM, Intune, etc.
  • Create, review, maintain and update documentation including Documenting & Publishing fixes in central knowledge base
  • Experience documenting, building and testing reference architectures.
  • Definition and monitoring of service level indicators and objectives to ensure platform health
  • Deployment Automation
  • Responsible for testing and configuring new products and technologies
  • Experience designing secure networks, systems and resilient application architectures
Candidates will ideally show evidence of the above in their CV in order to be considered.

Please be advised if you haven't heard from us within 48 hours then unfortunately your application has not been successful on this occasion, we may however keep your details on file for any suitable future vacancies and contact you accordingly. title: Network Engineer
description:
Adecco Public is partnering with an organisation who is looking to engage a Network Engineer on an initial 3 month contract with 3 month rolling extensions following. The post is to ensure that corporate Networks are secured and managed effectively, provide Networking, Wireless, Voice, Video and Firewall skills in the development, implementation, configuration and maintenance of network systems. In this role, you will be supporting an organisation Network refresh project and experience with Software-defined Networking is essential.
The role offers a hybrid working model with 1 week on site followed by 3 weeks working remote.
Duties and responsibilities: -
** Undertake the support of networks, covering routine housekeeping/maintenance/backup duties, configuration management, change management and problem management.
** Assist in the strategic planning and development of new Network communications services
** Project manage the assessment, planning and implementation of communication networks.
** Undertake the development, planning, and implementation of communication networks.
** Provide advice and consultancy on the procurement, implementation, operation and maintenance of communication networks.
** Take day-to-day responsibility for specific development work on network and computer systems.
Skills and experience: -
** Degree in Computing or equivalent commercial experience
** CCNA
** Substantial communication network administration experience
** Substantial experience in delivery of back office infrastructure support to users in a distributed environment
** Significant breadth of technical expertise built up from "hands on" operations and managing diverse applications and systems across a multi-site organisation
This is a really exciting opportunity to join a very well established IT project team during a period of change.
The contract element will fall in scope for IR35 and will need to operate through an umbrella company.
