title: Warehouse Lead
description:
No matter where you are in your career – or where you want to be – we’re here to create a great place to work where you can grow, perform and love what you do. At Cromwell, we’re all individuals, with unique backgrounds and personalities. But we have one thing in common: delivering exceptional service for our customers. And we do this through our purpose of Keeping Industry Working.

Role Responsibilities:

Cromwell Tools is seeking an Analyst Team Leader to join our Finance department in Wigston, Leicester. In this elevated role, you will report to the Head of FP&A and lead a team of Analysts. You will coach and train Analysts within the team, working on analytics to support big business decisions and putting insights in the hands of the teams that need it. Your primary focus will be on ensuring the delivery of high-quality data feeds, insights, and analytics, while maintaining a single source of truth for data within the organisation. Proficiency in SQL-based systems, particularly PostgreSQL, is preferred.
Key Responsibilities:

  • Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of Data Analysts, fostering their growth, and ensuring they meet individual and team goals.
  • Collaborate with other Analysts and the Data Science team Working together on larger data projects as well as supporting the immediate business needs.
  • Information Requests: Manage and prioritise day-to-day requests for data and information from various departments within the organisation, ensuring timely and accurate responses.
  • Legacy Reporting Systems: Oversee the decommissioning of legacy reporting systems, working with the team to migrate relevant data and reports to more efficient platforms.
  • Data Quality: Establish and maintain data quality standards and processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data feeds and reports.
  • Single Source of Truth: Ensure that data used across the organisation is consistent and aligns with a single instance of truth, reducing data discrepancies.
  • Coaching and Training: Coach and train analysts within the business to enhance their analytical skills and understanding of data practices.
  • Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, to identify opportunities for improving data management and reporting processes.

Preferred skills and qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred).
  • Proven experience in data analysis and team leadership roles.
  • Proficiency in data visualisation tools, with expertise in Power BI.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks and projects.
  • Knowledge of data governance and data quality best practices.
  • Experience with SQL-based systems, particularly PostgreSQL, is a plus.
  • Experience with data migration and legacy system decommissioning is a plus.

About Cromwell

Cromwell has been around for over 50 years, supplying an unrivalled choice of cutting tools, power tools, hand tools and safety equipment into all industries, professions and trades. We offer next day delivery or collection from our nationwide branch network, supported by an overnight UK logistics operation. Our team of over 1500 people are proud to be keeping industry working.

As a leader in B2B and B2C e-commerce, our Digital team is responsible for driving digital multi-channel solutions that make it easy for customers to deal with us.

Our Agile teams make data-driven decisions to ensure that our customers receive the biggest benefits, more frequently. You’ll have the freedom and autonomy to try new things, challenge the status quo and embrace curiosity.

And our data team, comprised of awesome data analysts, data engineers and data scientists, is leading the data landscape within Cromwell, building creative solutions and delivering key insights and valued reporting.

We’re all individuals, yet we’re very much one united team. We treat everyone fairly – regardless of gender, sexual orientation, background, age or disability – and give everyone opportunities for new and varied experiences. Inclusion means not just accepting people for who they are, but showing respect and making adjustments to help people and remove all barriers; it’s about creating a culture where everyone is respected, empowered and able to realise their full potential.

Cromwell is an Equal Opportunity Employer


    Location:Leicester (Head Office)
    Working Hours per week:40.25
    Contract Type:Permanent - Full Time

title: Instrumentation Engineer
description:
Salary: Starting from £29,000 per annum plus Veolia benefits

Location: Rugby

Programme Duration: 2 years

When you see the world as we do, you see the chance to help the world take better care of its resources and help it become a better place for everyone.

Through our graduate scheme, you’ll help us to achieve our purpose of Ecological Transformation and build a career we can be proud of. No matter what role you have, when you join us, you can play a key role in achieving our vision, and we can make yours happen, too.

We know everyone here at Veolia can help us work alongside our communities, look after the environment in small and big ways, and contribute to our inclusive culture.

What we can offer you;

- 25 days of annual leave

- Access to our company pension scheme

- Life assurance

- Ongoing training and development opportunities, allowing you to reach your full potential

- Access to a range of resources to support your physical, mental and financial health so you can lean on us whenever you need to

- 24-hour access to a virtual GP, 365 days a year, for you and family members in your household- Discounts on everything from groceries to well-known retailers

- One paid days leave every year to volunteer and support your community

Graduate Programme;

During this programme, you’ll gain valuable insight into our services and strategic projects and we’ll help you to further develop your skills and knowledge so that you can succeed in your career. You’ll also join our graduate network and receive our continued support throughout.

We’re strong believers in continuous development here at Veolia and actively encourage and support everyone to keep going after you finish the programme.

What you'll be doing;

- Act as technical support for Electrical, Control and Instrumentation (ECI) reactive and maintenance issues.

- Support Senior ECI Engineers and Project Managers to deliver ECI projects in line with deadlines, budget and scope, including drafting new technologies supporting documentation.

- Gain further technical understanding of control systems and control system networks.

- Make sure that the PPM schedule is uploaded and reviewed in a timely manner.

- Be responsible for weekly reporting in relation to completed vs. outstanding ECI work and escalate any high-risk issues if not addressed in a timely manner.

- Monitor KPI progress with complete vs. incomplete tickets.

- Learn to manage relationships with contractors to focus on efficient project delivery while promoting a Health and Safety culture.

- Learn to project manage, starting with project development to project construction, commissioning and handover phases.

- Support the senior engineers and managers with the project acceptance process to ensure the plant meets the predetermined resilience and performance criteria.

- Be an ambassador of Veolia’s Health and Safety culture.

- Support with Software Management, System Maintenance, and Site Operations Scada Systems

The successful candidate may be required to work in collaboration with our wider operational, engineering and performance teams as a part of your development programme.

What we're looking for;

- Degree in Instrumentation and Control Engineering or related subject (to be achieved by Sept 2024)

- A creative and solution-oriented thinker

- Full UK driving license

- Excellent time management and organisational skills

- Strong communication and interpersonal skills

- Ability to work independently as well as part of a team

- Proficient with Microsoft/Google spreadsheets, documents, Gantt charts, presentations

What's next?

Before we can consider your application further, you'll need to complete a couple of short, gamified assessments. If you're successful following this, we’ll then invite you to one of our virtual assessment days and a site visit.

Apply today, so we can make a difference for generations to come.

We're proud to be listed in The Sunday Times Best Places to Work 2023, being named as a Top 10 Very Big Organisation and Highly Commended as a workplace for 55+.

This accolade further demonstrates our commitment to our people and our actions in creating an environment where everyone can be their true selves and enjoy working at Veolia.

We want to ensure that you feel supported throughout the application process and provide reasonable adjustments where necessary and requested. If you require any reasonable adjustments as part of your application and interview process, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Graduate

Salary: From £29,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Employee mentoring programme
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Free parking
  • Health & wellbeing programme
  • On-site parking
  • Sick pay
  • Store discount
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

Expected start date: 04/09/2024

title: IT Architect
description:
At ATS, our Industrial IT Architects play a crucial role in delivering complex manufacturing IT projects for customers within the Aerospace and Defence industry sectors. This role involves taking ownership of technical scope across multiple projects and managing it throughout the entire project life cycle, including delivering high-quality technical documentation aligned with customers’ technical governance and assurance criteria.

As part of this role, you will assume technical leadership within projects to facilitate effective collaboration among technical delivery teams within our customers’ organisation and their various IT suppliers, ensuring seamless integration for project success.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Lead the technical aspects of manufacturing IT projects, aligning with business objectives and customer technical standards.
  • Oversee the project’s technical scope, guiding project management teams for effective planning and execution.
  • Identify, capture, and mitigate project risks and issues.
  • Host workshops and meetings to facilitate collaboration among technical delivery teams.
  • Produce high quality technical documentation and review constituent design documentation, ensuring overall solution design integrity.
  • Engage with Operational Technology OEMs for integrating manufacturing equipment with enterprise IT applications and networks.
  • Collaborate with pre-delivery and proposals teams to develop robust, commercially viable responses to customer requests for quotations.
  • Inspire our team of Industrial IT Engineers with their professional development by providing mentorship, guidance, and opportunities for growth, ensuring they stay motivated and continuously enhance their skills.

REWARD AND BENEFITS:

  • 23 days of annual leave plus bank holidays, increasing with each year of service.
  • Flexible working hours.
  • Paid family support days.
  • Private healthcare.
  • Career development and training opportunities focusing on education and development goals.
  • Monthly well-being events and resources.
  • Access to mental health first aiders (MHFA trained).
  • Employee Assistance Programme (EAP).
  • Life assurance.
  • Retail and leisure discounts.
  • Global working opportunities.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Proven experience in technically delivering IT projects.
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent industry experience.
  • Proven knowledge and ability to work with various IT disciplines, including networking, security, servers, infrastructure, virtualization, application development, and cloud offerings.
  • Ability to support Industrial IT Engineers with the delivery of complex industrial IT solutions in manufacturing environments.
  • Working knowledge of Enterprise IT systems and associated service and project delivery frameworks (e.g., ITIL, PRINCEII, TOGAF).
  • Good understanding of OT (Operation Technologies) such as PLCs, SCADA, HMIs, and associated data transport protocols like OPC UA, OPC DA, MTConnect, Profinet, and Profibus.
  • Understanding of ISA-95 and its translation to the “Purdue Model”
  • Strong interpersonal skills, with effective communication at all levels.
  • Articulate in written and spoken language at technical, logical, and business levels.
  • Experience in understanding business requirements to produce quotes for large-scale projects.
  • Ability to obtain Security Clearance to work at a UK MOD accredited manufacturing facility.
  • Willingness to work on-site at customers’ manufacturing facilities across the UK and occasionally overseas.

title: Apprentice
description:
Job Introduction

The Apprenticeship programme takes around three years to complete, and you’ll spend your first 12 weeks being inducted onto the programme at one of our Training Centres. You’ll earn while you learn and develop your knowledge, skills and behaviours to become a Power Networks Craftsperson, achieving a City & Guilds Level 2 Qualification in Electrical Engineering. Your Training will include periods of on the job training and development, learning from an experienced and qualified Craftsperson. Following a formal assessment of your knowledge, skills and behaviours, you’ll become a qualified Craftsperson yourself.

A Power Networks Craftsperson has responsibility for the safe construction, maintenance and repair of the electrical power network. You’ll work on distribution systems up to 66kV (or 132kV if in a Projects team). You can be a Jointer, Fitter, or Overhead Linesperson. We have one Overhead, one Fitter and two Jointer positions available at our Nottingham depot.

Whichever pathway you pursue, you’ll represent National Grid and carry out work handed down by other areas of the business.

Ready to power up your career? Join us and impact the way people heat, light and fuel their homes, business and vehicles. Keep reading and apply!

  • Details in these videos are correct but the previous company name 'Western Power Distribution' is in use, soon to be updated to National Grid.
Main Responsibilities

Our Trades

Underground cable engineer (Jointer). Our jointers carry out jointing techniques up to 66kV*, including excavation, cable laying, reinstatement and fault location on LV cables

Overhead lines engineer (Linesperson). Our Overhead Lines teams carry out the construction, maintenance, replacement and repair of overhead lines up to and including 66kV*.

Substation fitting engineer (Fitter). Our fitters carry out the annual maintenance of plant and switchgear up to 66kV*. They’re also responsible for the programming and monitoring of immediate work colleagues and switching up to 66kV*, among other tasks.

  • Projects teams work up to voltages of 132kV

Join us, and we’ll see you participate in craft skills activities on the live LV network, on dead LV, HV and EHV circuits (live HV circuits if part of a Hot Glove team). You’ll help with network operations, connect generators and services and organise your own projects. You’ll also:

  • Construct distribution substations, construct and alter overhead lines, install plant, lay and joint cables, terminate cables to plant and overhead lines
  • Carry out routine inspection, maintenance and repairs of underground, overhead, substation and protection equipment
  • Record asset routes, details and positions
  • Record plant details
  • Locate and identify cables, test insulation, phasing and continuity on LV cables
  • Test earthing, voltage, phasing and phase rotation
  • Write outage requests and switching programmes for simple outages

Weight restrictions apply to overhead and fitting trades based around Personal Fall Protective Equipment, including harnesses and other equipment such as ladders. If in doubt, please contact nged.recruitment@nationalgrid.co.uk

Our Culture

6,700 colleagues share our vision to be at the heart of a clean, fair, affordable energy future. If this appeals to you too, you could soon work in a supportive, rewarding and friendly environment that empowers everyone to succeed. We live by our values of doing the right thing, finding a better way and using our drive to make things happen every day. That’s why we’ll help you build a worthwhile career to be proud of – whatever your role and passion. Together we can bring energy to life using your enthusiasm and the latest technology.

The Ideal Candidate

We need you to have excellent communication skills; one moment, you could be speaking with customers, and the next, colleagues or internal stakeholders. Your success relies on your confidence to interact with the wider business. As you’ll be working outdoors, we need you to be adventurous and driven to work in all weather. Safety awareness is a must (you’ll follow safety instructions, use protective equipment and wear protective clothing), as is meeting deadlines. You’ll be resilient and willing to learn, genuinely passionate about your career and committed to studying. Curious problem solvers thrive here.

Our minimum entry criteria require the following qualifications (held or predicted):

  • GCSE English at Grade A*-C/9-4 or Level 2 Functional/Key Skills English
  • GCSE Mathematics at Grade A*-C/9-4 or Level 2 Functional/Key Skills Maths
  • GCSE Science at Grade A*-C/9-4 or BTEC Science Level 2 equivalent
  • Two other GCSE's A*-C/9-4 or Level 2 qualifications in any subject.

You can also apply with a recognised Level 3 qualification in Electrical Engineering plus GCSE Grade C/4 or above in Maths and English. Please note: Electrical Installation qualifications are not accepted as an equivalent to Electrical Engineering qualifications and as a result you will be required to meet the minimum entry requirements detailed above. Whatever qualifications you hold, we will need to see evidence of them for you to be considered. Evidence of your qualification certificates will be required prior to appointment.

Start date September 2024. Please note that we are unable to accommodate any annual leave during these first 12 weeks of training.

Operationally we require you to live within approximately 30 minutes of the depot you are applying for. If you appear to be a good match for more than one location, we will consider your suitability during the process. Please only submit one application as multiple applications will not be considered.

Your Benefits

Joining the UK’s leading electricity distribution business means plenty of career opportunities and well-deserved recognition. We reward hard work and encourage ambition. So, as well as a competitive starting salary of £16,776, you’ll have 23 days annual leave (26 when you complete training), plus 8 bank holidays. In Year 2 your salary will increase to £21,282 and in your development role which you are anticipate to reach after 2 and a half years, your salary will increase to £29,425. Your eventual Craftsperson’s salary will be £39,409. You can use our competitive contributory pension scheme (we double match your contributions up to a maximum of 12%), and you could even benefit from our annual Share Save plan. We supply your protective clothing and safety equipment, and there’s free parking at all our main sites. Our Employee Assistance Programme is there to take care of you and includes musculoskeletal and physiotherapy services if you need them.


About The Company

We are an equal opportunities employer. Our desire is to bring in more employees from diverse backgrounds to build further on our inclusive culture. We value and celebrate individual difference and we believe that an inclusive culture will help the business grow as a positive, strong and innovative company. We anonymise all jobs in our recruitment system, so we can eliminate unconscious bias and be a workplace that reflects the community we serve. Hiring managers only have access to necessary information after shortlisting has taken place and before interview so they can prepare.

Additional Application Information

Recruitment correspondence is usually sent by email, so please do check your email account including spam/junk folders regularly after the closing date.

Should you have any questions or require additional support to complete your online application, please email nged.recruitment@nationalgrid.co.uk

We reserve the right to close the vacancy early should sufficient numbers of suitable applications be received. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

About Us

We’re National Grid Electricity Distribution (NGED), the owner and operator behind the electricity distribution systems for the Midlands, the Southwest of England and South Wales. Serving communities of more than 8 million people, our expert teams deliver heat, light and power for homes and businesses, working outdoors with underground cables, overhead lines and substations that operate between 230 and 132,000 volts.

Net-zero targets are transforming the way we work and increasing the scope of the positive impact we can make. Right now, we’re looking for apprentices to join us.

Our people in Operations work across a number of teams to keep the lights on for our customers. They might be helping a customer who has lost supply or supporting a developer building a multi-million pound project.

They maintain a 24/7 service from faults and maintenance, asset replacement to new connections, working outdoors with underground cables, overhead lines and substations that operate between 230 and 132,000 volts, their work is critical to everything we do.

title: Design Engineer
description:
Job Introduction

An exciting opportunity is now available for a Civil Design Engineer, or experienced Civil CAD Technician, based at our Castle Donington office. We are looking to appoint an enthusiastic and skilled engineer to help us meet the needs of our EHV construction programs. The role reports to the engineering design team manager, under the guidance of our senior civil engineer. This is a unique opportunity for a civil designer to work in an environment not regularly found in the civil engineering discipline.

Rewarding success and development is important to us and as part of this role you’ll receive annual salary increases.

As part of our hybrid working approach and in line with our policy, this role allows you to apply for a mix of office and home working. Hybrid working can only be considered once your initial training is complete and subject to business need.

If you are offered a position, you will be required to successfully complete a basic DBS check that shows any unspent convictions or conditional cautions.

Main Responsibilities

We are seeking to recruit a Civil Design Engineer with experience/background within in the following areas:-

  • The detailed design of civil engineering features, primarily substation buildings (new and modifications to existing), reinforced concrete foundations, steel structures, groundworks, roads and drainage.
  • Preparation of detailed engineering drawings in an AutoCAD environment; specifically 2D wireframe but 3D skills may prove useful.
  • Preparation of specifications for tender and construction purposes.
  • Discharging the duties of a ‘Designer’ under the Construction Design and Management (CDM) regulations.
  • Ensuring compliance of civil design output with NGED policy.

Where applicants do not have familiarity with all of the above areas, they would be expected to demonstrate core skills or demonstrable experience within a civil/structural engineering discipline.

For example the role could be relevant to candidates with strong CAD Technician experience, or a recent Civil Engineering Graduate.

  • Where applicants initially lack particular skills, appointment on a designate basis may be considered. Training and support will be given to assist the appointee to develop into the role where necessary. A proactive approach to their own development is expected from the appointed candidate.
The Ideal Candidate

Candidates should ideally be qualified to a national certificate level or equivalent in an engineering discipline. Ideally you will have experience in preparing and manipulating engineering drawings using computer-aided design tools (e.g. AutoCAD).

Candidates will further be expected to demonstrate customer focus, flexibility, good communication skills and an ability to manage a number of design commissions.

A full UK driving licence is required for this role.

About The Company

If you join us you will enjoy a package of benefits designed to reward your hard work and incentivise your ambition. In addition to your competitive salary, we offer a competitive contributory pension scheme where the company will double match your pension contributions up to a maximum company contribution 12%. You will also have access, subject to eligibility criteria, to join our annual Share Save plan.

You will be entitled to 26 days annual leave entitlement, plus 8 bank holidays. Protective clothing and Safety Equipment will be provided where required and we offer free parking at all main sites. In addition, you will be able to access support via our Employee Assistance Programme, including musculoskeletal and physiotherapy services.

As an equal opportunities employer who is committed to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, we celebrate individual difference and are actively bringing in more employees from diverse backgrounds to build on our inclusive culture. We anonymise all jobs in our recruitment system, so we can eliminate unconscious bias and be a workplace that reflects the community we serve. Hiring managers only have access to necessary information after shortlisting has taken place and before interview so they can prepare.

Additional Application Information

Recruitment correspondence is usually sent by email, so please do check your email account including spam/junk folders regularly after the closing date.

To enhance your candidate experience, we recommend using Google Chrome to complete your online application. Should you have any questions regarding this or require additional support to complete your online application, please email nged.recruitment@nationalgrid.co.uk

We reserve the right to close the vacancy early should sufficient numbers of suitable applications be received. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

About Us

We’re National Grid Electricity Distribution (NGED), the owner and operator behind the electricity distribution systems for the Midlands, the South West of England and South Wales. Serving communities of more than 8 million people, our expert teams deliver heat, light and power for homes and businesses, working outdoors with underground cables, overhead lines and substations that operate between 230 and 132,000 volts.

6,700 colleagues share our vision to be at the heart of a clean, fair, affordable energy future. If this appeals to you too, you could soon work in a supportive, rewarding and friendly environment that empowers everyone to succeed. We live by our values of doing the right thing, finding a better way and using our drive to make things happen every day. That’s why we’ll help you build a worthwhile career to be proud of – whatever your role and passion. Together we can bring energy to life using your enthusiasm and the latest technology.

The Engineering Design Team prepare electrical, protection/control, mechanical and civil designs for schemes to construct, extend or modify electricity substations energised at up to 132,000 volts. The team assists network design colleagues with the assessment of substation options and develops selected schemes, from a broad engineering brief into a fully specified build package for delivery via internal and external construction teams.

The team comprises 80 design staff, primarily based at offices in Tipton, Pegasus, Avonbank and Cardiff. It handles in excess of 500 active design commissions at any time ranging in capital value from £50k to £10m.

We are a growing team, with a culture of support, progress and continuous improvement. We are looking for an individual who can join us in expanding and developing our outputs, who is committed to the success of the team, and is able to take ownership and personal responsibility for their workload.

We reserve the right to close the vacancy early should sufficient numbers of suitable applications be received. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

About Us

We’re National Grid Electricity Distribution (NGED), the owner and operator behind the electricity distribution systems for the Midlands, the Southwest of England and South Wales. Serving communities of more than 8 million people, our expert teams deliver heat, light and power for homes and businesses, working outdoors with underground cables, overhead lines and substations that operate between 230 and 132,000 volts.

Net-zero targets are transforming the way we work and increasing the scope of the positive impact we can make. Right now, we’re looking for apprentices to join us.

Our people in Operations work across a number of teams to keep the lights on for our customers. They might be helping a customer who has lost supply or supporting a developer building a multi-million pound project.

They maintain a 24/7 service from faults and maintenance, asset replacement to new connections, working outdoors with underground cables, overhead lines and substations that operate between 230 and 132,000 volts, their work is critical to everything we do.

title: IT Support
description:
Based in Hinckley, Working with small and medium-sized business, we provide hands-on support to demystify your IT setup, get you working smarter, and get you back on track quickly if anything falls over. We have built a large portfolio of customers and are looking for a senior engineer to help manage and develop our large customer base, being part of the team who drives this forward, whilst also assisting to support what we have when needed. Intalect are a forward thinking, IT company that embraces technology as it emerges. Being experts in Azure, Cloud and Microsoft 365 we provide quality IT Solutions to SME, Corporate and schools and are currently looking for the right people to join our talented IT team.

The Role

We are looking for a senior engineer to help support and maintain our existing managed IT Support client base and develop / drive forward new requirements, currently we are deploying a wide variety of Azure of Office 365 services, the role will be varied and interesting and will include:

· Acting as a technical escalation point to the IT service desk

· Work with our technical architects to plan, build and install IT systems ranging from

o Cloud deployments

o On Premise & Cloud servers

o Azure PaaS, IaaS, and SaaS

o Pro services installations

A broad skill set is required for this role as you are the escalation point for the service desk. It is a pre-requisite that you have Azure platform & Cloud based skill set, we have not provided an exhaustive list, if you are thinking you like the sound of the above and would like to learn more about the role itself, please get in touch and we will be happy to expand. The successful applicant will be in a position of seniority within the business, people will look to you for support, guidance, and technical ability, you will be at the “sharp end” of the business deploying technology, representing Intalect and resovling critical IT issues when called upon to speed up issue resolution in the event of a serious outage.

The Offer

- Flexible working – 2 working from home days

- Continuous development program

- Interesting, varied work

- Competitive salary

- Fast-paced friendly work environment

- Free Microsoft Training

Personal Skills

- Hungry to learn and develop your skill set

- Analytical thinking towards identifying, recommending, and introducing improvements

- Experience in adoption of new technologies though research, to deployment of a solution

- Good at documentation & keeping notes to provide technical documentation for handover to support desk

- You need to be self sufficient to manage and prioritise your workload

- Confident and driven personality

- Eagerness to work in a fast-paced environment

The Successful Applicant

- Previous experience held in an MSP environment

- Experience in Azure and Microsoft 365

- Strong technical experience of Microsoft Server operating systems, Microsoft core applications, such as Exchange, Domain Services

- Strong skills supporting Microsoft AD, DNS and Remote Desktop Services

- Experience supporting network related technologies and equipment

- Strong skills diagnosing & resolving client application, connectivity, and hardware-based incidents

- Exposure to Hyper-V and vSphere virtualisation technologies

- Exposure to backup and DR technologies

- Customer service skills, written and orally

- Have own transport and driving license

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to £40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Sick pay
  • Work from home

  • Monday to Friday

title: Apprentice
description:
IMPROVING LIVES BY MAKING JOURNEYS SAFER, CLEANER AND SMARTER.


HORIBA MIRA has over 75 years of heritage in developing some of the world’s most iconic vehicles. Our engineers utilise the latest test facilities and simulation tools to make vehicles and journeys safer, cleaner, more efficient and rewarding. Every journey in the world is positively influenced by us.

We are a very diverse organisation and, since our acquisition by HORIBA in 2015, operate from an increasingly global perspective.


Electro-mechanical Engineer Degree Apprenticeships Sep 2024


We are looking to recruit a number of candidates to become future engineers who can solve real-world problems using a combination of mechanical and electrical engineering expertise.

In partnership with the University of Nottingham, our Electro-mechanical Engineer Degree Apprenticeship combines university on-campus teaching (delivered as weekly block release), and on-the-job training provided by our own technicians and engineers, where you will gain a wide range of experiences across various business areas.


Successful apprentices will be awarded both a Level 6 Electro-mechanical Engineer Apprenticeship Certificate and a BEng (Hons) Electro-mechanical Engineering degree. You will join our network of apprentices, including being guided by those who are already further ahead on this programme.


We are recruiting in the following areas across our main site in Nuneaton:

  • Electromagnetic Compatibility
  • Propulsion & Electromobility
  • ADAS & CAV Testing
  • Passive Safety

Working at MIRA


We have a fantastic culture, which is something that inspires and retains our people. You can see more about who we are and what we an offer you on our new careers website.

Soft skills are just as important as technical skills, and so we look for candidates who can demonstrate key attributes such as customer focus, communication, teamworking, creativity and resilience.


Entry Requirements:


Applicants should possess:

  • A full UK driving licence.
  • Grade 4 or above in GCSE English Language (or equivalent)
  • Grade 5 or above in GCSE Mathematics (or equivalent)

and either

  • 3 A-levels at grade B or above, of which one must be A-Level Maths (or equivalent). A-levels which will not be accepted are Citizenship Skills, General Studies and Critical Thinking.

or

  • Advanced Apprenticeship, BTEC or T-level (Distinction preferred), or equivalent demonstrable work experience in the occupation area – to be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.


You should also be a UK/EU/EEA national or have lived and have had a right to work in the UK for 3 years or more.


Assessment process:


If you meet our eligibility criteria, we will then ask you to complete some psychometric tests, with successful applicants then progressing to a short assessment day where we can meet each other. This will take place at our MIRA Technology Institute on Thursday 25th April, so your diary must be available for this. Those selected from this will then be issued a Conditional Offer, pending a short Maths paper / interview with the University where a candidate’s Maths might need to be evaluated.


Closing date for Applications: Friday 1st March


You are advised to submit your application as soon as possible, as we reserve the right to close posts at any time once we have received sufficient applications.


HORIBA MIRA are an equal opportunities employer and will provide reasonable support to applicants with a disability throughout the recruitment process. If you consider you need reasonable adjustments with the application stage due to a disability, please contact the Recruitment Team (recruitment(at)horiba-mira.com).


Right to work: - HORIBA MIRA actively promotes diversity and inclusion across our organisation. Please note that this role is not on the Home Office list of occupations eligible for sponsorship under the Skilled Worker route.

We recommend that you assess your eligibility before applying for this position. Visit

title: Safety Engineer
description:
Req ID:438883

At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.


Appointment Basis: Permanent

Location: Derby, DE24 8AD


Could you be the full-time Safety Engineer in Derby we’re looking for?


Your future role


Take on a new challenge and apply your product safety expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You’ll report to Scott Condie ( Head of Vehicle Safety and Perf. AVENTRA, Derby) and work alongside passionate and dedicated teammates.

You'll be performing Railway/Product Safety activities and related deliverables in accordance with QCD commitments on Derby based projects/programs. Day-to-day, you’ll work closely with teams across the business to support the Alstom Transport products performance by ensuring Safety requirements are identified upstream reflecting Alstom Safety policy and much more.

We’ll look to you for:

  • Performing the Safety analyses he/she is in charge of, as per the applicable Safety instructions/processes and other specific requirements committed to the Customer.
  • Addressing Customer/Independent parties (ISA, NoBo, Debo,…) comments to get its approval on the Safety deliverables within the limits of Alstom Transport commitments.
  • Contributing to the assessment of the Safety performance of the product and to the upstream identification of the necessary safety requirements to ensure the achievement of the Safety targets.
  • Applying the Alstom Transport/Engineering rules & processes to his / her activities in particular those dedicated to Safety activities.
  • Having a pro-active challenging view on the Safety data/results he/she handles to enhance the adequacy/consistency of the Safety studies and requirements.
  • Seeking for the technical understanding of the Alstom Transport products in order to better assess their safety performance and potential areas of improvement.
  • Adopting a product oriented mindset in performing his/her studies to foster the capitalization of the results of the studies towards the product Safety performance.

All about you


We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:


  • Railway Safety analysis and demonstration methods and tools.
  • Electrical and/or Electro-mechanical Engineering

On a more personal level, you will also need to be:

  • Good communications and interpersonal skills
  • Time management skill.
  • Sense of priorities
  • Structured and organized with hands-on approach

Things you’ll enjoy

Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:

  • Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
  • Work with new railway safety standards for rolling stock.
  • Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
  • Contribute to innovative projects
  • Utilise our agile working environment
  • Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
  • Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
  • Progress towards Train Safety Engineer.
  • Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive benefits (pension, life ins., medical, + anything specific to the site e.g. free on-site parking, canteen etc).

You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

Important to note


As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 70+ countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.


At Alstom we will consider requests for flexible working on hiring. Many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, flexible start and finish times, job sharing, or compressed hours. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you need.


Alstom U.K. is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. We aim to have a welcoming and inclusive environment for individuals, of different ages, genders, ethnicities, disability, LGBT, religion and/or belief.


As a 'Disability Confident' employer, we will interview all disabled job applicants who match the essential criteria of the job description or specification: if you require any reasonable adjustments, please let us know.

title: Technician
description:
ASSISTANT WATER NETWORK TECHNICIAN APPRENTICE


LET’S CUT STRAIGHT TO IT


Taking care of ‘one of life’s essentials’ – it’s our purpose and we want you to be part of it. Supplying wholesome drinking water, treating wastewater and recycling this back to the environment responsibly is no mean feat. We serve around 8 million people across the Midlands and Wales and unlike other businesses, our delivery is non-negotiable. It’s a matter of life.


Many of our employees are also our customers, so we truly take pride in what we do! Employing people from across our communities and beyond, Severn Trent is an exciting and inclusive place to work – a place where you can be curious, can be ‘Wonderfully You’ and where you can truly make an impact to our environment, now and for future generations.


LET’S TELL YOU MORE


Apprenticeship Programmes are a great way to earn and learn! Our Apprentice Assistant Water Network Technician Programme offers the perfect blend of personal and professional development, exposing you to the frontline of our business. Entering an apprenticeship scheme with us involves working towards the role of a fully-fledged professional, earning a salary, whilst also being able to maintain a sense of academic achievement. At Severn Trent we provide the perfect mix between hands-on experience and a formal qualification, enabling our apprentices to make a real lasting difference to our customers and communities, not just for now, but far into the future.

Water Network Technicians work outside across our region to find leaks on our huge network of underground pipes and get these repaired. You will be supported every step of the way, by your line manager and mentor. Working in our water network team, you’ll will be ensuring we identify and reduce water leakage across our network. In your daily work, you’ll interact with distribution service technicians and our repair and maintenance technicians. You will also work with our call centres, network optimisation and contractors. You’ll regularly engage with customers and members of the public which will help you to build your stakeholder relationship management skills.


HOW WILL THE PROGRAMME WORK


Standard


Water Industry Network Technician


Website

https://www.instituteforapprenticeships.org/apprenticeship-standards/water-industry-network-technician-v1-0


Apprenticeship Duration


30 months Excluding EPA


Apprenticeship Level


Level 3


Location


  • Raynesway, Derby, Derbyshire, DE21 7BE


Salary

£17,194


Provider/ F2F or Online

Severn Trent Academy (Coventry) / F2F


ENTRY CRITERIA


This apprenticeship standard is at Level 3 (equivalent to 2 A-Level qualifications). If you don't already have GCSEs in English and maths, you will need to take functional skills as part of the apprenticeship, which is an alternative to GCSEs and achieve a Level 2. This will need to be achieved prior to completion of your apprenticeship.


Health & Safety: We take the health and safety of our employees very seriously. This role will require you to listen for leaking pipes, therefore you will be asked in your application if you have any health restrictions which could impact your ability to hear


TRAVEL/LICENCE REQUIREMENT


You will be required to have a Driving Licence & access to you own vehicle before completing your apprenticeship as driving is mandatory for your off-scheme role


ROLE EXPECTATIONS POST APPRENTICESHIP


Following successful completion of your apprenticeship, you will take up an Assistant Water Network Technician role, where you will be able to put your skills into action.


  • Expected 40-hour weeks.
  • Night-time working to investigate leakage when required.
  • You’ll be part of a standby rota.
  • Working independently.


WHAT WILL YOU LEARN


  • You will learn how to identify leakage, using data, tools and techniques.
  • Give advice to customers on water fittings and repair and maintain meters and loggers.
  • You will also learn how to identify water network issues, apply fault-finding and problem-solving techniques, and identify root causes in some of our equipment to resolve faults.
  • We will teach you how to calibrate equipment such as temporary loggers and pressure gauges to the appropriate standard.
  • You will learn how to operate our water network safely and protect our environment.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR


We want our employees to care and to have a genuine passion for what we do as a business. We need people who want to make a difference in providing a vital service to our customers, now and for the long-term.

We’d love you to be someone with…


  • A ‘can do’ attitude – willing to get stuck in, take accountability for decisions and actions and take pride in your work
  • A love of variety in a role and ability to adapt to a dynamic, fast-paced working environment
  • Ability to quickly prioritise tasks and the initiative to dive head-first into problem solving.
  • No two days are the same on the front line and not every day goes to plan, so you’ll need to be quick on your feet to respond!
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working with multiple teams
  • Ability to analyse and interpret information and effectively communicate this to different team members and audiences
  • Ability to travel freely across our patch to visit different sites and travel to meetings and training days
  • Curiosity to learn quickly in a reactive and dynamic working environment
  • Ability to work in all weather conditions to serve our customers and protect the environment


HOW WE’LL REWARD AND CARE FOR YOU IN RETURN


It’s not just a job you’ll get here, you’ll get a career too. We have a range of benefits that reward and recognise great work and award-winning training to ensure you reach your potential. And we’ll also help you play your part in looking after the environment and the community in which we live.

With that in mind, here are just some of our favourite perks that you’ll get being part of the Seven Trent family:


  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays (and the ability to buy/ sell up to 5 days per year)
  • Annual bonus scheme (of up to £1,500, which is subject to eligibility)
  • Leading pension scheme – we will double your contribution (up to 15% when you contribute 7.5%)
  • Sharesave – the chance to buy Severn Trent Plc shares at a discounted rate
  • Dedicated training and development with our Academy
  • Electric vehicle scheme and retail offers
  • Family friendly policies
  • Two paid volunteering days per year


As if that isn’t enough, you’ll receive an annual salary increase whilst you’re on programme and you’ll also get an increase when you move into your first job.


LET’S GO


Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.


Please note, we don’t require a CV or cover letter to complete your application, the system will ask you for this, but you can just upload a blank document.


  • Roles close on Friday 29th March 2024
  • Check your diary – face to face assessments will run from 7th May – 27th June


To find out more about working with us, search #LifeatSevernTrent on social media.


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION


At Severn Trent we are passionate about our people. We want to make sure that we continue to foster a more diverse, inclusive, and cohesive culture that represents the communities and customers we serve. We’re making sure we keep up the progress with our wonderful working groups – LGBTQ+, Women in Operations & STEM, Disability and Ethnicity, who help us with our commitments. Find out more about our commitments to Diversity and Inclusion at Severn Trent. Click here to find out more
