title: IT Field Service Engineer - Leicester in Loughborough, UK
IT Support
description:
About the Role

Joining our newly-formed central services, we are adding a dedicated, service-driven IT Support Engineer to join our ITIS team within our award-winning Technology team, working across The Forge Holiday Group.

This position will cover a 9 month fixed term Maternity Cover. Due to the on-call aspect of this position, you will be required to work on-call evenings and weekends on a rota basis working 1 week in around 6. Some travel may be involved and you will be expected to visit sites if required to solve issues or for project work.

Paying a salary up to £32,000 per annum working Monday-Friday, 9am-5.30pm.
Located at the Forest Holidays support centre in Moira, Derby for a minimum 3 days per week, 2 days WFH.
Plus access to our annual STIP (annual company-wide bonus) scheme with an additional 10% of your salary
️ 33 days annual leave including bank holidays
Plus an additional day off for your Birthday
Plus an additional two volunteering days per year
An enhanced maternity and paternity policy
Personal development and opportunities to be recognised
Study support for additional qualifications, courses and accreditations
Numerous dedicated wellbeing initiatives and access to 24/7 mental health support
️‍ ️ On-site gym at our Chester HQ
Regular social events including weekly Breakfast Club and 'Bring your Dog to Work' day!

We are one of the fastest-growing Tech businesses in the North West, connecting our customers to create perfect holiday moments whilst striving to nurture a rich culture of innovation across our team.

With over 120 tech superstars across our department, we consider our Tech Team to be the best and brightest, who eat, sleep and breathe tech and are truly inspired by the work they do. We are passionate about discovering new ways of doing things, driving towards constantly improving and are constantly challenging ourselves to stay one step ahead.

Joining our dedicated IT Support desk, you will provide 24/7 IT support to our 4 divisions across the Forge Holiday Group including our Regional Brands based across the UK and Ireland, Sykes Holiday Cottages, UKCaravansforHire and Forest Holidays. Working closely with the Chester based and Regional team, you will be based at our Forest Holidays Support Centre, focussing on Forest Holidays.

With experience in supporting Windows desktop, administering Active Directory and familiarity in networking, you will be responsible for the company’s network, servers and workstations and which provides desktop support to circa 2000 end users. On a daily basis you will be servicing technical support enquiries for the entire group, involving troubleshooting and diagnostics, plus work on technical projects.

Your Responsibilities

Reporting into IT Systems Manager, our newest Engineer will become a key player within our IT Operations team, responsible for:

  • Build an internal wiki with technical documentation, manuals and IT policies
  • Upgrade systems with new releases and models
  • Develop expertise to train staff on new technologies
  • Conscientiously log, manage and triage service requests within target service levels.
  • Work diligently on assigned projects and tasks.
  • Maintain consistent documentation and help build our Knowledge Base.
  • Perform routine testing to verify the availability of redundant systems.
  • Troubleshoot issues logically and methodically

Skills and Qualifications

We are looking for those who can share in our company goals, values and ethos, who can grow alongside us and whose skills can aid our ongoing success!

By Being One Team, Owning it, Communicating Honestly and showcasing a devotion to Learning, Growing and Innovating, we remain true to our original ethos and ensure we stay true to our Customers, Owners and Colleagues alike.

First and foremost we are interested in those who have the potential to hold these values, as for this position, we ask you to have the following key skills:
  • Experience supporting Windows desktop
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Word & Microsoft Excel or similar
  • Experience administering Active Directory
  • Resourcefulness and problem-solving skills
  • Experience of networking (firewalls, routers, switches, protocols)
  • Experience of Virtualisation
  • Good understanding of enterprise wifi solutions
  • Experience working with call logging/trouble ticket software
  • Experience of cloud-based technologies, particularly AWS or Azure
  • A valid UK Driving Licence

Although standouts will also have:
  • An ITIL qualification would be highly advantageous
  • Experience supporting Linux desktop and OS X
  • Experience of Intune
  • Experience of HP networking
  • Experience of Meraki MX and AP’s
  • Experience in management of NAS appliances
  • VMware ESXi
  • Hyper V
  • Office 365
  • 8x8 or Twilio
  • Scripting (PowerShell/bash) and/or programming (PHP, SQL, etc.)
  • DNS

This is a fantastic opportunity for those with a drive to work as part of a growing team, with ambitions of delivering the best service to valued colleagues across the Forge Holiday Group, growing your exposure to key processes and technologies along the way. If this sounds like you? you love what we are about? or keen to to leap into your latest career challenge, we want to hear from you!

The Forge Holiday Group

The Forge Holiday Group encompasses Sykes Holiday Cottages, Forest Holidays, UKcaravans4hire and Bachcare in New Zealand and unites us under four company values, which are the foundations of every aspect of our business and remain at the heart of everything we do. By Being One Team, Owning it, Communicating Honestly and showcasing a devotion to Learning, Growing and Innovating, we remain true to our original ethos and ensure we stay true to our Customers, Owners and Colleagues alike.

Diversity and Inclusion:

We encourage and welcome our people to bring their authentic and best selves to work every day. We know the power that comes from different ideas, backgrounds and perspectives. We recognise the role diversity plays in achieving our goals as a business. We actively welcome applications from as wide a range of backgrounds as possible. If you need any particular support or accommodations as part of your application process, please get in touch - our recruitment team are happy to help.

Hybrid Working:

We are proud to support hybrid-working across the business, with a mixture or remote and office working available. This will be discussed during your interview.

title: 3rd Line Infrastructure Engineer - Leicester - Up To £55,000
Junior Field Engineer
description:
Description


Summary

We are pleased to offer this entry level opportunity for a engineer with experience supporting clients with first fix on electronics and IT at client sites providing on-site technical assistance, configuring and installing a range of POS solution projects for our customers in the Retail & Hospitality sector

Typically you will be dealing with:
New site openings
Refurbishments
Upgrades
Closures and decommissioning equipment.

This role will require good technical understanding, ideally with experience working with retail or hospitality clients

You will also need to demonstrate some knowledge of IT hardware and basic network operating systems in order to identify problems affecting client sites and assist in the troubleshooting and repair where possible.
Working with award-winning hospitality groups across multiple projects at any given time, you will be supported and have close contact with our project managers and key stakeholders at client sites.

As you will be the visible face of Wanstor at our client sites you will need excellent communication skills, always ensuring you maintain high standards and safety procedures, with the ability to resolve issues and site work quickly and accurately with an eye for detail and maintain a strong customer-focused approach.
This role requires UK travel to various customer sites. Due to the nature of our work, some evenings, nights, and weekend may be required to ensure timely project completion and customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities


During your career with Wanstor, you will develop the skills to :
  • Attending customer sites across the region installing POS hardware, networking and infrastructure equipment.
  • Configure networking devices in line with project requirements including Cisco, Meraki, HP and Fortinet.
  • Assist project managers providing them with technical knowledge on POS systems from advisory setup to potential risks on the project.
  • Take ownership of project milestones to drive project completion on time and on budget.
  • Keep track of all project work progress and maintain company documentation and systems.
  • Prepare and complete detailed and accurate service reports and update documentation on all projects to PMs and Key Stakeholders.
  • Participate in meetings with internal teams and customers.
  • Create operational documentation for project works, supporting user testing and facilitate successful support handover to service desk.
  • Perform analysis and reviews to highlight system and process improvements to ensure efficiency on service and delivery.
  • Provide support to the service desk as required on various tickets relating to retail technology including workstations, servers, printers, networks, and vendor specific hardware and software.
  • Maintain clear communication on all project requests and service desk tickets in a timely manner.
  • Prioritising and implementing any other such requests of medium to high complexity.
  • Providing support to other team members as and when required.


About You


  • Minimum 2 years’ experience as a Field Engineer, ideally working IT technology.
  • Clean driving licence with a suitable vehicle to travel to and from client sites.
  • An interest in developing your technical skills and enjoy the challenge of solving complex issues.
  • Strong organisational and reporting skills in a multi-tasking environment.
  • Able to prioritise workload, remain calm under pressure and focus on solutions.
  • Exceptional communications skills with people at all levels and a strong customer-focused approach.
  • Motivated with an eye for details and a diligent and conscientious approach to your work.
  • Be proactive, forward thinking, and able to contribute to the success of the wider team

Our Benefits


Join our team at Wanstor, where you'll have the opportunity to apply your expertise, drive business growth, and shape the future of our clients' success through emerging technologies. We offer competitive compensation packages, a collaborative work environment, and ample opportunities for professional growth.

Wanstor is a sociable organisation and want to make sure everyone feels part of the team. Below are some of the perks we offer you:
  • Generous Annual Leave: Enjoy a starting annual leave entitlement of 24 days, which increases by 1 day each year, reaching 28 days, in addition to Bank Holidays, L&D time and Volunteering days. Take the time to rest, recharge, and spend quality time with your loved ones.
  • Continuous Learning Opportunities: We prioritise personal and professional development. Attend regular lunch and learn sessions led by both internal experts and external speakers. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to dedicate five days per year to learn something new, enhancing your skills and knowledge.
  • Volunteer Time Off: We believe in giving back to the community. You will have two days per year to participate in volunteer activities of your choice, making a positive impact and contributing to causes that matter to you.
  • Engaging Team Events: Join our friendly and close-knit team. Throughout the year, our social team organises various team events that foster camaraderie and create opportunities for networking and building lasting connections.
  • Modern and Enjoyable Workplace: Our office, located in Borough, provides a pleasant and inspiring work environment. Indulge in a freshly brewed cup of coffee from our great coffee machine and take advantage of our rooftop terrace, where you can unwind and enjoy the sunshine.
  • Private Health Coverage: We prioritise your well-being. As part of our benefits package, we offer Vitality health coverage, ensuring you have access to essential healthcare services and support to maintain your optimal health.


About Wanstor

Wanstor is an award-winning IT Solutions Company celebrating its 22nd year in business. The company has grown year on year and now has a team of over 240 staff. With IT Support Offices in central London and regional field-based IT Support, we are well placed to meet our customers’ needs for a quick response.
We provide a range of hosted and deployed services for customers small and large. Our hosted solutions include hosted Email (Hosted Exchange), Hosted online back-up, Hosted Desktop, and Hosted Network Monitoring. Wanstor provides a full support service which includes a 24-hour helpdesk, network monitoring and on-site support.

Wanstor’s clients provide a wide variety of fascinating opportunities for motivated technical staff. We employ service-oriented technical experts to work within our service team delivering a variety of hosted and deployed solutions.
We are a growing company with dedicated teams managing networks, storage and colocation. Our customers are some of the biggest brand names in the UK, and our consultants are some of the most skilled networking experts in the country.
As a service-centric organisation, we see people as our best competitive advantage as we strive to provide unsurpassed service to our customers. We expect a lot but at the same time are extremely supportive as we look to help realise each person’s potential in building a successful career with Wanstor.

Core Values
We align ourselves to a core set of values & behaviours:
  • Customer Advocates: Put customers at the heart of what you do, to consider their needs with every decision you make
  • Proactive: Leave things better than you found them. Drive change, don’t just talk about it.
  • Growth Mind-set: Learn on reflection, embrace change, and seek to continuously improve. Take opportunities to share knowledge with others
  • Trust: Do what is right, not what is easy. Instil confidence through proactive communication.
  • Winning Teams: Don’t settle for average, inspire others with your ambition and enthusiasm.

title: Electronic Security Engineer - Installation
company: Huntech - Engineering & B2B Sales Recruitment Consultancy

title: IT Apprentice
description:
Level 3 Information Communication Technician

Weekly Hours Worked: 40 Hours – Monday to Friday

About the company:

DIAM is a world leader in the POS, display, merchandising and brand retail services sectors. We create, develop and install Retail & Merchandising solutions to enhance the consumer’s experience in points of sale.

We create retail & merchandising solutions (POS material, store design, shopfitting, niche packaging and digital solutions…) for Brands & Retailers, from design to engineering to production and services, with local proximity & global synergies

We are committed to do better for the future. On all our projects, we make sure to respect a few steps doing systematic LCA and eco design, looking for recycled and materials alternatives, using optimized light systems, and also introducing model changes and creating circular economy.

Brief job description:

Estio Training have an exciting new opportunity for an IT Technician Apprentice with Diam UK LTD, a Retail and Merch Solutions company based in Loughborough.

Job Description:

DIAM UK Ltd are a World leading manufacturing organisation within the Point-of-Sale industry and are looking for an Infrastructure Engineer Apprentice to join their small but busy team based in their Loughborough Office. Ideal candidates will have good knowledge of Windows and Office as well as a great problem-solving approach.

The purpose of this role is to assist the IT Team in all aspects of maintaining and providing IT services to internal users when they experience technical issues, production problems or have general enquiries.

Principal responsibilities:

  • To provide first line support to users for hardware, software, audio-visual, printers and telephone equipment.
  • Assist with the setting up, maintenance and repair of computers and computer related equipment.
  • Install and configure software applications.
  • Produce and maintain IT Checklists and documentation as necessary.
  • Proactively implement the company’s policies and procedures.
  • Maintain the company’s infrastructure and assist with the implementation of new technologies.
  • To undertake any other relevant duties as may be reasonably requested by the IT Manager / Directors.

Desired skills:

  • Good working knowledge of Windows 10/11 and the Microsoft Office suite.
  • Excellent communication and organisation skills.
  • Previous experience of working and performing as part of a team.

Personal qualities:

  • A keen general interest and passion for IT and computer-based systems.
  • A problem-solving approach to issues with a desire to find root causes.
  • Willing to learn.
  • Self-motivated.
  • Presentable and professional at all times.

Qualifications:

5 GCSEs grades A*-C/9-4 or equivalent (including English Language and Maths)

Future prospects:

The role offers a permanent role upon completion of the apprenticeship depending on performance.

Training to be provided:

Estio apprenticeship training programmes are delivered virtually by our fully qualified and industry experienced training team. Using their expert knowledge, we’ve purposefully built our programmes around the real-world use of modern technology, so that the skills we create can be directly applied in the workplace.

Throughout the apprenticeship learners receive coaching, help and guidance from a dedicated team who are there to ensure they get the most from their work experience.

Successful completion of this apprenticeship gives you an accredited Level 3 Information Communications Technician, with training in how to:

  • Efficiently operate and control your ICT infrastructure – physical or virtual hardware, software, network services and data storage.
  • Use infrastructure management tools to automate the provisioning, testing, deployment and monitoring of infrastructure components.
  • Prioritise systems support tasks and monitor and maintaining system performance.
  • Maintain regulatory, legal and professional standards.
  • Support the information systems needs for your business.

IND123

Job Type: Apprenticeship

Salary: £13,312.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you have prior experience of working in a team?
  • Do you have good working knowledge of Windows 10/11 and the Microsoft Office suite?

Education:

  • GCSE or equivalent (required)

Work Location: In person

Reference ID: AL - Diam UK LTD

title: IT Technician
description:
You don’t need to go to university to kickstart your career!
Do you want to be learning whilst you are earning and keeping up to date with the latest technology?

By choosing Primary Goal as your training provider not only will you be learning whilst you're earning you will also be keeping up to date with the latest technology. At the same time, CompTIA learning content is at the heart of our delivery, we will provide you with the knowledge for your Level 3 Information Communications Technician apprenticeship. By using CompTIA practice, learn, and labs provided to you as part of your apprenticeship, you'll be able to prepare yourselves for the following exams:

  • CompTIA A + (Exam 1 and 2)
  • CompTIA Cloud Essentials
We are recruiting on behalf of an IT Support Company where you will gain valuable experience as a Level 3 Information Communications Technician, following the Support Technician pathway. We pride ourselves on the support we give our apprentices, you won’t be left on your own to figure things out, we will support you throughout your apprenticeship journey together with your employer!

The IT Support Apprentice will provide effective and friendly IT Helpdesk/Services operations across the academies in the Northamptonshire cluster. The post holder’s main role will be to provide effective first and at times second line support to customers served by their cluster. The role will require travel within the cluster, for example to provide field technician support. Travel expenses beyond the normal commute to the principal place of work will be reimbursed following receipt of an authorised expenses claim. Normal working hours will be in agreement with the IT Cluster Manager. You may be required to vary your hours to provide IT Support for meetings/events outside of the normal working hours and to complete other IT related work that cannot take place during normal working hours.

As this role is an apprenticeship role, training will be provided to enable the postholder to perform the duties of an IT Support Technician

Main Duties and Responsibilities
  • Performing administrative tasks.
  • Assisting with technical projects when directed.
  • Call answering and logging of support tickets.
  • Using initiative in problem solving.
  • Taking an active interest in IT Support.
  • Diagnosis and resolution of software and hardware incidents.
  • Support the learning of our students by effective use of IT; this could include setting up specialist equipment and other technologies for use in various teaching sessions.

Please note that you MUST be a driver who holds a full UK Driving Licence and access to a vehicle to apply for this role as it will be split across several schools in Kettering, Northampton, and Bugbrooke.

The training you'll be provided with:
  • Comprehensive introductory modules to technical concepts
  • Level 3 Information Communications Technician apprenticeship standard
  • Training for all pathways of your IT career (support technician, network technician, digital communications technician)
  • Specialising in a portfolio of evidence for the Support Technician pathway
  • e-learning training materials
  • Bi-weekly virtual classroom training on all options of the apprenticeships;
  • Access to virtual labs to develop technical competency
  • Monthly work-based coaches visits and competency checks
  • 9 am – 5 pm Support desk for technical support
  • Personal Learning and Thinking Skills and Key Skills development
  • Option for vendor and technical certificates- e.g. CompTIA
You will also have the opportunity to network with a range of other apprentices on our programme who can share ideas, offer suggestions and support. Our apprentices love being able to help each other!
As one of our apprentices you will also have access to our online portal that will provide you with information and technical guidance, as well as links to the helpdesk to speak to technicians who can give real-time advice and support.
We are looking for someone who:
  • Has a true passion for technology
  • Feels confident using hardware, software and other technical devices
  • Has good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Has a passion to learn with enthusiasm and motivation to achieve success
  • Loves helping others and enjoys working with people of all ages
  • Is committed to complete the full apprenticeship programme
  • Has the ability to work well in a team and independently using their own initiative
  • Has a true passion for new and emerging technology. Is enthusiastic about digital developments and has an active interest in IT keeps up to date with current technology and trends

Working Week:
Full time Monday to Friday – 37 hours per week. 8:00am to 4:00pm

Salary:
The salary rate is £14,862.
An allowance of 45p per mile is provided towards travel expenses.

Desired Qualifications:
We require someone who is educated to GCSE standard English and Maths grade 4 (or above), or Functional Skills Level 2 in English and Maths.

Expected Duration:
15 months and 4 Months End Point Assessment

Where a Primary Goal apprenticeship can take you:
This is a great opportunity for you to develop skills that will enhance your networking career. On passing your Primary Goal apprenticeship, you will gain professional recognition for the Register of IT Technician (RITTech).
We also offer a progressive step in some cases, onto our Level 4 Network Engineer apprenticeship programme.
Disability Confident: Primary Goal is committed to being a Disability Confident Training Provider, and as such will make reasonable adjustments required for interview. Please discuss any requirements which you may have with the Recruitment Team.
PLEASE NOTE that we will require a copy of your personal CV.
When completing your CV, please consider the job description and the role you are applying for.

0kaA0HKdHK

title: Senior IT Engineer
description:
Senior IT Engineer
Full time, 37 hours per week
£30893 per annum
Burton on Trent, Town Centre Campus

Who are we looking for?

Working closely with the IT director, you will develop technical solutions in line with operational requirements of the business and that of its associated interests. This will include project management, technical implementation and training of other staff where necessary. You will also act as escalation point for third line support in order to assist with service continuity and SLA compliance across the team.

You will have hands on technical expertise designing, implementing and maintaining network and server infrastructures including Microsoft operating systems, VMware software solutions, storage, switch configuration, firewall and wireless technologies. You will ensure security of the infrastructure is maintained across the business and monitor performance and resource utilisation to proactively identify issues and offer advice on future upgrades and new technical opportunities. This position would suit a friendly, positive individual who understands the demands of working in a customer focused support department.


Applicants should be qualified to, or willing to work towards, Level 2 English and Maths. Evidence of qualifications is required.

For more information please contact human.resources@bsdc.ac.uk

Why come and work for us?

Burton and South Derbyshire College value our employees and have a number of additional benefits to offer the successful applicant:

  • Generous pension schemes for academic and support staff
  • Generous holiday plans
  • Free Employee Assistance Programme
  • Flexible working policies
  • Competitive maternity, paternity and adoption leave
  • Excellent staff training programme, including two staff development days per year
  • On-site nursery with Good Ofsted rating
  • Cycle to Work Scheme
  • Free annual eye tests
  • Access to our onsite gym
  • Staff discounts at our fine dining restaurant, The Mulberry, our Mulberry Bistro and Innovations Hair and Beauty salon

Burton and South Derbyshire College are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture and you should share those values. We would welcome applications from all candidates, including under-represented groups in respect of age, disability, sex, gender or gender identity, ethnicity, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation or transgender status which would reflect our diverse community.

The College is registered with the Disclosure and Barring Service and the successful applicants for this post will be required to apply for the Disclosure at the enhanced level. In addition, internet searches will be undertaken in accordance with the KCSIE guidance. The College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of young people/vulnerable adults and expect all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.

We are committed to a sustainability agenda and are working hard towards achieving a net zero environmental impact. We aim to embed this in our culture with our staff, learners, visitors and suppliers all expected to show dedication towards reducing our carbon footprint.

The closing date for receipt of applications is 12 noon, Wednesday 21st February 2024. Please see our “Work For Us” page on the College website for more information on how to complete the application. Please note late applications are not acceptable.

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
Electrical Engineer - Failure investigation

The company

Since they were established in 60’s, they have specialised in the forensic investigation of the causes of fires, explosions and engineering related failures for insurance, engineering/manufacturing companies and legal clients.

They have a network of offices in the UK and overseas

The Role of a Forensic Electrical Engineer

They wish to recruit Electrical Engineers to train in the forensic investigation of fires, explosions and the failure of electrical equipment and systems.

These positions represent an excellent opportunity to enter a unique profession offering a wide variety of technical challenges and scientific interest in a commercial environment.

Their Requirements for a Forensic Electrical Engineer

· Educated to degree level in Electrical Engineering.

· A Chartered Engineer and Corporate Member of the IET.

· Practical knowledge of electrical installations and equipment.

· Ability to communicate clearly both orally and in writing.

· Where appropriate a relocation package is available

· London Office appointment have London weighting

· highly competitive starting salary

· unparalleled prospects.

· five weeks holiday

· contributory pension schemes

· medical insurance

· life assurance

· permanent health insurance

Charles Francis Cooper celebrates and supports diversity and is committed to ensuring equal opportunities for both employees and applicants.

title: IT Engineer
description:
Job Title: IT Engineer

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to £35,000 per year

Schedule: Monday to Friday, 9 am to 5:30 pm

Work Location: In person.

Exciting opportunity for a full-time IT Engineer to join our client, a thriving global business, with substantial growth potential. As an IT Engineer, you'll kick off as a sole contributor, addressing day-to-day hardware and network issues for users in a varied IT and support landscape. Positioned as the go-to expert on-site, you'll enjoy autonomy to reshape processes and enhance IT support methodologies. This role encourages you to truly personalise it, refining and optimising current workflows to suit your insights. Your success, development, and progression will hinge on your initiative and active participation, allowing you to carve a unique path within the organisation. Seize the chance to make a significant impact, contribute to the evolution of IT support, and shape your role to align with your expertise and aspirations.

Key Responsibilities:

-Technical Support: Act as the first point of contact for IT support, addressing hardware and network-related issues promptly.

-On-Site Maintenance: Engage in hands-on hardware troubleshooting, fixing computers, and resolving technical issues on the floor with colleagues.

- Service Request Management: Manage and prioritise service requests, ensuring timely resolution and maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction.

-Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, colleagues, and other company offices.

-Process Improvement: Review and enhance current IT support processes, enforcing adherence to ensure correct logging and resolution of issues.

-Collaborative Solutions: Collaborate with teams to present and develop new solutions based on insights into current processes, fostering innovation and efficiency.

-Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyse data to identify problem areas, providing valuable insights for continuous improvement.

Experience Required:

- Hands-on experience fixing computers and other hardware.

- Autonomy and independence in resolving IT issues.

- Project or change management experience.

- Proficiency in MS Server.

- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to work to deadlines and within timescales.

- Exceptional organizational and time management skills.

Perks and Benefits:

-Work in a vibrant and fun office environment.

- Enjoy the autonomy in your role with the prospect of building and leading your own team.

- Future opportunities for international travel to offices around the world.

- Competitive salary with potential for incentives.

- Clear path for career progression.

If you are a proactive and experienced IT professional looking for a challenging and rewarding role, apply now to join our team. Be a part of an organization that values innovation, teamwork, and individual growth. Take the next step in your career with us!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £30,000.00-£35,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: IT Support
description:
Job Title: IT Support Technician

We are currently looking to employ a self-motivated and adaptable IT Support Engineer to join us at Kazzoo supporting our clients across the East Midlands. Based in Leicester, but with the need to visit clients on site on a regular basis, this is far from a Helpdesk role. This is a great opportunity with excellent career and personal development prospects. You must have 4 years of experience in a similar position.

Job Role:

  • Diagnose and troubleshoot support requests, over the phone and in person, from a variety of business clients. This could involve guiding them step by step through the process to eradicate the issue themselves, logging in remotely or visiting them on-site where necessary
  • Consistently and reliably deliver on client IT Service Level Agreements
  • Install, configure and manage a broad range of IT solutions
  • Proactively monitor and maintain client’s IT infrastructure ‘health’
  • Assist account managers in the design and specification of IT solutions
  • Support Engineer Responsibilities – providing assistance to junior team members and new staff to ensure overall development of the team

Skills and Experience:

To be considered for this role, you must:

  • Have at least 4 years’ experience in providing IT support services to multiple business clients, within a similar environment
  • Have excellent customer facing skills and the ability to communicate technical issues in a non-technical way
  • Have a full, clean UK driving licence and own vehicle – this is essential
  • Be a quick learner and problem solver
  • Be reliable
  • Fluent in English, both verbal and written
  • Be able to follow written instructions
  • Be able to work as a part of the team as well as on your own
  • Be methodical, process driven and patient
  • Have an excellent telephone manner

We would also expect candidates to have first-hand experience of the following, ideally with appropriate and up-to-date accreditations:

  • Microsoft 365 and/or Office 365 migration and management
  • Microsoft Entra
  • Microsoft Windows Server
  • Active Directory and Group Policy configuration
  • Support of PC and mobile devices
  • Deployment of managed Anti-Virus and Backup solutions
  • Network and firewall infrastructure management, support and deployment
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word and Outlook
  • Cyber security & GDPR awareness

If you have applied for a similar position with us previously, please do not apply.

NO AGENCIES PLEASE

Work Remotely

  • No

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Full driving licence (required)

Expected start date: 01/03/2024

title: 3rd Line Infrastructure Engineer - Leicester - Up To 55,000
Infrastructure Engineer
description:
IT Infrastructure Engineer

Job details

Posted 02 February 2024
Salary £40000 - £45000 per annum
LocationDerby
Job type Permanent
Discipline Infrastructure
ReferenceZJ-39-117
Contact NameZak Jones

Job description

Job Title: IT Infrastructure Engineer
Location: Derby, United Kingdom (Hybrid)
Salary Range: £40,000 - £45,000 per annum (DOE)

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated IT Infrastructure Engineer to join our dynamic team in Leicester. As a key member of our IT department, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining a wide range of cutting-edge technologies to support the organisation's infrastructure. If you have a passion for Microsoft platforms, networking, virtualisation, cloud services, and IT security, along with hands-on experience in automation (ideally PowerShell) and Cisco technologies, this role is for you!

Responsibilities:
  • Utilise your comprehensive understanding and experience with Microsoft platforms, including Exchange Server, Active Directory, SharePoint, and Windows Server operating systems, to design and maintain robust and scalable solutions.
  • Demonstrate a strong knowledge of Storage Area Networks and backup systems to ensure data availability and disaster recovery readiness.
  • Develop and maintain IT disaster recovery plans and business continuity solutions to safeguard against potential disruptions.
  • Showcase your excellent and demonstrable knowledge of PowerShell automation to streamline and automate various IT processes.
  • Configure and maintain Cisco network equipment, investigate complex LAN / WLAN / WAN issues, and resolve networking challenges promptly.
  • Implement and manage servers in clustered VMware or Hyper-V virtualised environments for optimum performance and efficiency.
  • Apply your comprehensive understanding of IT security across network, server, and application layers to safeguard the organisation against potential threats.
  • Experience of working with both on-prem and cloud environments - migration experience from on-prem to Azure would be great.
  • Demonstrate experience in implementing and managing cloud-based platforms and services, particularly Azure, to leverage the benefits of cloud computing.
  • Utilise your experience with Cisco Unified Communication VOIP platform to enhance and support communication solutions.

Additional Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide technical solutions and support various infrastructure initiatives.
  • Stay updated with industry trends and best practices to continuously improve and optimise the organisation's infrastructure.

Requirements:
  • Proven experience as an IT Infrastructure Engineer or a similar role with hands-on experience in the technologies mentioned above.
  • In-depth knowledge of Microsoft platforms, automation (ideally PowerShell), Storage Area Networks, backup systems, Cisco networking, and virtualisation technologies.
  • Strong understanding of IT security principles and best practices.
  • Experience of working with both on-prem and cloud environments - migration experience from on-prem to Azure would be great.
  • Experience with implementing and managing cloud-based platforms such as Azure.
  • Familiarity with Cisco Unified Communication VOIP platform is highly desirable.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex IT issues efficiently.
  • Relevant certifications in Microsoft, Cisco, VMware, or other related technologies are a plus.

Why Work with Us:
  • Competitive salary within the range of £40,000 - £45,000, depending on your skills and experience.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement in a fast-paced and innovative environment.
  • Engage in exciting projects that leverage a wide range of cutting-edge technologies.
  • Collaborative and supportive team culture with a focus on work-life balance.
  • Modern and comfortable office space located in the heart of Leicester with easy access to public transport.
  • Additional benefits package, including health insurance, pension, and generous holiday allowance.
If you have a comprehensive understanding and experience in Microsoft platforms, networking, virtualisation, cloud services, IT security, and Cisco technologies, along with some type of automation skills, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and be a part of shaping the future of our IT infrastructure solutions.

How to Apply:
To apply for this position, please send your updated CV and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you believe you are a suitable candidate for this role. Feel free to email your application to zak@digitalwaffle.co

title: Senior Controls Engineer
description:
Kindeva is a leading global contract developer and manufacturer (CDMO) with delivery platform expertise in Autoinjector, Inhalation, Transdermal/Intradermal Patch Technologies. We partner with our customers to improve patient outcomes around the world. Together, as One Team, we will manufacture many more tomorrows.

Ready to be part of a team with purpose? Look no further, we are hiring for a talented Senior Controls Engineer to join our Loughborough team.
This individual will provide technical support, manage and maintain equipment, including lifecycle of equipment, which is used to monitor and control machinery, systems, and processes to both Plant Engineering and a 24/7 Manufacturing and Packaging operation.

Responsibilities:
Working with suppliers to specify, control & monitor electrical design & software supply in line with relevant Kindeva, ISO and Regulatory / GMP standards.
  • Lead the development & revisions of Kindeva UK standards in line with industry standards.
  • Ensure compliance with relevant health and safety regulations and quality standards.
  • LD File responsibilities as assigned.
  • Functional Safety & PUWER
  • Support Site Change Management and control of Validated control systems
  • Keep abreast of Evolving Regulatory Standards within the Pharma Industry,
  • Supplier selection & order placement in line with Kindeva requirements
  • Development of project scope, specifications, program and estimated cost along with control system design and software development for bespoke manufacturing equipment
  • Writing Computer Software and Test procedures
  • Designing and developing new controls systems
  • Testing Maintaining and Modifying existing Controls Systems
  • Software Management System Maintenance
  • Schedule and cost management including supervision / leadership of design reviews, acceptance testing, installation & commissioning.
  • Support manufacturing teams in understanding improvement opportunities and development of concepts
  • Maintain and provide continuous Improvement activities to the Loughborough site Plant, Operational Technology network and controls systems.
  • Provide technical support and fault finding for Operational Technology (OT) Network and PLC systems within Plant and Operations
  • Firewall maintenance
  • Testing, maintaining, and modifying existing systems.
  • Drive Continuous Improvement
  • Manage and execute specific assigned projects whilst balancing workload against priorities as required.
  • Support site operations SCADA Systems
  • Share knowledge with competent members of the team to aid 24/7 working
Qualifications:
  • HNC or above qualification in electrical or control disciplines
  • Industry qualifications desired including: IEC 61131, Recognised Functional Safety (e.g. TUV)
Experience:
  • Minimum expectation of 5 years relevant industry experience.
  • Working knowledge of relevant industry & regulatory standards including: IEC 61131, 62061 & 61508, GAMP 5, ISA-88, 21 CFR & Annex 11, ISO 13849.
  • Experience of project management & budget control desirable.
Skills / Knowledge:
  • Proven technical ability in design & programming of Rockwell Automation based control systems including PLC, Scada, Drives and motion control.
  • Vision systems experience preferable, (Cognex/ Keyence etc)
What we will give to you:
Attractive compensation package
Company pension scheme (up to 10% employer contribution)
25 days holiday per year (plus bank holidays) plus service days after 5 years
Company sick pay
Employee Assistance Program with 24/7 confidential helpline support for employee and immediate family
Life assurance of four times life cover salary
Flexible working hours
Wellness programmes
Employee recognition program
Employee development
Free on-site parking
Discount and cashback at many retailers
Cycle to work scheme
Flu vaccinations
Employee referral scheme

title: Test Engineer
description:
Job Introduction

To undertake routine, type, and special tests on Power Transformers between 33 and 132kv.Also be responsible for managing customers during FAT as well as following international and national standards.

Main Responsibilities
  • Responsible for carrying out all the routine tests, type tests and special tests on the Power Transformer as per the International and National Standards.
  • Perform in process testing at various stages of manufacturing.
  • Complete and maintain test record sheets.
  • Ensuring and maintaining calibration of all the test equipment.
  • Analysing and fault finding for partial discharge test failures
  • Fault finding/investigations as required by design or production.
  • Able to prepare test procedure/ITPs as per customer requirement
  • Responsible for the maintenance of the test equipment and various high voltage test gears like generators, transformers, switchgears used for carrying out the tests on the transformers.
  • Assist the test manager in planning of the daily and weekly testing activity.
  • Responsible for carrying out customer witness testing.
  • Raise non-conformance records for all non-compliant components including sign off where required.
  • Responsible for training and support for Apprentices, Test Engineers and other members of the team.
  • Support in the creation of risk assessments and safe working procedures.
  • Support with regards to purchase of new or replacement equipment using areas of expertise
Person Specification

Qualifications

  • Minimum qualifications Bachelor of Electrical Engineering/ relevant alternative

Skills

  • Knowledge of impulse test and partial discharge testing on transformers.
  • Knowledge of heat run test results calculation.
  • Competent user of Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.
  • Sound understanding of electrical circuits and IEC/ENAT/ANSI Standards.
  • Distribution/Power Transformer Testing background
  • Good interpersonal & communication skills.
  • Good team player.
  • Flexible approach (shift work may apply, including nights).
  • Understanding & working to engineering drawings/specifications.
  • Good understanding of quality and inspection standards.
  • Problem solver with a methodical approach and an eye for detail.
  • The attitude and will to want to make a difference.

Experience

  • Mechanical fitting advantageous.
  • Previous experience working to critical tolerances.
  • Previous experience in a busy manufacturing/engineering environment.
About Us

BRUSH Transformers provide agile and adaptive engineering solutions and products, including consultancy services, design, and project management as well as award-winning product technology, to a wide range of projects.

A chosen partner for national and regional power generation and distribution network operators, through innovation and a commitment to delivering solutions that address grid-resilience and drive system change, we support the global drive to net-zero, helping create a future-proof Infrastructure.
