title: Temp to Perm Security Systems Engineer– South Yorkshire
Fire & Security Small Works Installation Engineer - Ref23395
Security Installation Engineer (Access Control, CCTV & Intruder)
Delivery Engineer
description:
ICT Service Delivery Engineer. Full Time. 37 Hours Per Week. Permanent.

We are seeking to appoint an experienced ICT Service Delivery Engineer to join our Infrastructure Support Team. In this role you will develop and manage the College network / telecoms systems and ICT infrastructure, always ensuring robust and reliable services that support the needs of the College staff and students.

The team is a highly technical and experienced department within the College, supporting and developing an extensive range of ICT facilities, working within an ITIL framework to support a diverse user community.

To be successful you must hold the following:

  • A Degree or equivalent in a related discipline, or demonstrate a range of relevant experience within an enterprise network environment, significant and proven technical support experience, together with a desire to resolve issues to root cause under minimum supervision.
  • Minimum Level 2 qualification in Maths and English (GCSE Grade C or above, GCSE Grade 4 or above, or equivalent).

The role requires a clear analytical logical approach to problem solving along with good interpersonal and communication skills. The ability to work independently and as part of a diverse technical team across multiple sites is essential to the role.

Experience in Microsoft Windows Server operating systems is essential, whilst the following technologies would be desirable: O365 Management, VMWare, Meraki, Fortinet/Fortigate Firewalls and SCCM. Experience of managing, deploying and maintaining Layer 3 networks is also advantageous.

We strive for excellence within the team, continually looking for ways to improve our resiliency, security and operational availability. With a program of continuous improvement, the successful candidate will become part of a team where personal/ professional development is a cornerstone of the role, and the opportunity to learn new technologies and skills.

Closing Date: 3 March 2024

Interview Date : W/C 11 March 2024

Benefits we offer:

  • 41 days holiday
  • Membership of the Local Government Pension Scheme
  • Discounted shopping and rewards
  • Wellbeing services and support
  • On-site nurseries
  • Excellent training and development opportunities

Principals Welcome and about Leicester College

Safeguarding in Recruitment Policy

Applicant Guidance

Equality & Diversity Policy

Employee Benefits Booklet

We are one of the largest Further Education Colleges in the UK with more than 20,000 students studying with us on a wide range of courses. Our mission is to equip people with the skills they need to be successful in education, in work and business and in their personal lives.


Leicester College is proud of its diverse workforce and welcomes applications from the whole community.


Leicester College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the wellbeing of our students, we expect all staff to share this commitment. Background checks including current and latest employer references and an enhanced DBS check will be required for this role.


If you decide to apply for this post, keep a copy of these details, as they will no longer appear on this web site once the post is closed.

Please note all vacancies close at midnight on the closing date specified.


We aim to complete shortlisting for this role within 5 days after the closing date. You will be contacted via the email address you provide on your application form as to the outcome of your application. Please remember to check your spam email box if you haven’t heard from us.


Please ensure you complete in full all sections of the application form as we do not accept CVs or other forms of supplementary information.


Data Protection

Leicester College take the security of your data seriously and have internal policies and controls in place to ensure that your data is protected.

By entering your details you are allowing us to access and use the information you provide for recruitment purposes. We will not share your information with any third parties outside of our agreements.

Your data will be saved periodically before you reach the end of the application form. This is to help you if you want to complete the form over a number of visits and to limit data loss as a result of a technical issue such as an accidental browser closure or a loss of internet connection.

We will store your details for a period of 12 months, initially for use in the recruitment process and thereafter in an anonymised format to allow us to complete recruitment statistics. Your personal details will be deleted automatically once the data retention limit is reached.

For more information on how we use your information see our privacy statement.

Should you wish to remove your details prior to automatic deletion or for any other queries about your information is handled, please contact us on 0116 2295553 or via email hrenquiries@leicestercollege.ac.uk

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Who are we?

We provide products and services that are already improving the operational delivery of rail services. Our vision is to create a truly connected rail network, using our deep technology expertise and rail industry experience to deliver game-changing solutions that improve the quality of transport across the UK and beyond. We are a company that is excited by the possibilities offered by technology and are driven by improving experiences for passengers globally.

We have consistently innovated to create a best in the market product, delivering high levels of automation into complex operational environments. We continue to evolve our offer and recently integrated our technology with our own Traffic Management System; an operational and technical first. Our service offer continues to grow, taking advantage of technologies including cloud and data analytics.

To make this happen, we are seeking a highly skilled and versatile Infrastructure Engineer (to join our DevOps team) with a strong background in Linux servers (Ubuntu/Redhat) and AWS cloud to join our dynamic infrastructure team. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring the seamless operation, optimization, and automation of our application stack.

What are the key objectives?

  • Ensure our on-prem infrastructure and AWS cloud estate are ready and available to support our teams, digital services, and customers at all times
  • Provision environments and services that are used by our customers as well as our development, engineering, and test teams
  • Assist in deploying product updates, locating production errors, and building integrations that improve users’ experience
  • Create, manage, and maintain the Infrastructure as Code for the project, deploy and update docker stacks to a docker swarm, ensuring lab configurations as well as involvement in updating, rolling back the product version etc. This work is approximately 80% on-prem and 20% cloud based

Requirements

Personally, we are looking for:

  • An excellent problem-solver who shows initiative to deliver on their promises
  • A team player, not afraid to step out of their role where it is best for the team
  • Someone who is assured and approachable, able to build relationships and collaborate with others
  • Someone highly motivated, organised and able to manage their workload and commitments
  • A technical background with a keen attention to detail
    • Comprehensive communication skills

Technically, we are looking for someone who can hit the ground running, bring valuable insights and has demonstrated experience of:

  • Environment/Infrastructure Management, including provisioning and support for hardware, software, data, and network
  • Systems Administration Support, Security; User management; Upgrades/Patching; Scripting / Process Automation e.g. Ansible; Monitoring and System Analytics
  • Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment

Great to have, but not essential:

  • Worked with AWS Cloud services such as EC2 and S3, using CloudFormation and Terraform.
  • YAML based Azure DevOps pipelines.
  • Understanding of JSON language
  • AWS SysOps and Cloud Architecture Certifications
  • Advocate for DevOps culture and practices with Product and Project teams
  • Manage work items in Agile delivery lifecycle including updates to work items and active participation in ceremonies

Benefits

So that you can thrive both in and out of work we offer the following benefits on top of a competitive salary that rewards you for the value you bring:

  • Flexible working with a minimum requirement of one day in the office each week.
  • 27 days annual leave in addition to public holidays.
  • 3 “privilege days” scheduled between Christmas/New Year.
  • Pension plan with matched contributions from 5%-8%.
  • Private Healthcare that covers you and your immediate dependents.
  • Group Income Protection cover.
  • Life Assurance.
  • Enhanced maternity, paternity, and adoption policies.
  • Monthly divisional days that bring the whole team together.
  • Tailored and supported training and development to further your career.

This role could be based in Derby, Milton Keynes, or London. We have a flexible, hybrid approach to work and work location - so please talk to us about your preferences and how these could work for both you and the team. We do require everyone to be in one of our offices at least once a week. We provide this flexibility to enable you to work most effectively.

title: Design Manager
description:
The Opportunity

Redefine your personal best.

As part of continued growth across UK & Ireland, we are looking to recruit Design Lead / Design Manager / Project Technical Lead at all career levels.

In this role you will lead our strong multi-disciplinary team, delivering diverse and challenging projects for a range of Water Industry clients. You will work closely with our commercial team to deliver projects and you will be responsible for the efficient delivery of quality design outputs, to programme and to cost.

At Stantec, you will have the opportunity to work in some of the UK water industry’s most complex and engaging projects, delivering designs that will shape the way we manage water and wastewater for our local communities, using innovative and sustainable methods. Projects / clients Stantec have been involved with include:

  • Thames Water – Stantec have managed all HS2 design assurance for Thames Water, London Infrastructure design & build contract, and multiple engineering studies and assessments for Thames Water across both Infrastructure & non-Infrastructure deliver streams (Thames Water London Plan 2100 (stantec.com))
  • Northumbrian Water – Stantec is a strategic solutions partner to Northumbrian Water have been involved with delivering a major scheme in Essex (Abberton Reservoir)
  • Southern Water – Stantec is a Strategic Solutions Partner to Southern Water and are working together on an iconic water project – Water for Life Hampshire (Water for Life – Hampshire (southernwater.co.uk)
  • Severn Trent Water – Stantec have a well-established framework supporting Severn Trent with their major schemes.
  • South West Water, Welsh Water and Wessex Water – Stantec has been appointed on several frameworks and working on major projects.

Your wellbeing is important to us – we offer a hybrid way of working where you can select from one of our many offices around the UK & Ireland. In addition, we will cater for any of your development needs – we will fully support you in gaining extra qualifications or accreditations that will help you better your career.

About you

To be considered for this opportunity you must be degree qualified (or equivalent) in a relevant subject, be chartered (or approaching charter status) with a engineering institution. If you are pursuing chartership, with an engineering institution e.g. ICE, CIWEM, IMechE. This is something we can support you on.

In addition, you’ll have a passion for the water industry and environment sector and supporting our developing engineers. You will also have experience in successful project delivery and working collaboratively with project teams to develop innovative design solutions.

About Stantec

Stantec is a professional services firm. Our team of 25,000 global experts provides engineering, architecture, environmental, and project management services across all phases of the project life cycle and many sectors. We’re designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.

From large-scale developments to challenging neighbourhood projects, we stretch across our global network to learn from others, offer our support, and gain new experiences along the way. So, while we work to help the communities around us thrive, our own people thrive too.

Stantec provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for future and current employment and prohibit discrimination on the grounds of race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. Stantec is in compliance with laws and regulations and ensures equitable opportunities in all aspects of employment.

At Stantec we are committed to ensuring our recruitment process is accessible to all. If you require reasonable adjustments to be made during the recruitment process, then please inform a member of our Talent Acquisition team.

ReqID: 4966

title: Production Engineer
description:
How does working in a state of the art facility for an iconic brand sound to you? No one day will be the same as they have a very healthy pipeline of new projects. Also, not only is their work interesting, but they are passionate about looking after the team and their benefits scheme reflects this. It includes life assurance, increased pension, car scheme and a number of heavily discounted products.

The Role;
You will be a key member in the production engineering team, coming with a wealth of CNC machining and programming knowledge. You will be the bridge between the shopfloor and the design office, ensuring all the design work have job packs, process sheets and the correct routing for the machinists on the shopfloor. This will be a role that is office based with some duties on the shopfloor, ensuring programs are proved out at the machine. The programming will be done manually on Fanuc controls due to the type of work being produced. There is a production engineering team, with some members you will be helping to mentor and provide your expertise to them.

What you will need;
  • Strong understanding of CNC machining & programming
  • Knowledge of CAD – 2D drawings in particular
  • Worked closely with machinists to ensure programs are correct and proven out for them to machine the components.

If this sounds like a bit of you and you would like to know more about the business/role, please click apply and Chris Smith will be in touch to go through the details with you. Even if your CV isn’t fully up to date, he can help you fill in the blanks!

Job Ref: CS 1269

title: Software Engineer
description:
About the business:
LexisNexis Risk Solutions is the essential partner in the assessment of risk. Within our Insurance vertical, we provide customers with solutions and decision tools that combine public and industry specific content with advanced technology and analytics to assist them in evaluating and predicting risk and enhancing operational efficiency. Our insurance risk solutions help drive better data-driven decisions across the insurance policy lifecycle – all while reducing risk. You can learn more about LexisNexis Risk at the link below.
https://risk.lexisnexis.com/insurance

About our team:
  • We are focused on building high quality software to meet the challenges of our industry, creating systems to serve transactions at high volume to our business partners.
  • We create teams of innovative, enthusiastic software engineers to build systems to transform our industry.
  • We use a variety of technologies and are creating our next generation of services based on microservice architecture.
About the job:
  • This is a hands-on coding role, part of a cross functional team, working with other developers, quality, and operations engineers.
  • You’ll be working on the development of new products and product enhancements, delivering multiple different sources of data to our customers.
  • You'll be involved with design, documentation, support and implementation of new microservices as well as maintaining the current services.
You’ll be responsible for:
  • Interface with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.
  • Write and review of detailed specifications for the development of system.
  • Work closely with other development team members to understand product requirements and translate them into software designs.
  • Successfully implement development processes, coding best practices, and code reviews.
  • Implementing Agile processes, tools, and techniques to build efficiency, deliver value and shape best-practice in collaboration with key stakeholders.
  • Completing bug fixes and resolving technical issues to ensure quality and performance.
  • Levelling up our engineering practices by mentoring engineers, sharing knowledge and learning across our organization.
  • Keep abreast of new technology developments.
  • All other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
  • Java Development experience
  • Spring Boot framework experience
  • Web Services (SOAP, RESTful)
  • Test Driven Development
  • Ability to work well with internal and external technology resources.
  • Keen to learn new technology and adapt to change.
  • Strong written and oral communication skill
  • Good team player, interactive, be able to work well with other team members.
  • Creative, problem solver, innovative, can actively participate to give ideas / solutions.
  • Being able to help other team members.
  • Degree in Computer Science, related discipline, or relevant experience
Preferred skills:
  • Kubernetes / Docker
  • Github workflow
  • AWS, incl Terraform.
  • Agile / SCRUM
  • PHP, SQL, XML
Women in technology:
LexisNexis® Risk Solutions is very supportive of women in Technology and has been a founding signature for the Tech Talent Charter. Currently 26.2% of our Technology workforce are women which is much higher than the UK average of 17%. We have the following initiatives in place to support women in technology:
  • Mentoring scheme for women in technology
  • Women’s network forum
  • Regularly run events for schools girl about careers in technology to inspire the next generation of girls in tech.
Culture and benefits:
Learn more about the LexisNexis Risk team and how we work
here
#LI-Hybrid
#LI-SJ1
At LexisNexis Risk Solutions, having diverse employees with different perspectives is key to creating innovative new products for our global customers. We have 30 diversity employee networks globally and prioritize inclusive leadership and equitable processes as part of our culture. Our aim is for every employee to be the best version of themselves. We would actively welcome applications from candidates of diverse backgrounds and underrepresented groups.
We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form:

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
About the role:

About Us:

Holland and Barrett, a leader in health and well-being retail, invites talented individuals to join our IT Infrastructure team as Infrastructure Engineer. This is a unique opportunity to become part of a company that prioritizes health, personal growth, and the forefront of digital transformation and innovation.

Job Description:

As an Infrastructure Engineer at Holland and Barrett, you will play a pivotal role in supporting and driving our IT infrastructure forward. This role encompasses both 3rd line BAU support and the leadership of infrastructure projects that are instrumental in promoting business innovation and growth. Holland and Barrett is currently in the midst of a transformation, transitioning into a 'cloud-first' organization, making it an exciting time to be a part of our IT team.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Develop, document, and communicate strategic plans for IT infrastructure investments, including cost reduction opportunities.
  • Offer expertise and guidance in cloud/on-premise solutions to the wider IT team and business.
  • Provide support for existing infrastructure components such as Windows servers, VMWare, scripting, Exchange On-prem, Office 365, Azure, and Intune.
  • Collaborate closely with the networking team to troubleshoot IT infrastructure issues.
  • Work in tandem with Cyber Security to implement and monitor cloud and on-premises security measures and threat detection.
  • Independently manage your workload, proactively addressing requests through the ITSM tool, and mentoring and developing fellow engineers.
  • Create comprehensive technical documentation, especially concerning security standards and new solutions.
  • Contribute to broader business initiatives and projects as needed.
  • Evaluate ongoing projects, milestones, and priorities.
  • Regularly review and enhance existing infrastructure through thorough checks and assessments.
  • Offer support to the IT Service Desk, either by resolving escalated calls or providing training and assistance.

Key requirements:

Technical Skills:

  • Azure integration (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS) and policy expertise.
  • Azure, Microsoft Intune, and cloud migration experience.
  • Microsoft products, VMWare, security, and SQL knowledge.
  • Email security (Mimecast, SPF, DMARK, DKIM).
  • Networking protocols (TCP/UDP/ROUTING/DNS).
  • Versatile in data center, virtualization, and security.
  • SAN/NAS storage and IBM hardware backup.
  • Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS/DFS/DHCP administration.
  • 24x7 on-call support.
  • End-to-end architecture for business and technical alignment.
  • Linux and scripting familiarity.
  • Azure AD and Office 365 proficiency.

People Skills:

  • Adaptability and flexibility in a fast-paced environment.
  • Effective communication with colleagues at all organizational levels.
  • Ability to convey technical ideas and projects to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Quick assimilation of new technologies.
  • Capable of guiding technical colleagues, documenting solutions, and fixes effectively.

What we offer:

  • Pension company contribution = 3%
  • Incentive scheme up to 10% of annual salary, based on company performance.
  • Your wellbeing is paramount so you can get away and take 33 Days Holiday per year.
  • Learning and Development opportunity with Holland & Barrett is a great base for career development long term.
  • Private Medical Care (Self after 1 year)
  • Career progression.
  • Refer and Earn Scheme - as we're growing you can earn money by referring people to join us from your network.
  • Epic Extras gives you access to exclusive benefits, free advice and savings from a range of retailers and providers.
  • Stay healthy with Discounted Products - from day one you'll get a 25% discount (on top of other promotions) when you shop at H&B on anything that you buy.
  • We all need a little help sometimes, so we offer Free 24/7 Confidential Advice & Colleague Welfare.
  • Mental Health First Aiders - we have lots of qualified Mental Health First Aiders because its all about your health & wellbeing.
  • Stay active in the Onsite Gym at our Nuneaton Hub!
  • We have colleague Reward and Recognition Schemes, so your hard work and loyalty won't go unnoticed.
  • And many more!

We're passionate about helping every colleague thrive across all dimensions of wellbeing, and we're committed to having a diverse and inclusive workplace. In line with our EPIC values (Expertise, Pioneering, Inclusive, Caring), we embrace and actively celebrate all our colleagues unique and varying experiences, backgrounds, identities and cultures - I am me, we are H&B.

title: Senior Civil Designer
description:
Redefine your personal best.

Stantec is working in partnership with a number of UK Contractors to deliver innovative, sustainable and efficient solutions across regulated water programmes and projects. We are looking for individuals who think differently and love to challenge conventional thinking to join us in a growing, collaborative team of like minded engineers working to meet the unprecedented industry-wide efficiency and net zero challenges.

Currently we are looking for a Senior Civil Engineers to join our dynamic team, supporting the delivery of a variety of Design & Build projects as part of major capital investment programmes. Day to day you will provide technical solutions, develop detailed designs, mentor and develop other engineers and support Project Managers and Team Leaders. You will provide technical expertise to ensure that projects are delivered to cost, schedule, technical and quality standards to meet both Partner and Stantec expectations.

This is an exciting opportunity for you to join a global engineering firm that are expanding in the UK. You will work within professional and collaborative teams all with the same aim of delivering world class solutions for our clients and the communities around us. On a personal level, you will learn and develop, and our goal is to aid your career progression and increase your job satisfaction. You will be supported and guided by senior members of the Stantec team to enable you to realise your potential and prosper within the company.

You can find out more about our work in the water sector here: Stantec H2O+U - UK

About you

To be considered for this opportunity you must be degree qualified (or equivalent) in Civil Engineering or other relevant subject. You will also ideally be an Incorporated or Chartered member of a relevant engineering institution e.g. ICE, CIWEM.

Ideally, you’ll have previous experience of developing detailed designs, working in a Design and Build environment, leading and developing civil engineers and managing other technical professionals to achieve holistic technical outcomes. Most importantly, you’ll embody our values and ethos of client focus and service excellence.

We are seeking civil engineers across all areas of water and wastewater infrastructure / networks and treatment. Due to the nature of upcoming projects, ideally, you will also have experience in one or more of these technical areas:

  • Sustainable Urban Drainage and Surface Water Management
  • Trunk Mains and Large Diameter Pipeline Design
  • Service Reservoirs
  • Clean Water Treatment

Why Join Us

This is an exciting time to join Stantec, with the opportunity to tackle challenging new projects across the region and growth plans extending throughout the next AMP cycle. In addition, all employees have access to our company wide benefits, including:

  • Individualised development plan alongside company wide org structure highlighting pathway for progression, ensuring you always know where your career is heading
  • Mentoring & support from senior staff to help you realise your potential
  • Private medical insurance, group income protection & life assurance included as standard
  • Flexi-working and hybrid working pattern to help you to find the right work life balance for you
  • Lucrative employee referral scheme
  • Culture of inclusivity, where we celebrate diversity and put “doing what’s right” at the forefront of everything we do
  • Award winning consultancy with a commitment to achieving our ambitious environmental goals

Find out more about why Stantec could be the right next step for you here!

About Stantec

Stantec is a professional services firm. Our team of 26,000 global experts provides engineering, architecture, environmental, and project management services across all phases of the project life cycle. We’re designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.

From large-scale developments to challenging neighbourhood projects, we stretch across our global network to learn from others, offer our support, and gain new experiences along the way. So while we work to help the communities around us thrive, our own people thrive too.

Stantec provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for future and current employment and prohibit discrimination on the grounds of race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. Stantec is in compliance with laws and regulations and ensures equitable opportunities in all aspects of employment.

At Stantec we are committed to ensuring our recruitment process is accessible to all. If you require reasonable adjustments to be made during the recruitment process then please inform a member of our Talent Acquisition team.

title: Workshop Engineer
description:
Job Title – Workshop Engineer

Location – Nottingham

Salary – Circa £32,000 - £42,000 OTE DOE

About Us

Hydro International, a CRH Company, is a leading global provider of advanced products, services and expertise to help municipal, industrial and construction customers to improve their water management processes, increase operational performance and reduce environmental impact. With over 40 years of experience and a reputation for engineering excellence, businesses, and public bodies all over the world rely on our products, services and integrated solutions to reduce flood risk, improve water treatment and protect the environment from water pollution. We have a network of over 80 distribution partners and serve customers in more than 40 countries. As part of CRH Infrastructure Products, we are leading the water management industry with innovative, sustainable solutions and a safety-first mindset.

The Workshop Engineer will be working within Hydro International's UK Wastewater Services (UKWWS) team. We support water utility companies by improving sewage sites across the United Kingdom.

We are looking for an experienced/qualified Mechanical Engineer to join us at our Nottingham branch.

In this job you will…

- Work in our new Nottingham branch which covers the East Midlands and surrounding areas.

- Responsible for all workshop repairs / refurbishments ensuring work is kept to the agreed quote in terms of monetary value & time.

- Responsible for the compliance and examinations of lifting equipment.

- Maintain a safe and clean environment and ensure staff use all safe procedures and equipment as prescribed in appropriate risk assessment.

- Be prepared to work away if required / attend callouts.

- To mentor new engineers within the workshop environment and oversee when working in the workshop.

- Work as a team with other staff and trades within the business.

- CSCS card

- Previous engineering / electrical qualifications (G & G / Apprenticeship) including welding.

- Good communicator both written and verbal.

- Willingness to work outside of normal hours if required.

description:

Installation and Maintenance of EPoS Systems throughout the UK. The successful applicant must enjoy travelling with regular overnight stays.

As part of our Systems team, you will need to be happy to work by yourself and as part of a team, feel confident conversing with customers both on site and over the phone, be friendly and have excellent communication skills. A customer focused approach is essential.

This is an office based role with frequent travel and overnight stays.

title: IT Systems Engineer
description:
As a family-owned business our people are central to our success, and following years of organic, consecutive growth, we’re looking for people who share our core values of sustainability, trust, collaboration, and innovation to drive us forwards.Software never stays the same and neither do we. We want our people to be part of a progressive organisation, encouraged to embrace change and new ideas to shape our future development. Your input is vital, which is why we’re committed to personalised learning paths for every employee to help you, and us, grow. Our goal is to make the world of work easier as a leader in the HR, payroll, finance, and integration solutions software and services industry. We’re proud to design and develop some of the best business solutions like iTrent and People First to support our customers’ people-related challenges across every vertical.

Looking for the place where you can belong? Join MHR and help us shape the world of work.Are you an experienced and passionate IT System Engineer looking for a new and exciting opportunity? As we continue to expand our services, we are seeking a skilled and motivated IT System Engineer to join our in-house IT team. Do you thrive on building and supporting cutting-edge IT infrastructure solutions? If so, we have the perfect role for you!

As an IT System Engineer with us, you will be at the forefront of our technological advancements. Your responsibilities will include:Work as part of the team that supports our successful 850 user technology business.
Manage Microsoft Active Directory and Azure Active Directory and InTune solutions for seamless user management.
Manage VMWare /ESX virtualization infrastructure: physical and virtual.
Manage SAN storage Solutions.
Manage and maintain backups, replications and recovery procedures.
Diagnose and troubleshoot network problems.
Manage Microsoft Exchange and Exchange Online.
Supporting and designing Office 365 infrastructure and solutions, empowering our teams to work collaboratively and efficiently.
Provide 3rd line and senior support for complex issues.
Providing cross platform solutions to business needs and problems.
Work closely with third-party support companies and suppliers to resolve issues promptly.
Maintain and produce accurate IT documentation, ensuring efficient knowledge sharing.
Contribute to departmental improvement plans, with a focus on automation and process enhancement.
Mentor and assist IT support team members, fostering their professional development.
Engage in continuous learning activities to stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies.
Provide on-call support as part of a support Rota to ensure the uninterrupted operation of critical systems.

Desired Skills and Experience:Working knowledge of computer networking and Cisco technologies.
Familiarity with SAN (Storage Area Network) systems.
Proficiency in VMWare and Hyper-V hypervisor platforms.
Expertise in data centre infrastructure and monitoring.
Experience with Windows & Linux Server systems.
Knowledge of Office 365 infrastructure configuration.
Familiarity with PowerShell scripting.
Experience as a point of contact for technical escalation.
Previous involvement in mentoring staff.
Exposure to Azure Services.
Knowledge of backup strategies.
Familiarity with telephony solutions.
Ability to create technical configuration documentation.

Benefits to support you personally and professionally

Alongside the opportunity to work with an incredible team and express your individuality, we offer a range of personalised benefits including: Access to over 60 internal training courses, professional qualifications, and cross-departmental mentoring and coaching programs
24/7 access to a GP through SmartHealth for you and your family, confidential mental health support, and paid sick leave
Ability to purchase or sell additional holiday days beyond the standard 25 days and bank holidays
Discounts and cashback on leisure, travel, technology, fashion, gym memberships, and food
Monthly employee recognition program and departmental awards
Referral bonus scheme of up to £2,000
Employee-led social events such as running clubs, football teams, book clubs, and bake-offs
On-site subsidised restaurants offering a variety of fresh meals daily
Opt-in benefits schemes such as private medical insurance and dental coverage
We value the well-being, financial stability, and inclusivity of our employees, and strive to provide a supportive working environment.

As one of the world’s leading companies in the renewable energy space in Europe and Australia, RWE Renewables Europe & Australia is proud to be paving the way for a greener future. We’re well set to hit our 50 GW by 2030 target, and go climate neutral by 2040. That’s thanks to our community of experts currently building Europe and Australia’s largest onshore wind farms – as well as a pipeline of exciting projects across solar and PV. And the focus isn’t just on harnessing clean energy – but also the new technologies that can push our GW ever higher.

Your energy has impact, use it for good.

title: Network Engineer
description:
Become a change maker and join Node4.

Node4 have a committed, talented, and diverse workforce that is growing all the time, but as we expand through our own growth and acquisitions, we never lose sight of the most important part of our business - our people. We want you to grow, learn, and evolve alongside us. So, whether you're just starting out in your career or looking to progress as an industry professional, Node4 has a place for you.

About the role

As a Network Engineer, you will play a vital role in ensuring the stability, security, and scalability of our network infrastructure. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and maintain network solutions that meet the unique requirements of our clients. Your expertise will contribute to the successful delivery of projects and the overall growth of our organisation.

Working as part of a customer facing delivery team you will be responsible for provisioning services and delivering customer projects providing end-to-end solutions comprising of WAN, LAN, WLAN & Security. This role requires the delivery of network services from Node4 Data Centres though to customers sites over Node4s service provider infrastructure. Integrating these solutions with other services such as public cloud, private cloud and collaboration

What will you bring?

  • Confident, self-assured ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Strong analytical ability to support complex problem solving and presentation of issues and solutions into focused, structured content for both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Exceptional customer facing skills that promote a positive, collaborative, and productive professional relationship
  • Demonstrable professional experience with multiple networking technologies at an advanced professional specialism in at least one technology, including evidenced delivery and operational support experience with varied and complex environments and critical infrastructure with demanding SLAs
  • Evidenced direct ownership responsibility for network projects delivering against critical success factors
  • Experience with popular networking technologies in service provider and enterprise environments
  • Evidenced comprehensive design, implementation, configuration & support of service provider and enterprise networks
  • Experience of working in regulated change management environments based on ITIL principles

What can we offer you?

  • Hybrid Working
  • Private Medical Insurance or Company Paid Health Cash Plan
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • 25 days holidays plus your birthday off
  • Option to purchase additional holiday (up to 5 days)
  • Company Pension Scheme
  • Life Assurance x 4
  • A diverse workforce
  • Employee investment with Node4 training Academy
  • Family savings and shopping discounts through the Node4 benefits portal.
  • Discounted Gym Membership
  • Modern facilities with open and welcoming breakout areas
  • Company Social events
  • Never ending supply of hot and cold drinks, biscuits, sweets, and fruit

Why join Node4?

Founded in 2004, Node4 has experienced exceptional growth and success over the years. From an office in Derby to locations nationwide. From three people to a workforce of over 1,200. We believe that our people are the driving force behind our success. We are a vibrant, passionate, and diverse team committed to providing exceptional service as standard. We are proud of our employees and the environment that reflects our core business values of Passion, Innovation, and Trust.

Node4 is the place to be if you are passionate about technology and providing exceptional service while developing your career within a welcoming and evolving company.

TAKE A LOOK AT OUR STORY

title: Building Engineer
description:
We’re AtkinsRéalis, a world-leading design, engineering, and project management organization. We connect people, data, and technology to transform the world’s infrastructure and energy systems.

Our Project & Programme Services team are proud to deliver on some of the most prestigious construction projects across the world. It's thanks to our talented people and their diverse thinking, expertise and knowledge. Join us and you'll be part of our genuinely collaborative environment, where everyone is supported to make the most of their talents and expertise.

When it comes to work-life balance, AtkinsRéalis is a great place to be. So, let's discuss how our flexible and remote working policies can support your priorities. We're passionate about are work while valuing each other equally. So, ask us about some of our recent pledges for Women's Equality and being a 'Disability Confident' and 'Inclusive Employer.

AtkinsRéalis is one of the world’s leading project and cost management consultancies operating at the forefront of the transport, property and industry sectors. Placing great emphasis on the training, development and progression of our staff, we’re dedicated to providing high quality professional services with cutting-edge expertise. Join us and you’ll benefit from a development programme designed to ensure your career objectives are met in full.

As part of our continuous expansion in the UK market we are looking for an enthusiastic and highly motivated Mechanical Building Services Design Engineer to join the Building Surveying team, to consolidate and grow our Building Surveying and Building Services Engineering offering in Nottinghamshire and across surrounding regions.

The individual will work closely with the Managing M&E Engineer and existing teams to support the offering of M&E design and surveying services.

You will be able to demonstrate experience of working within consultancy teams and MUST possess demonstrable skills in the following areas:

  • Ability to produce Building Services related Mechanical design information, in the form of design calculations, drawings and specifications, whilst demonstrating sound working knowledge and a methodical approach.

  • Good organisation and time management skills, with ability to prioritise workload in accordance with project milestones.

  • Ability to analyse and consider all relevant information including wider design team information and project milestones, constraints and budgets.

  • Awareness and diligence in carrying out site surveys.

  • Confidence and acumen to represent M+E department at client/design team meetings.

Requirements:

  • HNC in relevant Building Services Engineering subject.

  • CIBSE/IET Membership is preferable, with desire and motivation to work towards professional accreditation.

  • Experience of using industry standard software, including Microsoft Office, AutoCAD and Hevacomp/IES, to produce drawings and design calculations.

  • The ability to demonstrate a highly motivated, pro-active approach to work matters.

  • Full UK Driving Licence.

Responsibilities:

  • Prepare design calculations utilising both industry standard software and spreadsheets.

  • Produce tender documentation to include drawings, specifications, risk assessments and pricing schedules.

  • Carry out site surveys and complete feasibility reports and budget costs.

  • Represent M+E department at client/design team meetings, answering queries and recording minutes.

  • Understand and work in accordance with regulations, standards and guidance, including Building Regulations and CIBSE guides.

  • Maintain service quality standards and a culture of continuous improvement and constructive expertise.

  • Participate in relevant internal/external training initiatives.

  • Keep abreast of industry issues and developments in best practice, in particular focussing on Net Zero initiatives and low carbon technologies.

  • Communicate and interact with others coherently, in accordance with the organisation's values.

This role has excellent prospects for an individual who has a strong ambition to progress and enjoys working collaboratively within a vibrant team. As well as technical competence, we are looking for someone with the ability to think laterally, who possesses first class communication skills, has good commercial awareness and who will assist in providing an exemplary service to our Clients.

Why work for AtkinsRéalis?

Join our Project & Programme Services team and expand your career on some of the industry's most exciting and newsworthy construction projects – from Sizewell C to the world's tallest hotel, London's Heathrow Airport to Europe's first eco-friendly mosque. You'll enjoy invaluable exposure to international expertise as well as innovation in local niche areas. Communities are at the heart of our work and our people are proud to be working towards a Net Zero Carbon future and regenerating cities across the UK.

https://careers.atkinsrealis.com/csr

AtkinsRéalis is committed to developing its people both personally and professionally. Our colleagues have the advantage of access to a high ranging training portfolio and development activities designed to help make the best of individual’s abilities and talents. We also actively support staff in achieving corporate membership of relevant institutions.

https://careers.atkinsrealis.com/

Meeting your needs:

To help you get the most out of life in and outside of work, we offer employees "Total Reward." It's a package that can be tailored to your changing lifestyle, career and personal needs.

Making sure you're supported is important to us. So, if you identify as having a disability, tell us ahead of your interview, and we’ll discuss any adjustments you might need.

New name, new era. We are AtkinsRéalis. It will take some time for all our information to update – you can still refer to our fantastic benefits via the link below.

https://yourrewarduk.snclavalin.com/

Additional Information:

This role may require security clearance and offers of employment will be dependent on obtaining the relevant level of clearance. If this is necessary, it will be discussed with you at interview. The vetting process is delivered by United Kingdom Security Vetting (UKSV) and may require candidates to provide proof of residency in the UK of 5 years or longer. If applying to this role please do not make reference to (in conversation) or include in your application or CV, details of any current or previously held security clearance.

We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community - a place where we can all be ourselves, thrive and develop. To help embed inclusion for all, from day one, we offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from different backgrounds. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.

Learn more.

Link: https://careers.atkinsrealis.com/equality-diversity-and-inclusion-uk-europe

title: Civil Engineer
description:
Who we are:
Avove is a leading infrastructure services and engineering company at the heart of modern Britain designing, maintaining and transforming utility infrastructure. We deliver projects holistically, adopting a concept to commissioning methodology, and in doing so have the capability to undertake projects of great technical complexity by leveraging a broad range of services, capabilities and experience to deliver them with a clear focus on client’s operational needs and stakeholder requirements.
We work closely with our clients to help protect and improve their assets, enhance customer experience and protect the natural environment. Everything we do is designed to drive continual improvement and provide piece of mind. The piece of mind that is built upon years of successful outcomes, a broad portfolio of related work, industry leading expertise, and a commitment to sustainability and innovation.
We are actively building for the future today, giving our customers the high-quality assets they need to meet their future challenges. We keep clean water flowing through Britain’s taps, provide safe sewerage facilities and install infrastructure for Water Companies and Housing Developers across the UK. We do this efficiently, safely and without fuss, while protecting the environment along the way.

The Role:
The Avove Design team is recruiting for Civil Engineers with an interest in Water/Wastewater Engineering to work in our dedicated Design and Construct (D&C) teams currently delivering an expanding workload for our Clients on a number of D&C frameworks throughout the UK.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a multidisciplinary team on a wide variety of projects covering all aspects of Wastewater and Water networks, and treatment facilities through the project lifestyle from feasibility design through detailed design to construction.
The positions will be based in our Eurocentral office and will involve a mixture of hybrid working. You will have the opportunity to work on both challenging and exciting projects of a technical nature designing excellent services and solutions for our wide client base by assisting the team in all relevant projects and activities to meet Avove and client objectives and needs. Working as part of a team, you will acquire a portfolio of technical knowledge and transferable skills that will give you a wide choice of careers options.

Responsibilities:
  • Implement the project requirements to fully meet the client specification in accordance with relevant standards
  • Undertake any work of a technical nature that falls within ability and competence
  • Be confident to work under minimum supervision and competent to check the work of others and supervise less experienced or junior staff
  • Carry out site visits and surveys and inspections
  • Prepare and check feasibility studies, inspection, assessment and technical reports and other written documents in an appropriate format ensuring compliance with Avove procedures
  • Comply with the requirements of the Avove Integrated Management System including Health & Safety, Environmental and all other appropriate regulations
  • Prepare/check design approach, calculations, drawings and documents
  • Keep up to date with industry best practice and where appropriate apply best practice within the team environment
  • Qualifications:
  • Degree qualified, and Chartered or Incorporated Engineer (CEng/ IEng through ICE, or relevant equivalent professional qualification) or approaching achieving relevant professional qualification having completed the necessary training requirements.
Individuals with qualifications that do not fully match the above criteria but have the relevant equivalent experience are invited to apply.

Skills & Experience:
  • Computer literate and conversant with MS Office suite and relevant engineering software packages
  • Demonstrable experience in Water / Wastewater Engineering preferable
  • Good written and oral communication and organisational skills and to produce reports in clear concise English
  • Desire to develop existing skills and acquire new technical competences to enhance personal and team capability
  • Proven ability to work within a team environment with a dedicated approach to meet project deadlines
  • Client focused approach to service delivery
  • Proven enthusiasm to embrace and participate in career development initiatives
  • Full Driving Licence
Benefits:
We offer a competitive salary that is based on proven skills and experience. Hard work is celebrated and rewarded. We recognise that one size doesn’t fit all so everyone has access to a variety of flexible benefits that work for you.
  • Min. 24 days holiday plus statutory holidays (option to buy more)
  • Company pension scheme
  • Life assurance
  • A selection of lifestyle benefit options
  • Financial wellbeing programme
  • Employee assistance program for health and wellbeing and onsite mental health first aiders to support our colleagues
  • We love to give back so we offer you volunteering days in your community and charity matched giving where we will boost your fundraising
Our main value is to “Move Life Forward” and we are committed to developing our colleagues and encouraging personal growth, in conjunction with a flexible working approach so everyone can thrive in an inclusive and open environment.

We encourage you to apply for this role as soon as you can. We recognise talent waits for no one, so we progress candidates independently through all stages of recruitment process.

title: Engineer
description:
Summary

Job Reference:
219822BR

Store Service Centre, Nottingham

Permanent

42 hours per week

Our application process


Our Boots Store Service Centre is home to one of the largest dynamic picking systems in the world, and we have an exciting opportunity for a maintenance engineer to join the team to maintain our automation, ensuring we can fulfil our commitment to our customers.

Our Engineering team provide a full PPM, breakdown response, repair and continuous improvement service to all Logistics Warehousing facilities. These include automated pallet and tote box cranes, lifts, transfer cars and an extensive network of conveyor systems.

The shift pattern is 3-2-2, 12 hour rotating days/nights (often known as a ‘panama’ shift pattern), working across Monday-Sunday.

ABOUT THE ROLE

  • Reporting into an engineering shift leader, you will work in a team of 7, providing engineering cover across multiple (linked) automated logistics facilities
  • To be accountable for providing a full Planned Preventative Maintenance, breakdown response, repair and continuous improvement function to all Logistics Warehousing facilities
  • Working largely unsupervised, directly accountable for ensuring all Materials Handling Equipment and facilities achieve availability expectations to aid the warehouse deliver the optimum service at the optimum cost
  • To use expertise, experience and professionalism to make strong well informed decisions to prioritise tasks, always striving to ensure customer requirements are satisfied
  • The job holder works within the Engineering team and works collaboratively with the Engineering Management, Improvement Engineers, first line fixer Managers, Control Room and Operational teams
  • Work will be within the guidelines and constraints of all company, legislative and safety criteria
  • Continue to drive the warehouse on our No1 for Customer Care journey
  • Ensuring all Preventive Maintenance, Inspections & repairs are completed within set deadlines
  • Ensure world class standards in the warehouse (Security, Health and Safety, Regulatory compliance & Housekeeping)
  • Development of strong relationships with key stakeholders to ensure service is meeting expectations and ensuring the engineering team is providing world class standards of service to our customers
  • Ensures the completion of accurate shift / breakdown reports. Raise CI initiatives to improve equipment availability

WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO HAVE
  • Minimum Level 3 qualification in a relevant engineering discipline
  • Ability to promote innovation across all working areas
  • Effective communication skills
  • Highly motivated with the ability to motivate others
  • Experience in a similar electro/mechanical engineering field
  • Ability to work at height
  • Right first time approach to all works, striving to work efficiently with a strong desire for quality and pro-activeness

IT WOULD BE GREAT IF YOU ALSO HAVE

Additional experience in some of the following areas would be an advantage: Automation, risk assessments, continuous improvements, maintenance planning, Microsoft office

OUR BENEFITS

  • Boots Retirement Savings Plan
  • Generous employee discount plus enhanced discounts for Boots brands, Boots Opticians and Boots Hearingcare
  • Excellent onsite facilities including staff shop, opticians (including free eye tests for team members), gym, cafeteria, outdoor seating spaces

We have a great range of benefits in addition to the above that go beyond salary and offer flexibility to suit you;(all rewards and benefits are subject to change and eligibility).

WHY BOOTS

We're always looking for people who care; people who go the extra mile to change things for the better. You'll be joining a company that is evolving and always looking to improve. We foster a working environment where consideration and inclusivity help everyone to be themselves and reach their full potential. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, passionate about embracing the diversity of our colleagues and providing a positive and inclusive working environment for all. As the heart of everything we do at Boots, it's with you, we can change for the better.

WHAT’S NEXT?

Closing Date: 12th May 2023

We are always open to discussing possible flexible working options and what this may look like for you, including job share and reduced hours. If you require additional support as part of the application and interview process, we are happy to provide reasonable adjustments to enable you to be at your best.

title: Test Lead
description:
Our client is a leading UK driverless vehicle and mobility company expanding internationally and on a mission to find the very best people to be part of our success and join the driverless revolution that will disrupt and transform the world of transport. They are recruiting a Test Lead for its Autonomous Vehicles R&D Team.

You will work with other team members to solve and integrate work from 3 different continents (Europe, Australia and Asia). The team is very diverse and always looks for people with high quality and good grasping of different domains in robotics and outside robotics. Team always urges You to design and give your opinion and request inquisitive, creative minds to solve our challenges.

Job Roles:

Work closely with our research, test, and robotics engineers to create simulation systems and visualization tools.

Develop functional tests for each component in the software/hardware.

Develop Regression tests for multiple scenarios either from simulation data or real life collected data, to test the integration of a new software or hardware feature.

Advance current CI/CD tests in Github.

Document, review and maintain high-standard code.

Develop relevant tests for the interfaces from the supporting system to the vehicle (e.g., visualization server) and design metrics to measure performance.

Carry out VIL, HIL, SIL tests.

Document, review and maintain high quality test reports for live vehicle testing.

Essential Requirements:

Solid theoretical background in the Software best practices and coding standards.

Solid theoretical background in the different test architectures.

BSc degree in Computer Science, Robotics or related field.

Experience with ROS/ROS2, Autonomous vehicles

Strong skill in modern C/C++, unit tests and software engineer best practices for different test protocols. Python is an extra but not required.

Experience developing shell/bash scripts.

1+ years of industry experience writing production-quality, performance-critical code, and maintaining large codebases is desired

Nice to have requirements:

MSc in Computer Science, Robotics or related field

Experience working with vehicle interfaces, including CAN or Ethernet network

Experience in testing autonomous systems in real-world scenarios (ideally in Autonomous Vehicles but any other filed is acceptable)

Experience working with one or more Machine learning algorithms that can create new test conditions using the limited available datasets.

Experience with FMEA analysis.

In return, they offer a great package that includes training, development, succession planning, a structured career path and a healthy bonus related to hitting key personal and company milestones.

If joining a growing cutting-edge technology organisation with great prospects in an emerging £billion sector and working with a brilliant motivated team appeals to you, please apply with an up-to-date CV as soon as possible, along with your availability and your salary expectations.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme
  • Performance bonus

  • What would be the relevant experience/ qualification for this role?
  • Current/Previous salary?
  • Expected Salary?
  • How soon can you join?

  • Driving Licence (preferred)

  • United Kingdom (preferred)

  • Coventry (preferred)

  • Coventry: Relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: System Engineer
description:
Our client is a leading UK driverless vehicle and mobility company expanding internationally and, on a mission, to find the very best people to be part of our success and join the driverless revolution that will disrupt and transform the world of transport. Due to year-on-year growth they are recruiting an experienced Lead Embedded Systems Engineer.

Responsibilities:

  • Development of embedded software guidelines and processes for safety critical embedded systems.
  • Interfacing with other teams to merge hardware, software, sensors, and controls.
  • Contributing to architectural development of designs including safety critical elements.
  • Managing of repositories and distribution/management for in-field updates and manufacturing changes related to embedded software.
  • Managing the update process of in-field hardware including bootloader design, integration with higher level systems, and security.
  • Verification and validation of embedded software.
  • In-person debug and testing of electromechanical designs.

Skills:

  • Experience leading a team in embedded development practices.
  • Demonstrated excellence in object-oriented programming with C++.
  • Experience with automotive embedded system hard- and software.
  • Experience with real-time operating systems, micro-controllers, and their standard peripheral components.
  • Knowledge of automotive vehicle communication networks, such as CAN, CAN-FD, Ethernet, LIN
  • Knowledge of automotive engineering best practice including 26262
  • Knowledge of embedded software architectures and software patterns
  • Strong documentation and communication
  • Technical team leadership
  • A passion for cooperative test-driven software development

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor/master’s degree in electrical engineering or computer Science, robotics, or related field
  • Passionate about self-driving vehicles and robotics
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Experience with standard embedded development practices
  • Experience with safety critical design/systems

Nice to Have:

  • 6+ years of experience
  • Understanding of DDS frameworks like ROS/ROS2 or other networking middleware
  • Experience with actuators and sensors of varying types
  • Robotics/autonomous experience is a plus.
  • Experience working with oscilloscope, logic analyzer, power supplies, and function generator.
  • Experience leading a team of embedded developers or managing the embedded software on a multidisciplinary team.

In return, you will get a great package that includes training, development, succession planning, a structured career path and a healthy bonus related to hitting key personal and company milestones.

If joining a growing cutting-edge technology organisation with great prospects in an emerging £billion sector and working with a brilliant, motivated team appeals to you, please apply with an up-to-date CV as soon as possible, along with your availability and your salary expectations.

Reference ID: ICAV-LESE-21-12-2023

title: Customer Engineer
description:
Job Introduction

This primary purpose of the role is to supply TGW customers with a quality technical hotline service. Ensure all requests are logged within the ticket system, ownership is taken until closure and a professional service is provided at all times.

Other secondary tasks will include but not limited to:

  • WCS module testing
  • Training delivery to LTS Engineers
  • PLC code testing and writing to support U&E business
Main Responsibilities
  • Be the go to technical expert for any PLC related issues on a range of sites across Europe and the US
  • Provide 24hr * 7 day cover on a rotated shift pattern
  • Offer professional telephone support to customers both internal and external
  • Manage the hotline ticket system for IT, Facilities and Controls
  • Work on ongoing issues to reduce the volume of calls.
  • To provide effective communication to senior management and support colleagues.
  • Maintain support desk documentation.
  • Monitor trends and action plans to prevent issue escalation.
  • Escalate problems to the next support level where required and continue to manage the problem until resolved.
  • Review and identify common issues raised from reports that need remedial action, either through PLC / WCS teams or additional site training
  • Undertake testing of WCS modules in support of the WCS team when required
  • Facilitate the remote monitoring of key accounts control systems
  • Attend sites during support office hours as required to support project works and training.
  • Facilitate the monitoring of hardware for upgrades such as firmware and also highlight any obsolescence to the U&E team.
About You
  • Extensive Control system experience / knowledge (PLC, IT, Drives, Networks)
  • Materials handling / Automation experience either as a controls engineer or an electrically biased maintenance engineer
  • Experience of IT systems support
  • Experience dealing directly with customers / end users
  • Excellent communications skills
  • Ability to work as part of a team
  • Flexible to travel throughout TGW NE as required
  • Electrical engineering qualification
We Offer

We offer a flexible working environment, and you will receive a competitive salary plus access to our comprehensive benefits package, including annual holiday entitlement with the option to buy or sell more, a health cash plan, a contributory pension scheme, life assurance and free use of onsite gym including weekly classes!

Training and career development also are a key part of the culture at TGW; therefore, you'll have access to training resources internally and externally from day one.

title: Integration Engineer
description:
Our client is a leading UK driverless vehicle and mobility company expanding internationally and, on a mission, to find the very best people to be part of our success and join the driverless revolution that will disrupt and transform the world of transport. Due to year on year growth they are recruiting an experienced Mechanical Integration Team Lead.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage a diverse team of vehicle integration engineers to help May achieve and realise a robust and successful vehicle autonomous system.
  • Troubleshoot autonomous vehicle system hardware and software issues to maintain system operation and rectify problems.
  • Assisting and advising technicians on proper installation and maintenance of required embedded and electrical systems.
  • Work with the design and development engineers throughout the engineering organisation to ensure the relevant subsystems are designed with appropriate requirements, interfaces, and interactions to achieve specific vehicle functions.
  • Learn about all aspects of our vehicle to support effective integration and troubleshooting of autonomous vehicle system components.
  • Collect and analyse autonomous vehicle system data to quickly improve system performance.
  • Understand interfaces between the vehicle platform, actuators, vehicle software, and communication networks.
  • Developing and performing tests to validate subsystems through functional testing.
  • Test the embedded software developed for an autonomous vehicle.

Skills:

  • Design work from initial concept through to production.
  • Exposure to a range of production processes and materials.
  • Experience with new product development and introduction.
  • Expertise in CAD Design from concept to manufacture.
  • CAD software: Catia, NX, SolidWorks, AutoCAD, Inventor, Mechanical Desktop.
  • Conducted technical presentations with CAD & MS PowerPoint.
  • Rapid Prototyping & Additive Manufacturing using a range of techniques.
  • Functional and Aesthetic prototypes.
  • Running projects with the key focus on quality, client requirements, budget, and delivery.
  • Managed and supported design, manufacturing, product research and development.

Nice to have:

  • BS/MS degree in Mechatronics, Mechanical, Computer or Electrical Engineering or proof of exceptional skills in related fields.
  • Exceptional ability to keep multiple projects moving forwards in parallel.
  • Proven ability to use programming to solve challenging problems and increase own/team’s efficiency through automation.
  • Experience with C or C++ required. Candidates must have strong comprehension but need not be fluent.
  • Experience with Python desired
  • Ability to fluently interpret system data to gain a full understanding of logged events.
  • Thorough understanding of mechanical fundamentals - and ability to apply them to automotive concepts.
  • Understanding of low voltage and high voltage circuits and how to debug them.
  • Experience with CAN and Vector CAN tools is a plus.
  • Experience with Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA) and Hazard Analysis and Risk Assessment (HARA) is a plus.

In return, you will get a great package that includes training, development, succession planning, a structured career path and a healthy bonus related to hitting key personal and company milestones.

If joining a growing cutting-edge technology organisation with great prospects in an emerging £billion sector and working with a brilliant, motivated team appeals to you, please apply with an up-to-date CV as soon as possible, along with your availability and your salary expectations.
