Permanent - Full Time

Location

Derby

Job Function

Managed Services

title: Network Operations Technician
description:
Description


You will be part of a team of NOC Engineers running a responsive and proactive 24x7 NOC function (Role is in hours only), constantly improving and reviewing monitoring to reduce preventable incidents and escalating alerts raised where required, assigning to the appropriate teams.

Reporting directly to the Infrastructure Ops Manager as part of a newly created team, you will be key to the running of a fast-paced monitoring and incident process troubleshooting and resolving incidents as quickly as possible with minimal downtime and impact.

Key Responsibilities


  • Configure and manage the monitoring of all the Data Centres, Cloud Infrastructure, Networking, associated systems and applications across the ParentPay Group.
  • Working in partnership with the Infrastructure Ops, Infrastructure Engineering, IT support, Application Ops, and Development teams to ensure all monitored systems are kept up to date and monitored as requested.
  • Work with the Service Ops Delivery teams to ensure that Monitoring and alerting is represented from the outset of any new system or service.
  • Create dashboards, reports and alerts for improved visibility of monitored systems by the whole business.
  • Maintain the monitoring software continually working on keeping alerts, modules and custom alerting up to date.
  • Analyse events, perform troubleshooting and incident response on the related systems communicating with relevant teams or third parties responsible for managing the systems for quick alert resolution.
  • Adhere to all internal processes (change/incident/problem etc) as set out by the IT Service Manager.
  • Regularly review our monitoring systems and attend training courses offered by our monitoring partners.
  • Maintain and create detailed documentation of monitoring systems and processes.
  • Work with the wider Service Ops team to feed in data for capacity management processes.
  • Automate where possible fixes and workarounds reducing human input.
  • Monitor the ParentPay Group custom applications in detail. Ensuring critical stats are provided to the wider business as required
  • Working with the rest of the Service Ops team tracking and documenting all alerts and resolutions in detail through a designated ITSM system.

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise


  • Configuration of on premise monitoring and alerting of cloud solutions.
  • Experience with multiple monitoring and alerting systems including Logic Monitor, PRTG, Solarwinds, Pager duty or similar.
  • Experience configuring and monitoring networking systems via SSH, SNMP v2 and v3
  • Experience working with custom/bespoke software applications.
  • Experience with Windows Server systems and WMI monitoring.
  • Excellent communication Skills.
  • Ability to manage and prioritise your own workloads.

About ParentPay Group

ParentPay Group brings together eleven brands that drive development in EdTech. As Europe's largest EdTech provider, we help primary and secondary schools streamline their cashless payments, improve their parent engagement, safely manage meals and securely store their data. Fundamentally, we create time for learning.

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
Nottingham Trent House (95002), United Kingdom, Nottingham, Nottinghamshire

End User Support Engineer

About this role

Capital One is looking for an experienced 2nd Line Desktop Support Engineer to be part of our End User Services team based in Nottingham.

As part of the End User Services team you will be supporting 2000+ Users based in the UK.

What you’ll do

  • Work in an established EUS team to provide technical support for end-users, including hardware and software support for Windows and Mac laptops, mobile devices and peripherals.
  • Be the 'face of IT' working in our modern Tech Bar and delivering great customer service. Supporting colleagues who drop in with their end user devices. Identifying repeat issues and investigating root cause analysis
  • Provide support for onboarding, offboarding and provisioning of new equipment using AutoPilot, Intune, SCCM and Jamf
  • Provisioning mobile devices through ABM and Intune and Airwatch as well as supporting iOS and Android.
  • Ensuring completion of Incidents, Requests and Tasks using Service Now whilst adhering to agreed SLA’s.
  • Respond to user requests for service, troubleshoot problems and take appropriate ownership of tickets that have been assigned to you.
  • Assist with maintaining asset management within Service Now
  • Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams across our Enterprise and work closely with teams across different locations to identify and address IT-related issues or improvements.
  • Support Google Suite including Gmail and Calendaring, Zoom and Slack.
  • Enhancing knowledge within the team by documenting tasks, resolution procedures, known errors

What we’re looking for

  • A strong track record of working in an SLA-driven support role
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex IT issues efficiently.
  • Good knowledge across a range of technology platforms, including SCCM/MECM, Active Directory, Group Policy,, Google Workspaces, Jamf and Mobile Device Management (MDM) Systems particularly Airwatch, Intune and Autopilot.
  • Proficiency in troubleshooting Microsoft Windows 10/11 and macOS devices.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and are able to work under pressure, multi-task and manage priorities.
  • Methodical and disciplined approach to problem solving and is always looking to prevent rather than just fix issues
  • Experience of ITIL Service Management practices and a solid understanding of Incident Management and Service Request Management
  • A good understanding of network principles and experience in troubleshooting TCP/IP, LAN, WAN, WLAN, VPN and Proxies/PAC.
  • Understanding of Security technologies such as Anti-Virus, Anti-Malware, Encryption and MFA Technologies
  • Familiarity with Audio Visual IT equipment and systems
  • Knowledge of packaging and scripting technologies for both MAC and Windows environments (JAMF, SCCM, Powershell, Intune)
  • Familiarity with Atlassian/Jira and Confluence

Where and how you'll work

This is a permanent position and will be based in our Nottingham office.

Our hybrid working model offers you the flexibility to work from our offices and from home, when you need to.

We're big on collaboration and connection, and so generally encourage our associates to use our offices on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays.

However, due to the nature of this team's work Monday and Friday office presence is required on a rota basis.

Many of our associates have flexible working arrangements, and we're open to talking about an arrangement that works for you.

What’s in it for you

  • We offer high performers strong and diverse career progression, investing heavily in developing great people through our Capital One University training programmes (and appropriate external providers)
  • Immediate access to our core benefits including pension scheme, bonus, generous holiday entitlement and private medical insurance – with flexible benefits available including season-ticket loans, cycle to work scheme and enhanced parental leave
  • Open-plan workspaces and facilities designed to inspire and support you. Our Nottingham head-office has a fully-serviced gym, subsidised restaurant, mindfulness and music rooms. In London, you can heighten your mood with a run on our rooftop running track or an espresso at the Workshop Coffee café


What you should know about how we recruit

We are committed to creating a level playing field and seek to create teams that are representative of our customers and the communities we serve. We’d love to hear from you if you identify with a typically under-represented group in our industry and are particularly keen to hear from women and ethnic minority candidates.

We pride ourselves on hiring the best people, not the same people. Building diverse and inclusive teams is the right thing to do and the smart thing to do. We want to work with top talent: whoever you are, whatever you look like, wherever you come from. We know it’s about what you do, not just what you say. That’s why we make our recruitment process fair and accessible. And we offer benefits that attract people at all ages and stages.

We also partner with organisations including the Women in Finance and Race At Work Charters, Stonewall and upReach to find people from every walk of life and help them thrive with us. We have a whole host of internal networks and support groups you could be involved in, to name a few:

  • REACH – Race Equality and Culture Heritage group focuses on representation, retention and engagement for associates from minority ethnic groups and allies
  • OutFront – to provide LGBTQ+ support for all associates
  • Mind Your Mind – signposting support and promoting positive mental wellbeing for all
  • Women in Tech – promoting an inclusive environment in tech
  • EmpowHER - network of female associates and allies focusing on developing future leaders, particularly for female talent in our industry

Capital One is committed to diversity in the workplace.

If you require a reasonable adjustment, please contact ukrecruitment@capitalone.com All information will be kept confidential and will only be used for the purpose of applying a reasonable adjustment.

For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com

Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.

Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).


Who We Are

At Capital One, we're building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

title: Apprentice
description:
Job Description:

Start date: September 2024

Location: Broughton

Duration: 38 months

Application closing date : We encourage you to apply early to avoid missing out on this opportunity! Please note we will close adverts as soon as we receive sufficient applications.

Benefits

Salary: 17,069 (starting salary)

35 hours per week // Working days or double day shift pattern // Holiday entitlement plus bank holidays // Pension // Success share // Plus many more flexible benefits!

About us

Airbus is a global pioneer in the aerospace industry, operating in the Commercial Aircraft, Helicopters, Defence and Space sectors. Airbus is a leader in designing, manufacturing and delivering aerospace products, services and solutions to customers on a worldwide scale.

With over 125,000 employees and as the largest aeronautics and space company in Europe and a worldwide leader, Airbus is at the forefront of the aviation industry. During your apprenticeship you will work alongside our experienced engineers and quality team to support you to complete the work safely and efficiently

As the global center of excellence, we manufacture and deliver over 500 wing sets per year for the A320 family, A330 and A350 . That is why at Airbus, we have carefully designed our apprenticeship programmes to give you valuable hands-on practical training while you complete your academic studies to set you up for success. Our programmes provide a clear route for you to make your career fly. So join us and let us help you soar towards an exciting career in the world of Aviation.

What you will be doing

As a C raft Aerostructures apprentice you will have the opportunity to combine hands-on technical experience in the workplace whilst completing your academic studies to gain valuable qualifications and competencies to work on live aircraft. You will also have the opportunity to join our Gen A support network who provide support and additional events and opportunities for all Early careers participants.

The 38 months apprenticeship consists of:

Year One : You will spend the first 12 months of your apprenticeship based at Coleg Cambria , Deeside, working towards obtaining:

  • NVQ Level 2 diploma in Performing Engineering Operations;
  • City and Guild 2675 Level 2 in In Machining
  • Level 2 Essential Skills;

This will allow you to develop the necessary skills, knowledge and experience to enable you to make an immediate contribution when you enter the workforce in the second year.

Year 2 and 3: Time to put your learning to action!

  • You will be based at Airbus’s Broughton (North Wales) site, working within the wing production areas on 6 monthly rotations , gaining experience in different areas;
  • You will assist in manufacturing the wings for our Single Aisle and Wide body families by assisting operations in work packages to manufacture these wings. This will include: setting of templates and jigs, drilling, bolting, final fitting and assembly of the wing box components (spars, stringers, ribs, pylons, wing skins etc);
  • The tasks will be varied and require you to use different skills in order to complete them successfully.
  • Additionally there may be the opportunity for some of you to transfer over to our systems apprenticeship where you will work on the installation and testing of the Aircraft flying controls, fuel and electrical systems.

You will also attend college on day release, working towards gaining:

  • Level 3 NVQ Extended Diploma (Aeronautical Engineering);
  • Advanced Manufacturing Engineering BTEC L3 certificate Essential skills.

On completion of your 38 months apprenticeship you will become a skilled aircraft fitter, working on the drill off and assembly of both metallic and composite components to produce the wing box structure on our world class Airbus aircraft and if successful you will receive a certificate of modern apprenticeship!

Requirements

In order to be eligible to this apprenticeship you must:

Achieve a minimum of 5 GCSEs including:

  • Grade C or 4 in Maths
  • Grade C or 4 in English Language
  • Grade CC or 44 in Double Award Science OR Grade C/4 in Single award in Physics.
  • Plus 2 other GCSEs at grade C or 4 (other qualifications that are equivalent or higher may be considered as an alternative to the additional 2 GCSE’s)

To be a successful candidate you need to:

  • Have a passion for learning, enjoy hands-on, teamwork and problem solving activities
  • Include your CV stating your predicted or achieved grades in your application;
  • Include your Cover Letter stating your motivation for this role in your application.

Important Information:

GRADES: Please note for all applicants your offer will be conditional until we receive evidence of the required grades prior to the 31st August 2024 , and in addition completing all pre-employment appointments and online forms.

RIGHT TO WORK IN THE UK: Candidates must have current legal authorization to work in the United Kingdom. For more information, please check the Government Website.

Contact

Please let us know if you need us to make any adjustments. Examples of this may include (but is not exclusive to) accessible facilities; additional time for written exercises; auxiliary aids; room layout; dietary requirements etc. If you wish to discuss this further please contact: erecruiting@airbus.com. Any information disclosed will be treated in the strictest confidence.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Airbus Operations Limited

Employment Type:

Apprenticeship

-

Experience Level:

Entry Level

Job Family:

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

title: Project Engineer
description:
ARE YOU READY TO REINVENT MOBILITY?

JOIN US AT EDAG AND BE PART OF OUR AGILE AND INTERNATIONAL TEAM

Together, we deal with tomorrow's questions and shape the mobility of the future! New technologies, mobility concepts and standards such as artificial intelligence (AI), car sharing, and smart factory offer our industry so many opportunities.

Working together, growing together, creating new things together: EDAG connects people and the future. Company and workforce share the same vision. You'll go your own way in your career at a high level, nationally or internationally.

High competence and a passion for new challenges are what make our Electrics/Electronics division a signpost towards the automotive future.

Requirements

Job Description

As a Connectivity Engineer you will support and liaise with cross-functional teams to ensure the quality and performance of Telematics and Connectivity components and systems. You will also plan, monitor, and execute development of hardware and software requirements to guarantee on-time project delivery.

This includes development, implementation and testing of requirements throughout the V Cycle. They are also able to perform functional and diagnostic testing of the electronic control units (ECUs). Additionally, industry best practices and trends should be employed during the development process. This includes adherence to UNECE Regulations and Standards which should be followed to ensure successful homologation (UNR144, 155 & 156 etc.).


Technical Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in automotive, electrical engineering or an equivalent qualification
  • Good overall vehicle E/E systems knowledge
  • Experience in Automotive Lifecycle, Product Delivery and technical problem solving
  • Knowledge of automotive vehicle systems and architectures
  • Familiar with Application Software development and network communication protocols (CAN, LIN, FlexRay)
  • Knowledge of Industry standards and regulations such as ISO 21434, UNECE R144, R155 & R156, ISO26262 and ISO14229 (UDS).
  • Understanding of eCall requirements and implementation
  • Knowledge of OTA, Remote diagnostics and other connected topics
  • Understanding of communication protocols such as WiFi 802.11, 4G LTE, 5G etc.
  • Experience in the field of software development for ECUs, specifically for telematics and infotainment systems
  • Knowledge of Software stacks, Microsar, MISRA C is a plus.
  • Experience with requirements management tools (Polarion, Doors, etc.)


Soft Skills

  • Communicating with, advising, and supporting our customers and internal development teams
  • Support and liaise with cross-functional teams to deliver leading vehicle components
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken). German knowledge is advantageous.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to write clear, concise technical documentation and reports
  • Creative and brave to achieve ambitious company goals
  • A cooperative problem-solver who works well with others
  • Deadline-oriented and independent working style

Benefits

  • Private Healthcare Plan
  • Pension Plans
  • Hybrid working
  • Core office hours 9-3pm (40 hours per week working time)
  • Training & Development
  • 25 days annual leave + BH
  • Generous Absence cover

title: Shafts Tunnels Associate Nottingham
description:
Specification

Purpose

BSP Consulting has a vacancy for an Associate Civil/Structural Engineer/Engineering Geologist in Nottingham.

The initial appointment is at Associate level, however it is envisaged that within five years the successful candidate will be leading the Shafts and Tunnelling Section as an Associate Director.

The successful candidate will be based in our Nottingham office, to help expand and develop the existing Shafts and Tunnelling team.

The candidate should have experience of acting as Designers Geotechnical Advisor on projects dealing with National Highways, and ideally would have some experience of working on Network Rail Projects.

The candidate will therefore be a Chartered Engineer with a minimum of 10 years experience of shafts and tunnelling work.

In addition, the candidate should be able to demonstrate experience of leading and running a team.

Responsibilities

To transition into the head of the shafts and tunnelling section at BSP, responsible to the Managing Director.

Experience

Chartered Engineer with a minimum of 10 years experience of shafts and tunnelling work.

Personal attributes

Personal attributes are important to BSP Consulting and the successful candidate will need to possess a strong team work ethic.

We value honesty and integrity both within the team and with our clients.

We value our staff and encourage and assist staff members to achieve professional qualifications. We support and encourage our staff in their personal development on their journey to become the best they can be.

Education

The successful Senior Structural Engineer Nottingham candidate will need to possess strong analytical skills be qualified to Bachelor or Master degree level.

In addition the successful candidate will be, computer literate, being fully competent in the use of Word and Excel and be experienced in the use of AutoCAD.

BSP Consulting is an Equal Opportunities Employer. See the values section of our website for a copy of the policy.

Details:
Location: 12 Oxford Street, Nottingham

Hours of work: 37.5 hours per week, from 9.00am-4.00pm, Monday to Friday with 30 minutes lunch.

Holidays: Allowance is in line with industry standard and is subject to relevant experience.

Salary: A competitive salary will be offered and is subject to relevant experience.

If you think you could become a valuable member of our team, we would welcome hearing from you.

You can apply for the Shafts Tunnels Associate Nottingham, by E-mailing your CV and covering letter to

E: k.smith@bsp-consulting.co.uk

or by sending it to:

Katie Smith
BSP Consulting
12 Oxford Street
Nottingham
NG1 5BG

Take a look at other vacancies we currently have available:
Careers

If you are interested in learning more about a career in engineering take a look at the ICE website, the home of civil engineering:
https://www.ice.org.uk/


Salary: £60k
Location: Nottingham

Skills

Required

  • Technical excellence in the design of Pipe Jacking, Auger Boring and HDD design experience
  • Technical excellence in the design of shafts, timber headings, thrust walls
  • Working as DGA for National Highways approvals
  • Excellent communicative skills
  • Team leader and team player

Desired

  • Management experience
  • Temporary works design experience

title: Senior Engineer
description:
Senior Engineer

(Job Number: 00739)


Outline of the role


As a Senior Engineer you will be managing site engineers, reviewing construction information, and assisting the site management teams with all aspects of health, safety and environmental management. You’ll also liaise closely with the Engineering and Integration team to ensure work is carried out in line with specifications and drawings.


As a Senior Engineer you will be responsible for:

  • Provide information to enable the commercial team to review and interrogate sub-contractor analysis


  • Report any deviances from survey to project/contracts manager


  • Implement and monitor all systems and procedures and ensure effective operation


  • Ensure effective communication to all parties


  • Utilise company ICT systems currently in place


  • Maintain awareness of Farrans health and safety requirements and standards


  • Proactively keep up to date with the current and changing status of the project


  • Maintain comprehensive and accurate records for archive


  • Input into site activities where appropriate and required


  • Offer support and advise on problem areas


  • Proactively contribute to effective teamwork


  • Identify training and development needs of self, and others as identified


  • Support training and development needs of others


  • Provide technical advice and support


  • Maintain a professional Farrans relationship throughout and be a reliable point of contact on engineering issues


  • Improve on and develop customer relationships


  • Ensure effective communication with relevant parties


  • Promote and present a professional Farrans image to the supplier in all dealings


  • Monitor and report on supplier performance


  • Build effective relationships to establish two-way dialogue


  • Ensure a working environment exists which encourages teamwork


  • Influence and support suppliers to innovate and achieve optimum solutions


  • Provide key information for the commercial team on re-measures and claims


  • Monitor labour and sub-contractor activity


  • Involvement in method statement approval and monitoring compliance


  • Build strong working relationships with the Engineering team and sub-contractors


  • Assist in managing systems to enable the progress of work to be reviewed against time, quality, dimensions, and quantity


  • Assist in the recording and testing of workmanship and materials, i.e., drainage, concrete, piling, brickwork etc


  • Provide engineering support to ensure technical problems are overcome and technical queries are answered


  • Regularly check the setting out points and benchmarks and checking that all setting out instruments and measuring equipment are delivered to site with a calibration certificate and recorded accordingly


  • Responsible for setting out works constructed within allowable tolerances


  • Responsible for providing and maintaining setting out and dimensional control, to ensure accurate construction of the work


  • Ensures workforce understand setting out information has been identified as suitable for the type of work being carried out


  • Take a proactive approach to managing Health and Safety on site


  • Co-ordinate and supervise temporary works as required


  • Implement a regime of test and inspection plans for all works on site


  • Willing to work nights if required


What we can offer you


Joining one the of leading construction and civil engineering contractors you will be provided with the opportunity to deliver on projects that play an important role in the everyday lives of people in the UK and Ireland. Our employees are at the core of everything we do, with this in mind we have our own in-house Learning & Development division who can offer you bespoke career toolkits & pathways.


In addition to a competitive base salary, we can also offer a wide range of benefits, some of the key ones being:


  • Car allowance
  • Payment of an annual professional membership
  • Contributory pensions plan up to 6%
  • Share Scheme opportunities available
  • Employee Referral Scheme
  • Enhanced Maternity & Family friendly policies
  • Health Shield (Medical & Dental Cover included)
  • 34 days annual leave (inclusive of bank holidays)
  • Cycle to work Scheme
  • Living away from home allowance*

  • For certain roles we offer living away from home allowance, this depends on site and location and can be amended throughout your contract. We are here to make this as seamless as possible, therefore we cover all accommodation costs, provide you with a daily allowance and cover travels costs (as set out in our living away from home policy)

Your required Skills and Experience


  • Educated to degree standard in Civil Engineering or equivalent
  • Technical knowledge of construction and best practices
  • An appropriate and valid CSCS / CSR card
  • Sound knowledge of engineering
  • Sound knowledge of latest building regulations, legislation and Health and Safety
  • Working knowledge in Microsoft Office packages
  • Good communication skills (verbal and written) and able to engage with all stakeholders at all levels
  • Excellent attention to detail and meticulous planning and organizational skills

Diversity & Inclusion


We believe there is power in being different. Every day, our people express their unique voices and draw from their rich experiences to bring fresh ideas to our company. There is no question that an inclusive and diverse workforce drives innovation, and it also makes us stronger as a team. Therefore, we are committed to fostering inclusion and diversity in the workplace; one that welcomes people from all backgrounds. No applicant or employee will receive less favourable treatment because of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership and pregnancy or maternity. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment and selection process is inclusive and accessible.


About Farrans


Farrans Construction is a leading building and civil engineering contractor with over 80 years’ experience of delivering world- class projects across the UK and Ireland. The company, which employs more than 650 people, has offices in Belfast, London, Cambridge and Edinburgh, with further site offices connecting its regional network.

Making a positive difference to the communities in which we operate is our passion and we place social responsibility at the heart of every scheme. We build, we transform, and we connect. Our people are at the core of everything we do. Our culture is one which fuels innovation, transparency, and inclusivity.


Primary Location UK -Nottinghamshire-Nottingham-HE A52 Nottingham Junctions
Employee Status Permanent
Schedule Full-time
: Ongoing

title: Transport Planner
description:
Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our innovation hubs across the globe will enable you to share ideas and best practices while growing your professional network. Wherever you are in your career journey, you will benefit from working with world-class engineers, scientists, and technical specialists.


Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®.


Your role:


We are looking for a Principal Transport Planner to help with the expanding workload of our Midlands transport team based in Leicester.

We offer a challenging and rewarding career working for a leading transport consultancy with a strong presence in the Midlands. You will join a growing team delivering a wide variety of interesting projects for clients in the private and public sectors.


Responsibilities:


You will work on and manage the preparation of transport assessments, travel plans and other development-related transport reports. The role requires somebody with experience in project management, client liaison, work winning and mentoring junior staff. Your work will involve:


  • Understanding client requirements for development-related transport planning
  • Client liaison and preparing fee proposals
  • Project management
  • Producing transport assessments and travel plans
  • Analysing, collating and interpreting transport data
  • Ensuring work is delivered on time and within budget
  • Attending internal and external client and team meetings
  • Undertaking site visits
  • Providing technical advice to support junior colleagues
  • Helping to develop and mentor junior team members

You will be required to undertake your work with a high degree of diligence and quality in line with Tetra Tech’s quality assurance processes. You will need to be well organised and able to manage your time effectively to meet project deadlines.

Professional Development

The role presents an excellent opportunity to progress your career and work within a successful team on a wide range of exciting transport planning projects.

About you:


We are looking for an enthusiastic and versatile individual with experience working in the industry that should ideally include:

  • A good understanding of the UK planning process and how your work fits into that
  • Knowledge of highway design principles relevant to site access design
  • An understanding of the capabilities of AutoCAD and GIS software
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel
  • Experience of using software packages such as TRICS, Junctions 9 and LinSIG
  • Previous UK work experience
  • Experience of developing and maintaining client relationships

Requirements:


Above all, we are looking for someone with the following qualities:

  • Drive to succeed and a willingness to get involved
  • Excellent communication skills, confidence to liaise with clients and team members
  • Methodical approach to problem solving and excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to produce clear, precise and coherent analysis, reports and drawings
  • Ability to work collaboratively as part of a multi-disciplinary team
  • Knowledge of the application of transport modelling software

Preferred qualifications:


Degree or Masters in a relevant subject (e.g. transport planning, civil engineering, geography)

Professional Accreditation, such as MCIHT, MTPS, MCILT


About Tetra Tech:


Tetra Tech is a leading provider of high-end consulting and engineering services for projects worldwide. We combine the resources of a global, multibillion dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 400 locations around the world. We are Leading with Science® to provide sustainable and resilient solutions for our clients.

At Tetra Tech, we provide a collaborative environment that supports individual performance, innovation, and creativity. We are proud to offer competitive compensation and benefits. Learn more by visiting www.tetratecheurope.com/careers

For more information on our company, please visit our website at www.tetratecheurope.com. To apply, please submit your CV and cover letter on the Careers section of our website.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Tetra Tech is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, transgender status, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity / shared parental leave.

We are very happy to discuss flexible working for this role, including the possibility of reduced hours, flexible start and finish times, or compressed hours. We can offer a range of solutions to help you to get the most out of your work / life balance.

Our culture at Tetra Tech encourages and embraces the differences that make each of us unique - we are hiring you for you, so be yourself!

title: Help Desk Analyst
description:
• Answer incoming support calls via email, telephone calls or website ticket and accurately identify, diagnose and prioritise the required actions.
  • Enter technical problems, causes and solutions within our helpdesk software.
  • Contact the customer/end user to provide troubleshooting help and advice.
  • Track changes, monitor success and feedback to the customer and record actions in the helpdesk software.
  • Keep mindful of timescales, impact and scale of problems to ensure the customer is kept informed at all times.
  • Diagnose desktop/laptop/network/server/storage/Virtual Server hardware and software issues by using our managed service software, agents and asking accurate, concise questions in a professional and timely manner.
  • Seek help and support for more complex or persistent problems to your team mates, team leaders and management personnel as needed or just because you would like a second pair of eyes.
  • Make recommendations to others within PCS on how best to action needs within a customer’s environment.
  • SLA’s are key to providing exceptional support so responding to them in an agreed way is paramount.
  • Keep accurate records, record your steps and update both people and our software.
  • Provide help and support to an Outstanding level.

APPLY NOW

At PCS, we are always on the lookout for amazing people who share our passion and vision. If you are excited by the idea of joining our team, please complete a form and tell us what makes you a perfect match for us. Don’t forget to attach your CV and send it to us by email. We can’t wait to hear from you!

title: Electronics Engineer
description:
Sectors: Electronics, Manufacturing, Utilities
Job title: Electronics Design Engineer
Job Type: Permanent
Location: Leicestershire (East Midlands)
Salary: £50,000 - £75,000 per annum
Contract Hourly Rate: £40-55 an hour, DOE

Company overview & Job Title:
A small but very unique and exciting expert engineering company based in Leicestershire (East Midlands) who specialise in the Utilities Industry is experiencing an incredibly exciting phase in the development of company’s products in which they’re now seeking to recruit and hire for a brand new Electronics Design Engineer to join the company. This is company is also happy and open to hire a contract Electronics Design Engineer.

Benefits Package - Share Options + 32 Days Holiday + 8% Employer Pension + Career Progression

Salary on offer, hourly rate and work from home policy:
The salary on offer for the successful permanent Electronics Design Engineer is £50,000 - £75,000 per annum, depending on skillset and experience. Contract hourly rate will be £40-£55 an hour, DOE. This role is very hand’s on and will mean the Electronics Design Engineer will need to work onsite 5 days a week and it’s very rewarding.

Summary of the Electronics Design Engineering role:
The Electronics Design Engineer will take overall technical ownership for the development of the hardware and microcontroller based products and technology within the business. This Electronics Design Engineering role will suit a candidate that is subject matter with expertise within the electronics and microcontroller field coupled with the drive and passion to deliver solutions necessary for the delivery of this fascinating engineering system.

Electronics Design Engineer Key Skills:
  • Degree, HND or suitable experience in relevant field for Electronics Engineering
  • 5+ years industry experience
  • Experience within the full product design lifecycle – start to finish
  • Electronics Circuit Design (analogue & digital)
  • PCB Design & Schematic Capture
  • Experience of bringing up a full PCB Board - start to finish
  • Highly proficient bring-up of hardware designs on appropriate types of prototype boards using commercially available modules such as Arduino
  • Embedded C, C++ - Bonus
  • Network interfaces – SPI, I2C, USB, UART
  • Experience of Microcontrollers – STM, PIC, ARM Processors, ATMEL
  • Experience in prototype (circuit) design build and testing.
  • Practical skills - Prototype testing, debugging, soldering, system fault finding
  • Experience with A to D and D to A converters; interfacing analogue and digital circuits. Signal conditioning. Analogue front-end circuitry design prior to digitalisation.

If you are interested in the above exciting Electronics Design Engineering position and think you have the skills required as an Electronics Design Engineer to join a small successful company and progress well, please don’t hesitate to apply and contact Frank Kanjanda on fkanjanda@pg-rec.com or call 01217961888 for information.

Not for you but know someone who may be interested? We do offer up to £500 upon placement of successful referrals!

For more information about this role please apply, or email Frank Kanjanda on fkanjanda@pg-rec.com who will be able to provide more details on the opportunity.

Many thanks, Premier Group

title: Design Engineer
description:
About the role


Own your career, and you can build something to be proud of at Balfour Beatty. By joining our Rail team as a Design Engineer, you’ll work with true experts who’ll share their knowledge and provide support, encouragement and invaluable feedback so you never stop learning. Bring us your capability, and we’ll help you take it much, much further.


What you'll be doing


As a Design Engineer, you will have the following accountabilities:

  • Development and implementation of Power Systems Traction design proposals ensuring they meet client requirements including budget constraints, presenting proposals for approval to the client. The design should deliver:
  • Quality within affordable parameters
  • Ease of maintenance, energy efficient with minimum environmental impact
  • Innovation to meet client goals and positive impact on the local community
  • Responsible for the design and delivery of design and assurance on one or more project(s), ensuring compliance with latest standards, project technical work scope and the relevant Company processes.
  • Ensure effective control of project design to meet client requirements, within budget and programme constraints utilizing established, appropriate Company processes and techniques
  • Provide advice and guidance on the technical compliance of the design proposals to the design teams
  • Proactively contribute to the Risk and Value Management process
  • Development of the design deliverables programme:
  • Attend gate reviews activities to ensure appropriate that they are timely and appropriate sign off is achieved at each project gate.
  • Attend the co-ordination and production of design data, bid deliverables, reports and documentation essential to the programme and contractual requirements
  • Ensure that contracted work is suitably designed, assured and certified by qualified persons
  • Responsible for project design approvals, providing guidance and direction on any varying circumstances and ensure that effective and detailed records are maintained to support claims.
  • Ensure that programme commitments are being met, and take action to establish priorities and deal with problems regarding timescales, when required
  • Provide effective reporting on design status and key design issues
  • Undertake designated role duties within rail projects

Who we're looking for


You will have the following:

  • The individual will ideally have previous relevant experience in AC and DC power design with Network Rail and/or London Underground experience preferred. Good interpersonal and communication skills are required, coupled with an ability to form effective relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.
  • The individual should have a desire to continuously pursue innovation and development, with a focus on the customer and the Major Projects business.
  • A degree (or equivalent) in an Electrical discipline is required and professional membership of IET is desirable.
  • Understanding of customer relationship management processes
  • Ability to clearly and concisely communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Able to implement and drive performance improvement using lean tools, KPIs and visual management

Why work for us


Day in, day out, our teams deliver amazing projects in challenging conditions; developing, managing and maintaining the vital infrastructure and public spaces that modern economies, societies and communities rely on.


About us


Our Rail business has an extensive legacy of rail expertise. Our teams safely deliver complex projects, from consultancy and design to all aspects of construction and maintenance. Using advanced plant and machinery, and unique innovations, we provide end-to-end solutions for our customers.

Our aim is to improve the passenger’s experience, and our teams create better journeys by increasing network capacity, improving reliability, and making our railways more efficient and sustainable.

At Balfour Beatty we are committed to creating a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture where everyone can be themselves and reach their full potential, not only because this is the right thing to do, but because it makes us a better business. To ensure we deliver on this commitment, we have a UK Diversity and Inclusion Action Plan which sets out the wide range of targeted, proactive, measurable steps we are taking to make this a reality. You can read our UK Diversity and Inclusion Action Plan in full at www.balfourbeatty.com/value_everyone

To help and support us with our desired commitment to create an inclusive culture we are members of WISE, enei, Business Disability Forum and Women into Construction. In 2020, we signed the Audeliss and Involve Open Letter to demonstrate our commitment to taking key long term and sustainable actions on Black Inclusion. Balfour Beatty is also a Gold Award holder in the Ministry of Defence 'Employer Recognition Scheme' and actively encourage applications from Armed Forces personnel, veterans and reservists.

As a Disability Confident Employer, we are committed to working with people who have disabilities and long-term health conditions to remove barriers for them in obtaining employment. We are also committed to offering applicants with a disability an interview if they meet the minimum requirements for the role.

Further information on Disability Confident can be found at: https://disabilityconfident.campaign.gov.uk/

title: Network Operations Technician
description:
Role: NOC Engineer

Location: Rugby, Remote

Contract: 6 Months

Pay Rate: Competitive Daily Rate

Clearance: SC Clearance


SC Cleared NOC Engineer required to deliver support for two Data Centre. The role will involve delivering Network Service Requests, Incident resolution, and Change execution for the Data Centre's network environments.


Key Skills:

Network technologies such as routing/switching, firewalls, load balancers, and proxies that underpin multiple data centres.

Experience working with alerting and monitoring tools such as CISCO DNA-C, Prime, Nagios etc.

Experience working with any ITSM tool such as Service Now.

ITILv3/ITIL4 certified or recent relevant experience working in ITIL controlled environment.


Essential Responsibilities:

Operational support of Network environments across two UK Data Centres.

Follow and promote change control processes to ensure compliance and protect service.

Document and control Standard Operating Procedure (SOP's) for IT processes.


Desirable:

Demonstrate technical understanding of Architecture, Infrastructure, and service management.

Experience with Packet Analysis.

Experience with Load Balancers and proxy.

Experience in network tools such as DNA Centre/Infoblox/Prime.

SoC Experience and some understanding of WAF and Firewall logs etc.

Quickly able to technically analyses, diagnose, and resolve technical operational incidents and requests.


Minorities, women, LGBTQ+ candidates, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Interviews will take place this week so please apply immediately to be considered for this exciting contract role or call Bangura Solutions to discuss this role further.

title: Sustainability Engineer
description:
Date: Feb 11, 2024
Location: Burton On Trent, GB
Company: MolsonCoors_UK
Requisition ID: 28186
Why You Should Join Us

For over two centuries, Molson Coors has been bringing people together over a cold beer, but today, our modern portfolio of award-winning brands extends beyond beer to meet the evolving tastes and preferences of our consumers.
With a presence in over 100 countries and a team of 16,000 talented employees globally, we take pride in our traditions, brands and the role we play in uniting people to celebrate all life’s moments.

As one of the world’s leading beverage companies, we are passionate about promoting responsible drinking and creating a sustainable future.

In addition to popular favourites like Coors, Carling and Doom Bar, our beverage portfolio includes Aspall, Staropramen, Madrí Excepcional, Blue Moon, Pravha, Cobra and Cobra Zero, Rekorderlig, Doom Bar 0.0% to name but a few.
As a People First organisation, we’re happy to discuss flexible working options.

Your Purpose

We’re now looking to recruit a Sustainability Engineer to join our brilliant Supply Chain Team.

The role is responsible for leading and overseeing the development and implementation of strategies, technologies, and initiatives to achieve net-zero carbon emissions at the site level.

This role involves analysing energy consumption, carbon emissions, and sustainability practices and collaborating with cross-functional teams to design and execute plans to reduce carbon footprint. The Net Zero Technical Lead may also engage with stakeholders, evaluate emerging technologies, and ensure compliance with environmental regulations.

Strong expertise in renewable energy, energy efficiency, and sustainable practices is essential for success in this role.

This role requires communicating with the site leadership team and the wider supply chain excellence team. Key internal stakeholders OLT and Site Leadership Team. Key external stakeholders are suppliers and industry networks.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the execution of strategies to achieve net-zero carbon emissions at specific site level.
  • Conduct thorough analyses of energy consumption, carbon emissions, and sustainability practices to identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including engineering, operations, finance, and sustainability to design and implement initiatives that reduce carbon footprint at specific site level.
  • Monitor and report progress towards net-zero goals, providing regular updates to senior management and stakeholders, site level.
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to carbon reduction and sustainability.
  • Evaluate and recommend the adoption of emerging technologies, renewable energy sources, and energy-efficient practices to optimise operations and reduce environmental impact.
  • Develop and manage the Ne Zero site specific budget, ensuring proper allocation of resources for initiatives, projects, and ongoing monitoring.
  • Develop and deliver training programs and awareness campaigns to educate site based employees, stakeholders, and the community about Net Zero principles, practices, and benefits.
  • Lead and participate in educational and awareness-building initiatives to promote a culture of Net Zero within production site.

About You

You may not meet all the criteria for the role, but don't let that stop you from applying. We all need to learn and develop and here at Molson Coors we can help you do this.

  • Strong understanding of energy consumption, carbon accounting, and environmental impact assessment.
  • Proven track record of developing and implementing successful carbon reduction strategies and initiatives.
  • Expertise in renewable energy technologies, energy efficiency measures, and sustainable practices.
  • Excellent project management
  • Experience in setting Utilties investment and optimisation strategy for production sites.
  • Strong commercial awareness and experienced in UK Engineering Contracts, specifically JCT and MF1.
  • Strong Contractor Health and Safety management skills;

About Us

  • We’re one of the UK’s Most Attractive Employers winning the Top Employer award for the last 10 years
  • Flexible work programmes to ensure a work life balance is maintained such as our market leading Moments That Matter for significant moments in your life.
  • Commitment to the physical and mental wellbeing of all our people. We are proud to have been awarded Gold in Mind’s Workplace Wellbeing Awards.
  • We’re committed to raising industry standards and leaving a positive imprint on our employees, consumers, communities and the environment which is reflected in Our Beer Print and our 2025 sustainability targets.
Molson Coors Beverage Company: Building Careers

Molson Coors Beverage Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we seek diversity. We want to continue to create an environment where our people are truly able to be themselves at work, regardless of their gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation or religion. We want people to be able to bring their own creativity and style to work, so that we get diversity in our thinking across our organisation, as we believe that we are a better business for it.

This makes our talent strategy simple – we want the best talent in all our roles, regardless of their background. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew and our people are our greatest asset.

title: Security Engineer
description:
Quest Global is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the world’s fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility.

We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers.

As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we’re eager to hear from you.

The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek, have the following characteristics and skills:


Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Project Engineering "IT Network Communication" for HVDC control & protection systems (LAN/ WAN Communication, Time synchronization, remote access, telecommunication (Design of the IT network infrastructure for control & protection equipment utilized in HVDC plants to ensure reliable communication between the various automation devices, integration of process devices and subsystems in the network).

    Creation and maintenance of project specific technical specifications, documents & manuals. Clarification of communication concepts with internal departments and external suppliers and customers.

    Configuration of communication components (router, switch, firewall, masterclock, etc.) under consideration of IT- security requirements

    System integration and commissioning of the various components in the test field in Erlangen (Verification of proper communication between the various components, IT-Security, time synchronization, redundancy, etc.) Conduct/ support Factory Acceptance Tests with sub suppliers and customers

    Technical support during commissioning phases

    Project Engineering "IT Security" for HVDC control & protection systems (Development & Implementation of IT - security concepts based on international standards for control systems of HVDC plants)

    Plan and conduct project-specific IT-security audits, threat-risk workshops and penetration tests incl. evaluation of counter - measures

    System integration and commissioning of the specific components (e.g. firewalls) in the test field in Erlangen (Verification of proper rule settings and hardening measures) Conduct/ support Factory Acceptance Tests with sub suppliers and customers

Required Skills (Technical Competency):

  • Degree in electrical engineering, automation technology or network / communication technology

    Several years of work experience in the area of networks for control systems, IT-security for industrial networks (Requirements, Plan/ conduct audits, etc.)

    Creation and maintenance of project specific technical specifications, documents & manuals. Clarification of communication concepts with internal departments and external suppliers and customers.

    Understanding for SCADA systems as part of energy transmission system (Substations, etc.)

    Technical english
    Creation and maintenance of project specific technical specifications, documents & manuals. Clarification of communication concepts with internal departments and external suppliers and customers.

Desired Skills:

  • Good communication in English (oral & written) & Interpersonal skills
  • Customer focus - ability to build and develop customer & supplier relationships
  • Organisational agility
  • Problem solving ability
  • Logical thinking
  • Effective time management
  • Results driven outlook

DISCLAIMER: Due to the nature of work candidates should be UK citizen/ EU Citizen/ Valid work permit holder. For further information contact us on: career_uk@quest-global.com

Job Type

Full Time-Regular

Experience Level

Senior Level

Total Years of Exp

6 - 9

title: Geotechnical Engineer
description:
Our client is an engineering consultancy renowned for delivering complex and innovative design solutions to the global construction industry. Their people make their business a success and so they invest in your development and wellbeing providing an environment that supports you at whatever career level you are at.

They believe that there is more to a job than work. They encourage a healthy work/life balance through a wide range of social activity groups. They’re great fun and a chance to expand your professional and social networks. They also offer the opportunity of a hybrid work model where you can split your working week between the office and your home

You will need to have a strong design background and be able to work within a team environment, supporting the design delivery of existing projects and the growth of the existing client base. Previous experience and knowledge of the regional Civil Engineering market is desirable.

The Role

  • Design delivery of the geotechnical elements of existing and future projects
  • Co-ordinate with other engineers both in the regional offices and between groups
  • Prepare fee budgets, proposals and resource requirements for projects.
  • Prepare calculations, drawings and other documents and ensuring these are controlled during the execution of projects.
  • Support less experienced staff, sharing knowledge and acting as a coach or mentor.

What you need to succeed:

  • Meng / BEng in Civil Engineering or similar
  • Chartered Engineer or working toward

title: Engineer
description:
Req ID:432035

At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 74,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.


Appointment Basis: Permanent

Location: Derby, DE24 8AD


Could you be the full-time Railway Dynamics Engineer in Derby we’re looking for?

Your future role


Take on a new challenge and apply your project/ offer development expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You’ll report to Anthony Chesshire (Head of Dynamics, Derby) and work alongside inspiring and dedicated teammates.


You'll participate in project/offer development through the application of internal procedures, instructions and guidelines of the domain and has to be operative on the advanced simulations or co-simulations activities.


Day-to-day, you’ll work closely with teams across the business for Complex MBS calculations, requiring interdisciplinary approach: flexible bodies, safety to cross wind, Wear and Rolling Contact Fatigue, Fatigue loads definition; Complex MBS/Simulink co-calculations, requiring interdisciplinary approach: active and semi-active suspensions, tilting system, drive line, other active systems such as steering, levelling systems, and much more.


You’ll specifically take care of analysis and interpretation of tests results (indoor and on track tests), R&D activities related to Core Competency Network (CCN) action plan and in collaborative projects, but also Domain R&D management and development of simulation methodologies and new technologies applied in Alstom Transport (RSC-TGS-TLS).


We’ll look to you for:

  • To apply the Railway Dynamics Instructions and Guidelines in carrying-out the Pre-Project, Project or R&D tasks
  • To perform the Railway Dynamics system Technical Specification analysis (Customers, Platform, etc), and prepare Clause-by-Clause analysis.
  • GAP Analysis for the Railway Dynamics domain between the indicated solution (RSAD), in terms of Tech spec. requests, Design Data and Normative, and the reference solution
  • To support the OWNER to define and write Railway Dynamics Management Plan and TRS (including both Integrator site and Components/Bogie site tasks)
  • Highlights any missing data or other missing inputs.
  • RISK analysis on the assumptions (in case of missing data) for the Project, Pre-Project.
  • Prepare the Matrix of tasks and BGT necessary, considering all phases of the project (including the support for the certification and acceptance phase)
  • Carry-out the standard Railway Dynamics simulations for the Pre-Project and Projects
  • Carry-out the activities related to BMS and CBM, in collaboration with system engineering
  • To lead and manage R&D actions in the context of simulation methodologies in the domain, including the management of the resources involved and respect of QCD targets
  • Provide Support to burning issues on on-going projects or revenue service
  • Accounts for the final result towards the OWNER.
  • Reports to the OWNER whether any criticality or problems come out from his activities
  • Support Chief engineer métier and CCN leader with continuous REX to improve the relevant methodologies/guidelines
  • Support the function in the development and deployment of the new processes and new technologies
  • Support for updating and/or developing of Metier instructions

All about you


We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:

  • Mechanical Engineering degree (MSc) or equivalent.
  • 5+ years of experience in a Railway Dynamics departments in industry sector or R&D research in the railway dynamics and Mechatronics domain.
  • Very good knowledge of the MultiBody System (Simpack, VAMPIRE or Other)
  • Very good knowledge of mechanical vibrations, Track-vehicle system and impact on dynamics behavior; knowledge on train system engineering.
  • Knowledge of mechanical design and calculation, in particular on bogie mechanical and suspension components such as : primary and secondary suspensions ; elastic elements and dampers; Finite Elements theory, System Engineering process.
  • Advanced knowledge in modelling and control of active systems in Matlab/SIMULINK
  • Knowledge of sensors used in Mechatronics and Railway Dynamics (Bogie Monitoring System, Condition Based Monitoring, etc)
  • Railway Dynamics International Standards knowledge
  • English conversational/writing/reading advanced level mandatory

On a more personal level, you will also need to be:

  • Good management skills to lead R&D actions with a transversal approach
  • Good communication skills, pro-activity, team working, strategic vision

Things you’ll enjoy

Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:

  • Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
  • Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
  • Contribute to innovative projects
  • Utilise our collaborative, cross-site and cross-discipline working environment
  • Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
  • Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
  • Progress towards Senior Expert recognition within the Railway Dynamics CCN
  • Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive benefits (pension, life ins., medical, + anything specific to the site e.g. free on-site parking, canteen etc).

#LI-COM1


You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!


Important to note

As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 70+ countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

At Alstom we will consider requests for flexible working on hiring. Many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, flexible start and finish times, job sharing, or compressed hours. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you need.

Alstom U.K. is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. We aim to have a welcoming and inclusive environment for individuals, of different ages, genders, ethnicities, disability, LGBT, religion and/or belief.

As a 'Disability Confident' employer, we will interview all disabled job applicants who match the essential criteria of the job description or specification: if you require any reasonable adjustments, please let us know.



Job Segment: Research

title: Structural Engineer
description:
Req ID:433566

At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

Appointment Basis: Permanent

Location: Derby, Litchurch Lane


Could you be the full-time Bogie Structures Engineer in Derby we’re looking for?


Your future role


Take on a new challenge and apply your existing structural expertise in a challenging and diverse field. You’ll report to the Bogies Head of structures in Derby and work alongside experienced and friendly teammates as well becoming part of the wider global engineering and structures community.


You'll undertake structural assessments (using both manual and Finite Element methods) on rail vehicle bogies. Day-to-day, you’ll work closely with teams across the business on both new design projects, the assessment of existing products and much more.


You’ll specifically take care of carrying out structural analysis, and the development of the designs to meet the structural and functional requirements of the products.


We’ll look to you for:

  • Planning structural calculation activities considering applicable standards, processes and specific customer requirements.
  • Deriving load cases for different bogie components
  • Finite Element Calculations, Linear and non-linear
  • FE model setup, conducting the analysis, evaluating the results, modifying designs and writing the reports,
  • Communicating the progress and results to the Project teams
  • General Mechanical Engineering design and problem solving
  • Writing specifications & presiding over test programmes
  • Evaluating supplier calculations & test results
  • Managing work undertaken by other sites and sub-contractors
  • Work within allocated budget & schedule whilst maintaining the required quality of deliverables
  • Participate in the creation of new processes and standards for the company and wider rail industry
  • Performing quotation for engineering work packages as requested

All about you


We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:

  • Bachelor or master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or a similar related degree
  • 3+ years’ experience in the Rail vehicle industry or similar related industries
  • Experience of Finite Element analysis packages, such as Hyperworks, Ansys, Patran/Nastran, Ideas, Abacus, including both linear and non-linear assessments
  • Previous experience in using CAD packages such as CATIA or Pro Engineer is desirable
  • Understanding of Structural Mechanics and the fundamentals of fatigue assessment and bolt calculation methods
  • Demonstrable practical experience in Mechanical Engineering outside of the role of structural mechanics, such as design, dynamics or testing is desirable
  • Willingness to develop a wide range of skills and flexibility to work on variety of projects which require different engineering skills
  • Ability to define and manage priorities within deadlines
  • Willingness to travel to visit other Alstom sites, suppliers and customers.
  • English operational in reading/writing and technical meetings

On a more personal level, you will also need to be:

  • Self-motivated with a desire to learn new processes and skills
  • Good communication and presentation skills
  • A strong team player, with effective interpersonal skills and a positive, solution-oriented attitude

Things you’ll enjoy

Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:

  • Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
  • Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
  • Contribute to innovative projects
  • Utilise and contribute to our evolving working environment
  • Progress towards formal recognition as a structural expert, creating effective relationships within the structural community across the globe
  • Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
  • Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
  • Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive benefits (pension, life insurance, medical and anything specific to the site location e.g. free on-site parking, canteen etc).

#LI-COM1

You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!


Important to note

As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 70+ countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

At Alstom we will consider requests for flexible working on hiring. Many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, flexible start and finish times, job sharing, or compressed hours. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you need.

Alstom U.K. is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. We aim to have a welcoming and inclusive environment for individuals, of different ages, genders, ethnicities, disability, LGBT, religion and/or belief.
